ï»¿ FAR FROM [THE MADDING CROWD]418-the madding crowd by [Thomas Hardy]142-thomas hardy , 1874 From the Penguin edition , 1978 CHAPTER I DESCRIPTION OF [FARMER OAK]143-farmer oak - AN INCIDENT When [Farmer Oak]143-farmer oak smiled , the corners of [his]143-farmer oak mouth spread till they were within an unimportant distance of [his]143-farmer oak ears , [his]143-farmer oak eyes were reduced to chinks , and diverging wrinkles appeared round them , extending upon [his]143-farmer oak countenance like the rays in a rudimentary sketch of the rising sun . [His]143-farmer oak Christian name was [Gabriel]144-gabriel , and on working days [he]143-farmer oak was [a young man of sound judgment , easy motions , proper dress , and general good character]419-a young man of sound judgment , easy motions , proper dress , and general good character . On Sundays [he]143-farmer oak was [a man of misty views , rather given to postponing]420-a man of misty views , rather given to postponing , and hampered by [his]143-farmer oak best clothes and umbrella : upon the whole , one who felt [himself]143-farmer oak to occupy morally that vast middle space of Laodicean neutrality which lay between [the Communion people of [the parish]422-the parish]421-the communion people of the parish and [the drunken section]423-the drunken section , - that is , [he]143-farmer oak went to [church]424-church , but yawned privately by the time [the con- gegation]425-the con- gegation reached the Nicene creed,- and thought of what there would be for dinner when [he]143-farmer oak meant to be listening to the sermon . Or , to state [his]143-farmer oak character as it stood in the scale of public opinion , when [[his]143-farmer oak friends]426-his friends and [critics]427-critics were in tantrums , [he]143-farmer oak was considered rather [a bad man]428-a bad man ; when [they]429-they were pleased , [he]143-farmer oak was rather [a good man]430-a good man ; when [they]429-they were neither , [he]143-farmer oak was [a man whose moral colour was a kind of pepper - and - salt mixture]431-a man whose moral colour was a kind of pepper - and - salt mixture . Since [he]143-farmer oak lived six times as many working - days as Sundays , [Oak]144-gabriel 's appearance in [his]143-farmer oak old clothes was most peculiarly [his]143-farmer oak own - the mental picture formed by [[his]143-farmer oak neighbours]432-his neighbours in imagining [him]143-farmer oak being always dressed in that way . [He]144-gabriel wore a low - crowned felt hat , spread out at the base by tight jamming upon the head for security in high winds , and a coat like [Dr. Johnson]145-dr. johnson 's ; [his]144-gabriel lower extremities being encased in ordinary leather leggings and boots emphatically large , affording to each foot [a roomy apartment so constructed that [any wearer]434-any wearer might stand in [a river]435-a river all day long and know nothing of damp]433-a roomy apartment so constructed that any wearer might stand in a river all day long and know nothing of damp - [[their]434-any wearer maker]436-their maker being [a conscientious man who endeavoured to compensate for any weakness in [his]144-gabriel cut by unstinted dimension and solidity]437-a conscientious man who endeavoured to compensate for any weakness in his cut by unstinted dimension and solidity . [Mr. Oak]146-mr. oak carried about [him]144-gabriel , by way of watch,- what may be called a small silver clock ; in other words , it was a watch as to shape and intention , and a small clock as to size . This instrument being several years older than [[Oak]146-mr. oak 's grandfather]438-oak 's grandfather , had the peculiarity of going either too fast or not at all . The smaller of its hands , too , occasionally slipped round on the pivot , and thus , though the minutes were told with precision , [nobody]439-nobody could be quite certain of the hour they belonged to . The stopping peculiarity of [his]144-gabriel watch [Oak]146-mr. oak remedied by thumps and shakes , and [he]146-mr. oak escaped any evil consequences from the other two defects by constant comparisons with and observations of the sun and stars , and by pressing [his]146-mr. oak face close to the glass of [[his]146-mr. oak neighbours]432-his neighbours ' windows , till [he]146-mr. oak could discern the hour marked by [the green - faced timekeepers within]441-the green - faced timekeepers within . It may be mentioned that [Oak]146-mr. oak 's fob being difficult of access , by reason of its somewhat high situation in the waistband of [his]146-mr. oak trousers which also lay at a remote height under [his]146-mr. oak waistcoat , the watch was as a necessity pulled out by throwing the body to one side , compressing the mouth and face to a mere mass of ruddy flesh on account of the exertion , and drawing up the watch by its chain , like a bucket from a well . But [some thoughtfull persons , who had seen [him]146-mr. oak walking across one of [[his]146-mr. oak fields]443-his fields]442-some thoughtfull persons , who had seen him walking across one of his fields on a certain December morning - sunny and exceedingly mild - might have regarded [Gabriel Oak]144-gabriel in other aspects than these . In [his]146-mr. oak face one might notice that many of the hues and curves of youth had tarried on to manhood : there even remained in [his]146-mr. oak remoter crannies some relics of [the boy]444-the boy . [His]146-mr. oak height and breadth would have been sufficient to make [his]146-mr. oak presence imposing , had they been exhibited with due consideration . But there is a way [some men]445-some men have , [rural and urban]446-rural and urban alike , for which the mind is more responsible than flesh and sinew : it is a way of curtail- ing [their]445-some men dimensions by [their]445-some men manner of showing [them]445-some men . And from a quiet modesty that would have become a vestal which seemed continually to impress upon [him]146-mr. oak that [he]146-mr. oak had no great claim on [[the world]447-the world 's room]448-the world 's room , [Oak]144-gabriel walked unassumingly and with a faintly perceptible bend , yet distinct from a bowing of the shoulders . This may be said to be a defect in [an individual]449-an individual if [he]146-mr. oak depends for [his]146-mr. oak valuation more upon [his]146-mr. oak appearance than upon [his]146-mr. oak capacity to wear well , which [Oak]144-gabriel did not . [He]144-gabriel had just reached the time of life at which " young "[144-gabriel] is ceasing to be the prefix of " [man]3450-man "[144-gabriel] in speaking of one . [He]144-gabriel was at the brightest period of masculine growth , for [his]144-gabriel intellect and [his]144-gabriel emotions were clearly separated : [he]144-gabriel had passed the time during which the influence of youth indiscriminately mingles [them]445-some men in the character of impulse , and [he]144-gabriel had not yet arrived at the stage wherein [they]445-some men become united again , in the character of prejudice , by the influence of [a wife]450-a wife and [family]451-family . In short , [he]144-gabriel was twenty - eight , and [a bachelor]452-a bachelor . The field [he]144-gabriel was in this morning sloped to [a ridge called [Norcombe Hill]1-norcombe hill]453-a ridge called norcombe hill . Through [a spur of [this hill]455-this hill]454-a spur of this hill ran [the highway between [Emminster]2-emminster and [Chalk- Newton]3-chalk- newton]456-the highway between emminster and chalk- newton . Casually glancing over the hedge , [Oak]144-gabriel saw coming down the incline before [him]144-gabriel [an ornamental spring waggon , painted yellow and gaily marked , drawn by two horses]457-an ornamental spring waggon , painted yellow and gaily marked , drawn by two horses , a waggoner walking alongside bearing a whip perpendicularly . [The waggon]458-the waggon was laden with household goods and window plants , and on the apex of the whole sat [a woman]459-a woman , " young "[459-a woman] and attractive . [Gabriel]144-gabriel had not beheld the sight for more than half a minute , when [the vehicle]460-the vehicle was brought to a standstill just beneath [his]144-gabriel eyes . " The tailboard of the waggon is gone , [Miss.]147-miss. "[461-the waggoner] said [the waggoner]461-the waggoner . " Then [I]462-the girl heard it fall . "[462-the girl] said [the girl]462-the girl , in a soft , though not particularly low voice . " [I]462-the girl heard a noise [I]462-the girl could not account for when [we]3451-we were coming up [the hill]3452-the hill . "[462-the girl] " [I]461-the waggoner 'll run back . "[461-the waggoner] " Do . "[462-the girl] [she]462-the girl answered . The sensible horses stood - perfectly still , and the waggoner 's steps sank fainter and fainter in the distance . [The girl on the summit of the load]463-the girl on the summit of the load sat motionless , surrounded by tables and chairs with [their]464-their legs upwards , backed by an oak settle , and ornamented in front by pots of geraniums , myrtles , and cactuses , together with a caged canary - all probably from the windows of [the house just vacated]465-the house just vacated . There was also a cat in a willow basket , from the partly - opened lid of which [she]462-the girl gazed with half - closed eyes , and affectionately - surveyed the small birds around . [The handsome girl]466-the handsome girl waited for some time idly in [her]462-the girl place , and the only sound heard in the stillness was the hopping of the canary up - and down the perches of its prison . Then [she]462-the girl looked attentively downwards . It was not at the bird , nor at the cat ; it was at an oblong package tied in paper , and lying between them . [She]462-the girl turned [her]462-the girl head to learn if [the waggoner]461-the waggoner were coming . [He]461-the waggoner was not yet in sight ; and [her]462-the girl - eyes crept back to the package , [her]462-the girl thoughts seeming to run upon what was inside it . At length [she]462-the girl drew the article into [her]462-the girl lap , and untied the paper covering ; a small swing looking - glass was disclosed , in which [she]462-the girl proceeded to survey [herself]462-the girl attentively . [She]462-the girl parted [her]462-the girl lips and smiled . It was a fine morning , and the sun lighted up to a scarlet glow the crimson jacket [she]462-the girl wore , and painted a soft lustre upon [her]462-the girl bright face and dark hair . The myrtles , geraniums , and cactuses packed around [her]462-the girl were fresh and green , and at such a leafless season [they]468-they invested the whole concern of horses , waggon , furniture , and [girl]469-girl with a peculiar vernal charm . What possessed [her]462-the girl to indulge in such a performance in the sight of the sparrows , blackbirds , and [unperceived farmer who were alone its spectators]470-unperceived farmer who were alone its spectators , - whether the smile began as a factitious one , to test [her]462-the girl capacity in that art , - [nobody]439-nobody knows ; it ended certainly in a real smile . [She]462-the girl blushed at [herself]462-the girl , and seeing [her]462-the girl reflection blush , blushed the more . The change from the customary spot and necessary occasion of such an act - from the dressing hour in [a bedroom]472-a bedroom to a time of travelling out of doors - lent to the idle deed a novelty it did not intrinsically possess . The picture was a delicate one . [Woman]473-woman 's prescriptive infirmity had stalked into the sunlight , which had clothed it in the freshness of an originality . A cynical inference was irresistible by [Gabriel Oak]144-gabriel as [he]144-gabriel regarded the scene , generous though [he]144-gabriel fain would have been . There was no necessity whatever for [her]462-the girl looking in the glass . [She]462-the girl did not adjust [her]462-the girl hat , or pat [her]462-the girl hair , or press a dimple into shape , or do one thing to signify that any such intention had been [her]462-the girl motive in taking up the glass . [She]462-the girl simply observed [herself]462-the girl as a fair product of Nature in the feminine kind , [her]462-the girl thoughts seeming to glide into far - off though likely dramas in which [men]474-men would play a part - vistas of probable triumphs - the smiles being of a phase suggesting that hearts were imagined as lost and won . Still , this was but conjecture , and the whole series of actions was so idly put forth as to make it rash to assert that intention had any part in them at all . [The waggoner]461-the waggoner 's steps were heard returning . [She]462-the girl put the glass in the paper , and the whole again into its place . When [the waggon]458-the waggon had passed on , [Gabriel]144-gabriel withdrew from [his]144-gabriel point of espial , and descending into [the road]477-the road , followed [the vehicle]460-the vehicle to the turnpike - gate some way beyond [the bottom of [the hill]3452-the hill]479-the bottom of the hill , where the object of [his]144-gabriel contemplation now halted for the payment of toll . About twenty steps still remained between [him]144-gabriel and the gate , when [he]144-gabriel heard a dispute . lt was a difference con- cerning twopence between [the persons with [the waggon]458-the waggon]481-the persons with the waggon and [the man at the toll - bar]483-the man at the toll - bar . " [[Mis'ess]3453-mis'ess 's niece]3454-mis'ess 's niece is upon the top of the things , and [she]3454-mis'ess 's niece says that 's enough that [I]461-the waggoner 've offered [ye]144-gabriel , [[you]144-gabriel great miser]3455-you great miser , and [she]3454-mis'ess 's niece wo n't pay any more . "[461-the waggoner] These were [the waggoner]461-the waggoner 's words . " Very well ; then [[mis'ess]3453-mis'ess 's niece]3454-mis'ess 's niece ca n't pass . "[485-the turnpike - keeper] said [the turnpike - keeper]485-the turnpike - keeper , closing the gate . [Oak]144-gabriel looked from one to [the other of the disputants]486-the other of the disputants , and fell into a reverie . There was something in the tone of twopence remarkably insignificant . Threepence had a definite value as money - it was an appreciable infringement on a day 's wages , and , as such , a higgling matter ; but twopence - " Here . "[144-gabriel] [he]144-gabriel said , stepping forward and handing twopence to [the gatekeeper]487-the gatekeeper ; " let [the young woman]3458-the young woman pass . "[144-gabriel] [He]144-gabriel looked up at [her]488-her then ; [she]488-her heard [his]144-gabriel words , and looked down . [Gabriel]144-gabriel 's features adhered throughout their form so exactly to the middle line between the beauty of [St. John]148-st. john and the ugliness of [Judas Iscariot]149-judas iscariot , as represented in a window of [the church]489-the church [he]144-gabriel attended , that not a single lineament could be selected and called worthy either of distinction or notoriety . [The redjacketed and dark- haired maiden]490-the redjacketed and dark- haired maiden seemed to think so too , for [she]490-the redjacketed and dark- haired maiden carelessly glanced over [him]144-gabriel , and told [[her]490-the redjacketed and dark- haired maiden man]491-her man to drive on . [She]490-the redjacketed and dark- haired maiden might have looked [her]490-the redjacketed and dark- haired maiden thanks to [Gabriel]144-gabriel on a minute scale , but [she]490-the redjacketed and dark- haired maiden did not speak them ; more probably [she]490-the redjacketed and dark- haired maiden felt none , for in gaining [her]490-the redjacketed and dark- haired maiden a passage [he]144-gabriel had lost [her]490-the redjacketed and dark- haired maiden [her]490-the redjacketed and dark- haired maiden point , and [we]492-we know how [women]493-women take a favour of that kind . [The gatekeeper]487-the gatekeeper surveyed [the retreating vehicle]495-the retreating vehicle . " That 's [a handsome maid]3459-a handsome maid "[487-the gatekeeper] [he]487-the gatekeeper said to [Oak]144-gabriel " But [she]496-the comely traveller has [her]496-the comely traveller faults . "[144-gabriel] said [Gabriel]144-gabriel . " True , [farmer]3460-farmer . "[487-the gatekeeper] " And the greatest of them is - well , what it is always . "[144-gabriel] " Beating [people]3461-people down ? ay , ' tis so . "[144-gabriel] " O no . "[144-gabriel] " What , then ? "[144-gabriel] [Gabriel]144-gabriel , perhaps a little piqued by [the comely traveller]496-the comely traveller 's indifference , glanced back to where [he]144-gabriel had witnessed [her]496-the comely traveller performance over the hedge , and said , " Vanity . "[144-gabriel] CHAPTER II NIGHT - THE FLOCK - AN INTERIOR - ANOTHER INTERIOR IT was nearly midnight on the eve of [St. Thomas]4-st. thomas 's , the shortest day in the year . A desolating wind wandered from the north over the hill whereon [Oak]144-gabriel had watched the yellow waggon and [its occupant]497-its occupant in the sunshine of a few days earlier . [Norcombe Hill]1-norcombe hill - not far from [lonely Toller - Down]6-lonely toller - down - was one of the spots which suggest to [a passer - by]498-a passer - by that [he]498-a passer - by is in the presence of a shape approaching the indestructible as nearly as any to be found on [earth]499-earth . It was a featureless convexity of chalk and soil - an ordinary specimen of those smoothly - outlined protuber- ances of the globe which may remain undisturbed on some great day of confusion , when far grander heights and [dizzy granite precipices]500-dizzy granite precipices topple down . [The hill]3452-the hill was covered on [its]3452-the hill northern side by [an ancient and decaying plantation of beeches]502-an ancient and decaying plantation of beeches , whose upper verge formed a line over the crest , fringing its arched curve against the sky , like a mane . To - night these trees sheltered [the southern slope]503-the southern slope from the keenest blasts , which smote the wood and floundered through it with a sound as of grumbling , or gushed over its crowning boughs in a weakened moan . The dry leaves in [the ditch]504-the ditch simmered and boiled in the same breezes , a tongue of air occasionally ferreting out a few , and sending them spinning across the grass . [A group or two of the latest in date amongst the dead multitude]505-a group or two of the latest in date amongst the dead multitude had remained till this very mid - winter time on the twigs which bore them and in falling rattled against the trunks with smart taps : Between [this half - wooded , half naked hill]506-this half - wooded , half naked hill , and the vague still horizon that [its]3452-the hill summit indistinctly com- manded , was a mysterious sheet of fathomless shade - the sounds from which suggested that what it con- cealed bore some reduced resemblance to features here . The thin grasses , more or less coating [the hill]3452-the hill , were touched by the wind in breezes of differing powers , and almost of differing natures - one rubbing the blades heavily , another raking them piercingly , another brushing them like a soft broom . The instinctive act of human- kind was to stand and listen , and learn how the trees to each other in the regular antiphonies of a cathedral choir ; how hedges and other shapes to leeward [them]508-them caught the note , lowering it to the tenderest sob ; and how the hurrying gust then plunged into the south , to be heard no more . The sky was clear - remarkably clear - and the twinkling of all the stars seemed to be but throbs of one body , timed by a common pulse . [The North Star]7-the north star was directly in the wind 's eye , and since evening [the Bear]150-the bear had swung round [it]7-the north star outwardly to the east , till [he]150-the bear was now at a right angle with the meridian . A difference of colour in the stars - oftener read of than seen in [England]8-england - was really perceptible here . The sovereign brilliancy of [Sirius]151-sirius pierced the eye with a steely glitter , the star called [Capella]9-capella was yellow , [Aldebaran]152-aldebaran and [Betelgueux]153-betelgueux shone with a fiery red . To [persons standing alone on a hill during a clear midnight such as this]509-persons standing alone on a hill during a clear midnight such as this , the roll of [the world]447-the world eastward is almost a palpable movement . The sensation may be caused by the panoramic glide of the stars past earthly objects , which is perceptible in a few minutes of still- ness , or by the better outlook upon space that [a hill]511-a hill affords , or by the wind , or by the solitude ; but whatever be its origin , the impression of riding along is vivid and abiding . The poetry of motion is a phrase much in use , and to enjoy the epic form of that gratification it is necessary to stand on [a hill]511-a hill at a small hour of the night , and , having first expanded with a sense of differ- ence from the mass of [civilised mankind , who are dreamwrapt and disregardful of all such proceedings at this time]513-civilised mankind , who are dreamwrapt and disregardful of all such proceedings at this time , long and quietly watch [your]514-your stately progress through the stars . After such a nocturnal reconnoitre it is hard to get back to [earth]499-earth , and to believe that the consciousness of [such majestic speeding]516-such majestic speeding is derived from a tiny human frame . Suddenly an unexpected series of sounds began to be heard in this place up against the sky . They had a clearness which was to be found nowhere in the wind , and a sequence which was to be found nowhere in nature . They were the notes of [Farmer Oak]143-farmer oak 's flute . The tune was not floating unhindered into the open air : it seemed muffled in some way , and was altogether too curtailed in power to spread high or wide . It came from the direction of a small dark object under [the plantation hedge]517-the plantation hedge - [[a shepherd]518-a shepherd 's hut]519-a shepherd 's hut - now presenting an outline to which [an uninitiated person]520-an uninitiated person might have been puzzled to attach either meaning or use . The image as a whole was that of [a small Noah 's Ark on [a small Ararat]10-a small ararat]521-a small noah 's ark on a small ararat , allowing the traditionary outlines and general form of [the Ark]11-the ark which are followed by [toy- makers]522-toy- makers - and by these means are established in [men]474-men 's imaginations among [their]474-men firmest , because earliest im- pressions - to pass as an approximate pattern . [The hut]524-the hut stood on little wheels , which raised [its]524-the hut floor about a foot from the ground . [[Such shepherds]525-such shepherds ' huts]526-such shepherds ' huts are dragged into [the fields]527-the fields when the lambing season comes on , to shelter [the shepherd]528-the shepherd in [his-]529-his- enforced nightly attendance . It was only latterly that [people]3461-people had begun to call [Gabriel]144-gabriel " [Farmer "[3461-people] Oak]143-farmer oak . During the twelvemonth pre- ceding this time [he]144-gabriel had been enabled by sustained efforts of industry and chronic good spirits to lease [the small sheep farm of which [Norcombe Hill]1-norcombe hill]531-the small sheep farm of which norcombe hill was a portion , and stock [it]531-the small sheep farm of which norcombe hill with two hundred sheep . Previously [he]144-gabriel had been [a bailiff]532-a bailiff for a short time , and earlier still [a shepherd]518-a shepherd only , having from [his]144-gabriel childhood assisted [[his]144-gabriel father]534-his father in tending [the flocks of [large proprietors]536-large proprietors]535-the flocks of large proprietors , till [old Gabriel]144-gabriel sank to rest . This venture , unaided and alone , into the paths of farming as [master]537-master and not as [man , with an advance of sheep not yet paid for]538-man , with an advance of sheep not yet paid for , was a critical juncture with [Gabriel Oak]144-gabriel , and [he]144-gabriel recognised [his]144-gabriel position clearly . The first movement in [his]144-gabriel new progress was the lambing of [his]144-gabriel ewes , and sheep having been [his]144-gabriel speciality from [his]144-gabriel " youth , [he]144-gabriel wisely refrained from deputing - the task of tending them at this season to [a hireling]3462-a hireling or [a novice]3463-a novice . The wind continued to beat - about the corners of [the hut]524-the hut , but the flute - playing ceased . A rectangular space of light appeared in the side of [the hut]524-the hut , and in the opening the outline of [Farmer Oak]143-farmer oak 's figure . [He]144-gabriel carried a lantern in [his]144-gabriel hand , and closing the door behind [him]144-gabriel , came forward and busied [himself]144-gabriel about [this nook of [the field]3467-the field]3466-this nook of the field for nearly twenty minutes , the lantern light appear- ing and disappearing here and there , and brightening [him]144-gabriel or darkening [him]144-gabriel as [he]144-gabriel stood before or behind it . [Oak]143-farmer oak 's motions , though they had a quiet - energy , were slow , and their deliberateness accorded well with [his]143-farmer oak occupation . Fitness being the basis of beauty , [nobody]439-nobody could - have denied that [his]143-farmer oak steady swings and turns "[539-the flock] in and- about [the flock]539-the flock had elements of grace , Yet , although if occasion demanded [he]540-his could do or think a thing with as mercurial a dash as can [the men of [towns]542-towns]541-the men of towns [who are more to the manner born]543-who are more to the manner born , [his]540-his special power , morally , physically , and mentally , was static , owing little or nothing to momentum as a rule . A close examination of the ground hereabout , even by the wan starlight only , revealed how a portion of what would have been casually called [a wild slope]544-a wild slope had been appropriated by [Farmer Oak]143-farmer oak for [his]540-his great purpose this winter . Detached hurdles thatched with straw were stuck into the ground at various scattered points , amid and under which the whitish forms of [his]540-his meek ewes moved and rustled . The ring of the sheep - bell , which had been silent during [his]540-his absence , recommenced , in tones that had more mellowness than clearness , owing to an increasing growth of surrounding wool . This continued till [Oak]143-farmer oak withdrew again from the flock . [He]143-farmer oak - returned to [the hut]524-the hut , bringing in [his]143-farmer oak arms a new - born lamb , consisting of four legs large enough for a full- grown sheep , united by a seemingly inconsiderable mem- brane about half the substance of the legs collectively , which constituted the animal 's entire body just at present . The little speck of life [he]143-farmer oak placed on a wisp of hay before the small stove , where a can of milk was simmer- ing . [Oak]143-farmer oak extinguished the lantern by blowing into it and then pinching the snuff , the cot being lighted by a candle suspended by a twisted wire . A rather hard couch , formed of a few corn sacks thrown carelessly down , covered half the floor of [this little habitation]546-this little habitation , and here [the young man]547-the young man stretched [himself]547-the young man along , loosened [his]547-the young man woollen cravat , and closed [his]547-the young man eyes . In about the time [a person unaccustomed to bodily labour]548-a person unaccustomed to bodily labour would have decided upon which side to lie , [Farmer Oak]143-farmer oak was asleep . The inside of [the hut]524-the hut , as [it]524-the hut now presented itself , was cosy and alluring , and the scarlet handful of fire in addition to the candle , reflecting its own genial colour upon whatever it could reach , flung associations of enjoyment even over utensils and tools . In the corner stood the sheep - crook , and along a shelf at one side were ranged bottles and canisters of the simple prepara- tions pertaining to bovine surgery and physic ; spirits of wine , turpentine , tar , magnesia , ginger , and castor - oil being [the chief]550-the chief . On a triangular shelf across the corner stood bread , bacon , cheese , and a cup for ale or cider , which was supplied from a flagon beneath . Beside the provisions lay the flute whose notes had lately been called forth by [the lonely watcher]551-the lonely watcher to beguile a tedious hour . [The house]552-the house was ventilated by two round holes , like the lights of [[a ship]553-a ship 's cabin]554-a ship 's cabin , with wood slides- The lamb , revived by the warmth began to bleat " instant meaning , as expected sounds will . Passing from the profoundest sleep to the most alert wakefulness with the same ease that had accompanied the reverse operation , [he]143-farmer oak looked at [his]143-farmer oak watch , found that the hour- hand had shifted again , put on [his]143-farmer oak hat , took the lamb in [his]143-farmer oak arms , and carried [it]3469-it into the darkness . After placing the little creature with [its mother]3470-its mother , [he]143-farmer oak stood and carefully examined the sky , to ascertain the time of night from the altitudes of the stars . The Dog - star and [Aldebaran]152-aldebaran , pointing to [the restless Pleiades]12-the restless pleiades , were half - way up the Southern sky , and between them hung [Orion]154-orion , which gorgeous constellation never burnt more vividly than now , as it soared forth above the rim of [the landscape]3471-the landscape . [Castor]155-castor and [Pollux]13-pollux will [the north - west]3472-the north - west ; far away through [the plantation Vega]3473-the plantation vega and [Cassiopeia]156-cassiopeia 's chair stood daintily poised on the uppermost boughs . "[0-i] One o'clock . " said [Gabriel]144-gabriel . Being [a man]3474-a man not without a frequent consciousness that there was some charm in this life [he]143-farmer oak led , [he]143-farmer oak stood still after looking at the sky as a useful instrument , and regarded it in an appreciative spirit , as a work of art superlatively beautiful . For a moment [he]143-farmer oak seemed impressed with the speaking loneliness of the scene , or rather with the complete abstraction from all its compass of the sights and sounds of [man]3450-man . Human shapes , interferences , troubles , and joys were all as if they were not , and there seemed to be on [the shaded hemisphere of the globe]3476-the shaded hemisphere of the globe [no sentient being save [himself]143-farmer oak]3477-no sentient being save himself ; [he]143-farmer oak could fancy [them]3478-them all gone round to the sunny side . Occupied this , with eyes stretched afar , [Oak]144-gabriel gradually per- ceived that what [he]143-farmer oak had previously taken to be a star low down behind [the outskirts of [the plantation]3480-the plantation]3479-the outskirts of the plantation was in reality no such thing . It was an artificial light , almost close at hand . To find [themselves]3478-them utterly alone at night where company is desirable and expected makes [some people]3481-some people fearful ; but a case more trying by far to the nerves is to discover some mysterious companionship when intuition , sensation , memory , analogy , testimony , probability , induction - every kind of evidence in [the logician]3482-the logician 's list - have united to persuade con- sciousness that it is quite in isolation . [Farmer Oak]143-farmer oak went towards [the plantation]3480-the plantation and pushed through [its]3480-the plantation lower boughs to the windy side . A dim mass under the slope reminded [him]143-farmer oak that [a shed]3484-a shed occupied a place here , the site being a cutting into [the slope of the hill]3485-the slope of the hill , so that at [its]3484-a shed back part the roof was almost level with the ground . In front [it]3484-a shed was formed of board nailed to posts and covered with tar as a preservative . Through crevices in the roof and side spread streaks and spots of light , a combination of which made the radiance that had attracted [him]143-farmer oak . [Oak]143-farmer oak stepped up behind , where , leaning down upon the roof and putting [his]143-farmer oak eye close to a hole , [he]143-farmer oak could see into the interior clearly . [The place]3486-the place contained [two women]3487-two women and two cows . By the side of the latter a steaming bran - mash stood in a bucket . [One of [the women]3489-the women]3488-one of the women was past middle age . [[Her]3488-one of the women companion]3490-her companion was ap- parently young and graceful ; [he]143-farmer oak could form no decided opinion upon [her]3488-one of the women looks , [her]3488-one of the women position being almost beneath [his]143-farmer oak eye , so that [he]143-farmer oak saw [her]3488-one of the women in a bird's - eye view , as [[Milton]157-milton 's Satan]3491-milton 's satan first saw [Paradise]158-paradise . [She]3488-one of the women wore no bonnet or het , but had enveloped [her-]3488-one of the women self in a large cloak , which was carelessly flung over [her]3488-one of the women head as a covering . " The cow standing erect was of the Devon breed , and was encased in a tight warm hide of rich Indian red , as absolutely uniform from eyes to tail as if the animal had been dipped in a dye of that colour , [her]0-i long back being mathematically level . [The other]3495-the other was spotted , grey and white . Between the sheep and the cows [Lucina]160-lucina had been busy on [Norcombe hill]3500-norcombe hill lately . " [Oak]143-farmer oak , upon hearing these remarks , became more curious to observe [her]0-i features , but this prospect being denied [him]143-farmer oak by the hooding effect of the cloak , and by [his]143-farmer oak aerial position , [he]143-farmer oak felt [himself]143-farmer oak drawing upon [his]143-farmer oak fancy for their details . In making even horizontal and clear inspections [we]555-we colour and mould according to the warts within [us]555-we whatever [our]555-we eyes bring in . Had [Gabriel]144-gabriel been able from the first to get a distinct view of [her]0-i - countenance , [his]144-gabriel estimate of it as very handsome or slightly so would have been as [his]144-gabriel soul required a divinity at the moment or was ready supplied with one . Having for some time known the want of a satisfactory form to fill an increasing void within [him]144-gabriel , [his]144-gabriel position moreover affording the widest scope for [his]144-gabriel fancy , [he]144-gabriel painted [her]0-i a beauty . By one of those whimsical coincidences in which [Nature]161-nature , like [a busy mother]3501-a busy mother , seems to spare a moment from [her]0-i unremitting labours to turn and make [[her]0-i children]3502-her children smile , [the girl]462-the girl now dropped the cloak , and forth tumbled ropes of black hair over a red jacket . [Oak]144-gabriel knew [her]462-the girl instantly as [the heroine of the yellow waggon , myrtles , and looking - glass]3504-the heroine of the yellow waggon , myrtles , and looking - glass : prosily , as the woman who owed [him]144-gabriel twopence . [They]3505-they placed the calf beside [[its]0-i mother]3470-its mother again , took up the lantern , and went out , the light sinking down [the hill]3452-the hill till it was no more than a nebula . [Gabriel Oak]144-gabriel returned to [his]144-gabriel flock . CHAPTER III [A GIRL ON HORSEBACK]3508-a girl on horseback - CONVERSATION THE sluggish day began to break . Even its position terrestrially is one of the elements of a new interest , and for no particular reason save that the incident of the night had occurred [there]3509-there , [Oak]144-gabriel went again into [the plantation]3480-the plantation . Lingering and musing here , [he]144-gabriel heard the steps of a horse at [the foot of [the hill]3452-the hill]3511-the foot of the hill , and soon there appeared in view an auburn pony with [a girl on its back]3513-a girl on its back , ascending by the path leading past [the cattle- shed]3514-the cattle- shed . [She]462-the girl was [the young woman of the night before]3515-the young woman of the night before . [Gabriel]144-gabriel instantly thought of the hat [she]462-the girl had mentioned as having lost in the wind ; possibly [she]462-the girl had come to look for it . [He]144-gabriel hastily scanned [the ditch]504-the ditch and after walking about ten yards along it , found the hat among the leaves . [Gabriel]144-gabriel took it in [his]144-gabriel hand and returned to [[his]144-gabriel hut]3517-his hut . Here [he]144-gabriel ensconced [himself]144-gabriel , and peeped through the loophole in the direction of the riders approach . [She]462-the girl came up and looked around - then on the other side of the hedge . [Gabriel]144-gabriel was about to advance and restore the missing article when an unexpected per- formance induced [him]144-gabriel to suspend the action for the present . [The path]3518-the path , after passing [the cowshed]3519-the cowshed , bisected [the plantation]3480-the plantation . [It]3518-the path was not a bridle - path - merely [a pedestrian]3521-a pedestrian 's track , and the boughs spread horizontally at a height not greater than seven feet above the ground , which made it impossible to ride erect beneath [them]3518-the path . [The girl , who wore no riding - habit]3522-the girl , who wore no riding - habit , looked around for a moment , as if to assure [herself]3522-the girl , who wore no riding - habit that all humanity was out of view , then dexterously dropped backwards flat upon the pony 's back , [her]3522-the girl , who wore no riding - habit head over its tail , [her]3522-the girl , who wore no riding - habit feet against its shoulders , and [her]3522-the girl , who wore no riding - habit eyes to the sky . The rapidity of [her]3522-the girl , who wore no riding - habit glide into this position was that of a kingfisher - its noiselessness that of a hawk . [Gabriel]144-gabriel 's eyes had scarcely been able to follow [her]3522-the girl , who wore no riding - habit . [The tall lank pony]3523-the tall lank pony seemed used to such doings , and ambled along unconcerned . Thus [she]3522-the girl , who wore no riding - habit passed under the level boughs . [The performer]3524-the performer seemed quite at home anywhere between a horse 's head and its tail , and the necessity for this abnormal attitude having ceased with the passage of [the plantation]3480-the plantation , [she]3522-the girl , who wore no riding - habit began to adopt another , even more obviously convenient than the first . [She]3522-the girl , who wore no riding - habit had no side - saddle , and it was very apparent that a firm seat upon the smooth leather beneath [her]3522-the girl , who wore no riding - habit was un- attainable sideways . Springing to [her]3522-the girl , who wore no riding - habit accustomed perpendicular like a bowed sapling , and satisfying [her]3522-the girl , who wore no riding - habit , self that [nobody]439-nobody was in sight , [she]3522-the girl , who wore no riding - habit seated [herself]3522-the girl , who wore no riding - habit in the manner demanded by the saddle , though hardly expected of [the woman]3527-the woman , and trotted off in the direction of [Tewnell Mill]14-tewnell mill . [Oak]144-gabriel was amused , perhaps a little astonished , and hanging up the hat in [[his]144-gabriel hut]3517-his hut , went again among [[his]144-gabriel ewes]3529-his ewes . An hour passed , [the girl]462-the girl returned , properly seated now , with a bag of bran in front of [her]462-the girl . On nearing [the cattle - shed]3531-the cattle - shed [she]462-the girl was met by [a boy]3532-a boy bringing a milking - pail , who held the reins of the pony whilst [she]462-the girl slid off . [The boy]444-the boy led away the horse , leaving the pail with [the young woman]3458-the young woman . Soon soft shirts alternating with loud shirts came in regular succession from within [the shed]3535-the shed , the obvious sounds of [a person milking a cow]3536-a person milking a cow . [Gabriel]144-gabriel took the lost hat in [his]144-gabriel hand , and waited beside the path [she]462-the girl would follow in leaving [the hill]3452-the hill . [She]462-the girl came , the pail in one hand , hanging against [her]462-the girl knee . The left arm was extended as a balance , enough of it being shown bare to make [Oak]144-gabriel wish that the event ha happened in the summer , when the whole would have been revealed . There was a bright air and manner about [her]462-the girl now , by which [she]462-the girl seemed to imply that the desirability of [her]462-the girl existence could not be questioned ; and this rather saucy assumption failed in being offensive , because [a beholder]3538-a beholder felt it to be , upon the whole , true . Like exceptional emphasis in the tone of [a genius]3539-a genius , that which would have made mediocrity ridiculous was an addition to recognised power . It was with some surprise that [she]462-the girl saw [Gabriel]144-gabriel 's face rising like the moon behind the hedge . The adjustment of [the farmer]3540-the farmer 's hazy conceptions of [her]462-the girl charms to the portrait of [herself]462-the girl [she]462-the girl now presented [him]144-gabriel with was less a diminution than a difference . The starting - point selected by the judgment was . [her]462-the girl height [She]462-the girl seemed tall , but the pail was a small one , and the hedge diminutive ; hence , making allowance for error by comparison with these , [she]462-the girl could have been not above the height to be chosen by [women]493-women as best . All features of consequence were severe and regular . It may have been observed by persons who go about [the shires with eyes for beauty]3542-the shires with eyes for beauty , that in Englishwoman a classically - formed face is seldom found to be united with a figure of the same pattern , the highly - finished features being generally too large for the remainder of the frame ; that a graceful and proportionate figure of eight heads usually goes off into random facial curves . Without throwing a Nymphean tissue over [a milkmaid]3543-a milkmaid , let it be said that here criticism checked [itself]3544-itself as out of place , and looked at [her]462-the girl proportions with a long consciousness of pleasure . From the contours of [her]462-the girl figure in its upper part , [she]462-the girl must have had a beautiful neck and shoulders ; but since [her]462-the girl infancy [nobody]439-nobody had ever seen them . Had [she]462-the girl been put into a low dress [she]462-the girl would have run and thrust [her]462-the girl head into a bush . Yet [she]462-the girl was not [a shy girl]3546-a shy girl by any means ; it was merely [her]462-the girl instinct to draw the line dividing the seen from the unseen higher than [they]3547-they do it in [towns]542-towns . That [the girl]462-the girl 's thoughts hovered about [her]462-the girl face and form as soon as [she]462-the girl caught [Oak]144-gabriel 's eyes conning the same page was natural , and almost certain . The self- consciousness shown would have been vanity if a little more pronounced , dignity if a little less . Rays of male vision seem to have a tickling effect upon virgin faces in [rural districts]3550-rural districts ; [she]462-the girl brushed [hers]462-the girl with [her]462-the girl hand , as if [Gabriel]144-gabriel had been irritating its pink surface by actual touch , and the free air of [her]462-the girl previous movements was reduced at the same time to a chastened phase of itself . Yet it was [the man who blushed]3551-the man who blushed , [the maid not at all]3552-the maid not at all . "[0-i] [I]0-i found a hat . " said [Oak]144-gabriel . "[0-i] [It]560-it is [mine]0-i . " said [she]462-the girl , and , from a sense of proportion , kept down to a small smile an inclination to laugh dis- tinctly : "[0-i] it flew away last night . " "[0-i] One o'clock this morning ? " "[0-i] Well - it was . " [She]462-the girl was surprised . "[0-i] How did [you]0-i know ? " [she]462-the girl said . "[0-i] [I]0-i was here . " "[0-i] [You]0-i are [Farmer Oak]143-farmer oak , are [you]0-i not ? " "[143-farmer oak] That or thereabouts . [I]0-i 'm lately come to [this place]561-this place . " "[0-i] [A large farm]562-a large farm ? " [she]462-the girl inquired , casting [her]462-the girl eyes round , and swinging back [her]462-the girl hair , which was black in the shaded hollows of its mass ; but it being now an hour past sunrise , the rays touched its prominent curves with a colour of their own . "[0-i] No ; not large . About a hundred . " In speaking of [farms]3553-farms the word "[0-i] [acres]563-acres " is omitted by [the natives]3554-the natives , by analogy to such old expressions as "[0-i] a stag of ten . " [she]462-the girl inquired , a misgiving bringing every muscle of [her]462-the girl lineaments and frame to a standstill . "[0-i] Here - going through [the plantation]3480-the plantation , and all down [the hill]3452-the hill . " said [Farmer Oak]143-farmer oak , with an aspect excessively knowing with regard to some matter in [his]143-farmer oak mind , as [he]143-farmer oak gazed at [a remote point in the direction named]3555-a remote point in the direction named , and then turned back to meet [his]143-farmer oak colloquist 's eyes . A perception caused [him]143-farmer oak to withdraw [his]143-farmer oak own eyes from [hers]462-the girl as suddenly as if [he]143-farmer oak had been caught in a theft . Recollection of the strange antics [she]462-the girl had indulged in when passing through the trees , was suc- ceeded in [the girl]462-the girl by a nettled palpitation , and that by a hot face . It was a time to see [a woman redden who was not given to reddening as a rule]3557-a woman redden who was not given to reddening as a rule ; not a point in [the milkmaid but was of the deepest rose - colour]3558-the milkmaid but was of the deepest rose - colour . From [the Maiden]3559-the maiden 's Blush , through all varieties of the Provence down to the Crimson Tuscany , the countenance of [[Oak]143-farmer oak 's acquaintance]3560-oak 's acquaintance quickly graduated ; whereupon [he]143-farmer oak , in con- siderateness , turned away [his]143-farmer oak head . [The sympathetic man]3561-the sympathetic man still looked the other way , and wondered when [she]462-the girl would recover coolness sufficient to justify [him]143-farmer oak in facing [her]462-the girl again . [He]143-farmer oak heard what seemed to be the flitting of a dead leaf upon the breeze , and looked . [She]462-the girl had gone away . With an air between that of [Tragedy]162-tragedy and [Comedy]163-comedy ! [Gabriel]144-gabriel returned to [his]144-gabriel work . Five mornings and evenings passed . [The young woman]3458-the young woman came regularly to milk the healthy cow or to attend to [the sick one]3563-the sick one , but never allowed [her]3458-the young woman vision to stray in the direction of [[Oak]144-gabriel 's person]3564-oak 's person . [His]144-gabriel want of tact had deeply offended [her]3458-the young woman - not by seeing what [he]144-gabriel could not help , but by letting [her]3458-the young woman know that [he]144-gabriel had seen it . For , as without law there is no sin , without eyes there is no indecorum ; and [she]3458-the young woman appeared to feel that [[Gabriel]144-gabriel 's espial]3565-gabriel 's espial had made [her]3458-the young woman [an indecorous woman]3566-an indecorous woman without [her]3458-the young woman own connivance . It was food for great regret with [him]144-gabriel ; it was also a contretemps which touched into life a latent heat [he]144-gabriel had experienced in that direction . The acquaintanceship might , however , have ended in a slow forgetting , but for an incident which occurred at the end of the same week . One afternoon it began to freeze , and the frost increased with evening , which drew on like a stealthy tightening of bonds . It was a time when in cottages the breath of [the sleepers]3567-the sleepers freezes to the sheets ; when round the drawing - room fire of [a thick - walled mansion]3568-a thick - walled mansion [the sitters]3569-the sitters ' backs are cold , even whilst [their]3569-the sitters faces are all aglow . [Many a small bird]3570-many a small bird went to bed supperless that night among the bare boughs . As the milking - hour drew near , [Oak]144-gabriel kept [his]144-gabriel usual watch upon [the cowshed]3519-the cowshed . At last [he]144-gabriel felt cold , and shaking an extra quantity of bedding round the yearling ewes [he]144-gabriel entered [the hut]524-the hut and heaped more fuel upon the stove . The wind came in at the bottom of the door , and to prevent it [Oak]144-gabriel laid a sack there and wheeled the cot round a little more to the south . Then the wind spouted in at a ventilating hole - of which there was one on each side of [the hut]524-the hut . [Gabriel]144-gabriel had always known that when the fire was lighted and the door closed one of these must be kept open - that chosen being always on the side away from the wind . Closing the slide to windward , [he]144-gabriel turned to open the other ; on second - thoughts [the farmer]3540-the farmer con- sidered that [he]144-gabriel would first sit down leaving both closed for a minute or two , till the temperature of [the hut]524-the hut was a little raised . [He]144-gabriel sat down . [His]144-gabriel head began to ache in an unwonted manner , and , fancying [himself]144-gabriel weary by reason of the broken rests of the preceding nights , [Oak]144-gabriel decided to get up , open the slide , and then allow [himself]144-gabriel to fall asleep . [He]144-gabriel fell asleep , however , without having performed the necessary preliminary . How long [he]144-gabriel remained unconscious [Gabriel]144-gabriel never knew . During the first stages of [his]144-gabriel return to [percep-]15-percep- tion peculiar deeds seemed to be in course of enactment . [His]144-gabriel dog was howling , [his]144-gabriel head was aching fearfully - [somebody]3576-somebody was pulling [him]144-gabriel about , hands were loosening [his]144-gabriel neckerchief . On opening [his]144-gabriel eyes [he]144-gabriel found that evening had sunk to dusk in a strange manner of unexpectedness . [The young girl with the remarkably pleasant lips and white teeth]3577-the young girl with the remarkably pleasant lips and white teeth was beside [him]144-gabriel . More than this - astonishingly more - [his]144-gabriel head was upon [her]566-her lap , [his]144-gabriel face and neck were disagreeably wet , and [her]566-her fingers were unbuttoning [his]144-gabriel collar . "[566-her] Whatever is the matter ? " said [Oak]144-gabriel , vacantly . [She]566-her seemed to experience mirth , but of too insignifi- ca nt a kind to start enjoyment . "[566-her] Nothing now ' , [she]566-her answered , ' since [you]567-you are not dead It is a wonder [you]567-you were not , suffocated in [this hut of yours]568-this hut of yours . " "[566-her] Ah , [the hut]524-the hut ! " murmured [Gabriel]144-gabriel . "[566-her] [I]0-i gave ten pounds for [that hut]570-that hut . But [I]0-i 'll sell it , and sit under thatched hurdles as [they]571-they did in old times , curl up to sleep in a lock of straw ! It played [me]0-i nearly the same trick the other day ! " [Gabriel]144-gabriel , by way of emphasis , brought down [his]144-gabriel fist upon the floor . "[0-i] It was not exactly the fault of [the hut]524-the hut . " [she]566-her ob- served in a tone which showed [her]566-her to be that novelty among [women]493-women - [one who finished a thought before beginning the sentence which was to convey it]3579-one who finished a thought before beginning the sentence which was to convey it . "[567-you] [You]567-you should [I]0-i think , have considered , and not have been so foolish as to leave the slides closed . " "[567-you] Yes [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i should . " said [Oak]144-gabriel , absently . [He]144-gabriel was endeavouring to catch and appreciate the sensation of being thus with [her]566-her , [his]144-gabriel head upon [her]566-her dress , before the event passed on into the heap of bygone things . [He]144-gabriel wished [she]566-her knew [his]144-gabriel impressions ; but [he]144-gabriel would as soon have thought of carrying an odour in a net as of attempting to convey the intangibilities of [his]144-gabriel feeling in the coarse meshes of language . So [he]144-gabriel remained silent . [She]566-her made [him]144-gabriel sit up , and then [Oak]144-gabriel began wiping [his]144-gabriel face and shaking [himself]144-gabriel like [a Samson]3580-a samson . [[My]0-i uncle]577-my uncle has [a hut like this one]578-a hut like this one , and [I]0-i have heard [him]577-my uncle tell [[his]577-my uncle shepherd]579-his shepherd not to go to sleep without leaving a slide open . CHAPTER IV [GABRIEL]144-gabriel 'S RESOLVE - THE VISIT - THE MISTAKE THE only superiority in [women that is tolerable to the rival sex]3585-women that is tolerable to the rival sex is , as a rule , that of the unconscious kind ; but a superiority which recognizes itself may sometimes please by suggesting possibilities of capture to [the subordinated man]3586-the subordinated man . [This well - favoured and comely girl]3587-this well - favoured and comely girl soon made appre- ciable inroads upon the emotional constitution of [young Farmer Oak]143-farmer oak . Love , being an extremely exacting [usurer]3588-usurer a sense of exorbitant profit , spiritually , by an exchange of hearts , being at the bottom of pure passions , as that of exorbi- tant profit , bodily or materially , is at the bottom of those of lower atmosphere , every morning [Oak]144-gabriel 's feelings were as sensitive as the money - market in calculations upon [his]144-gabriel chances . [His]144-gabriel dog waited for [his]144-gabriel meals in a way so like that in which [Oak]144-gabriel waited for [the girl]462-the girl 's presence , that [the farmer]3540-the farmer was quite struck with the resemblance , felt it lowering , and would not look at the dog . However , [he]144-gabriel continued to watch through the hedge for [her]462-the girl regular coming , and thus [his]144-gabriel sentiments towards [her]462-the girl were deepened without any corresponding effect being produced upon [herself]462-the girl . [Oak]144-gabriel had nothing finished and ready to say as yet , and not being able to frame love phrases which end where they begin ; passionate tales - - Full of sound and fury - signifying nothing - [he]144-gabriel said no word at all . By making inquiries [he]144-gabriel found that [the girl]462-the girl 's name was [Bathsheba Everdene]243-bathsheba , and that the cow would go dry in about seven days . [He]144-gabriel dreaded the eight day . At last the eighth day came . The cow had ceased to give milk for that year , and [Bathsheba Everdene]243-bathsheba came up [the hill]3452-the hill no more . [Gabriel]144-gabriel had reached a pitch of existence [he]144-gabriel never could have anticipated a short time before . [He]144-gabriel liked saying ` [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba ' as a private enjoyment instead of whistling ; turned over [his]144-gabriel taste to black hair , though [he]144-gabriel had sworn by brown ever since [he]144-gabriel was [a boy]3532-a boy , isolated [himself]144-gabriel till the space [he]144-gabriel filled in a possible strength in an actual weakness . Marriage transforms a distraction into a support , the power of which should be , and happily often is , in direct pro- portion to the degree of imbecility it supplants . [Oak]144-gabriel began now to see light in this direction , and said to [himself]0-i , "[0-i] [I]0-i 'll make [her]585-her [[my]0-i wife]586-my wife , or upon [my]0-i soul [I]0-i shall be good for nothing ! " All this while [he]144-gabriel was perplexing [himself]144-gabriel about an errand on which [he]144-gabriel might consistently visit [the cottage of [[Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's aunt]3595-bathsheba 's aunt]3594-the cottage of bathsheba 's aunt . [He]144-gabriel found [his]144-gabriel opportunity in the death of [a ewe]3596-a ewe , [mother of a living lamb]3597-mother of a living lamb . On a day which had a summer face and a winter constitution - a fine January morning , when there was just enough blue sky visible to make [cheerfully - disposed people]3598-cheerfully - disposed people wish for more , and an occasional gleam of silvery sunshine , [Oak]144-gabriel put the lamb into a respectable Sunday basket , and stalked across [the fields]527-the fields to [the house of [Mrs. Hurst]165-mrs. hurst]3600-the house of mrs. hurst , [the aunt]3601-the aunt - [George]166-george , the dog walking behind , with a countenance of great concern at the serious turn pastoral affairs seemed to be taking . [Gabriel]144-gabriel had watched the blue wood - smoke curling from the chimney with strange meditation . At evening [he]144-gabriel had fancifully traced it down the chimney to the spot of [its]3602-its origin - seen the hearth and [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba beside [it]3602-its - beside it in [her]3595-bathsheba 's aunt out - door dress ; for the clothes [she]3595-bathsheba 's aunt had worn on [the hill]3452-the hill were by association equally with [[her]3595-bathsheba 's aunt person]3604-her person included in the compass of [his]144-gabriel affection ; they seemed at this early time of [his]144-gabriel love a necessary ingredient of the sweet mixture called Bath- sheba Everdene . [He]144-gabriel had made a toilet of a nicely - adjusted kind - of a nature between the carefully neat and the carelessly ornate - of a degree between fine - market - day and wet- Sunday selection . [He]144-gabriel thoroughly cleaned [his]144-gabriel silver watch - chain with whiting , put new lacing straps to [his]144-gabriel boots , looked to the brass eyelet - holes , went to [the inmost heart of [the plantation]3480-the plantation]3605-the inmost heart of the plantation for a new walking - stick , and trimmed it vigorously on [his]144-gabriel way back ; took a new handkerchief from the bottom of [his]144-gabriel clothes - box , put on the light waistcoat patterned all over with sprigs of an elegant flower uniting the beauties of both rose and lily without the defects of either , and used all the hair - oil [he]144-gabriel possessed upon [his]144-gabriel usually dry , sandy , and inextricably curly hair , till [he]144-gabriel had deepened it to a splendidly novel colour , between that of guano and Roman cement , making it stick to [his]144-gabriel head like mace round a nutmeg , or wet seaweed round a boulder after the ebb . Nothing disturbed the stillness of [the cottage]3607-the cottage save the chatter of a knot of sparrows on the eaves ; one might fancy scandal and rumour to be no less the staple topic of these little coteries on [roofs]3608-roofs than of those under [them]3608-roofs . It seemed that the omen was an unpropitious one , for , as [the rather untoward commence- ment of Oak]3609-the rather untoward commence- ment of oak 's overtures , just as [he]144-gabriel arrived by [the garden gate]3610-the garden gate , [he]144-gabriel saw a cat inside , going into various arched shapes and fiendish convulsions at the sight of [his]144-gabriel dog [George]166-george . The dog took no notice , for [he]144-gabriel had arrived at an age at which all superfluous barking was cynically avoided as a waste of breath - in fact [he]144-gabriel never barked even at the sheep except to order , when it was done with an absolutely neutral countenance , as a sort of Com- mination - service , which , though offensive , had to be gone through once now and then to frighten the flock for [their]3611-their own good . A voice came from behind some laurel - bushes into which the cat had run : "[587-a nasty brute of a dog] Poor dear ! Did [a nasty brute of a dog]587-a nasty brute of a dog want to kill it ; - did [[he]587-a nasty brute of a dog poor dear]588-he poor dear ! " "[587-a nasty brute of a dog] [I]0-i beg [your]589-you pardon . " said [Oak]144-gabriel to the voice , "[587-a nasty brute of a dog] but [George]166-george was walking on behind [me]0-i with a temper as mild as milk . " Almost before [he]144-gabriel had ceased speaking , [Oak]144-gabriel was seized with a misgiving as to whose ear was the recipient of [his]144-gabriel answer . [Nobody]439-nobody appeared , and [he]144-gabriel heard [the person]3613-the person retreat among the bushes . [Gabriel]144-gabriel meditated , and so deeply that [he]144-gabriel brought small furrows into [his]144-gabriel forehead by sheer force of reverie . Where the issue of an interview is as likely to be a vast change for the worse as for the better , any initial difference from expectation causes nipping sensations of failure . [Oak]144-gabriel went up to the door a little abashed : [his]144-gabriel mental rehearsal and the reality had had no common grounds of opening . [[Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's aunt]3595-bathsheba 's aunt was indoors . "[166-george] Will [you]589-you tell [Miss Everdene]167-miss everdene that [somebody]3576-somebody would be glad to speak to [her]167-miss everdene ? " said [Mr. Oak]146-mr. oak . Calling [one 's self]3615-one 's self merely Some- body , without giving a name , is not to be taken as an example of the ill - breeding of [the rural world]3616-the rural world : it springs from a refined modesty , of which [townspeople]3617-townspeople , with [their]3617-townspeople cards and announcements , have no notion whatever . [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba was out . The voice had evidently been [hers]167-miss everdene . "[589-you] Will [you]589-you come in , [Mr. Oak]146-mr. oak ? " "[589-you] Oh , thank ' [ee]589-you , said [Gabriel]144-gabriel , following [her]167-miss everdene to the fireplace . " [I]144-gabriel 've brought a lamb for [Miss Everdene]167-miss everdene . "[165-mrs. hurst] said [Mrs. Hurst]165-mrs. hurst , musingly ; " though [she]167-miss everdene 's only [a visitor]3619-a visitor [here]575-here . " [The lamb]3621-the lamb is n't really the business [I]144-gabriel came about , [Mrs. Hurst]165-mrs. hurst . In short , [I]144-gabriel was going to ask [her]167-miss everdene if [she]167-miss everdene 'd like to be married . "[144-gabriel] " And were [you]144-gabriel indeed ? "[144-gabriel] " Yes . "[144-gabriel] " Let [me]165-mrs. hurst think , "[165-mrs. hurst] said [Mrs. Hurst]165-mrs. hurst , poking the fire superfluously .... " Yes - bless [you]589-you , [ever so many young men]3623-ever so many young men . [You]589-you see , [Farmer Oak]143-farmer oak , [she]167-miss everdene 's so good - looking , and [an excellent scholar]3624-an excellent scholar besides - [she]167-miss everdene was going to be [a governess]3625-a governess once , [you]589-you know , only [she]167-miss everdene was too wild . Not that [[her]167-miss everdene young men]3626-her young men ever come [here]575-here - but , [Lord]3628-lord , in the nature of [women]493-women , [she]167-miss everdene must have a dozen ! "[144-gabriel] " That 's unfortunate . "[143-farmer oak] said [Farmer Oak]143-farmer oak , contemplating a crack in the stone floor with sorrow . " [I]143-farmer oak 'm only [an every - day sort of man]3630-an every - day sort of man , and [my]143-farmer oak only chance was in being [the first comer]3631-the first comer ... , Well , there 's no use in [my]143-farmer oak waiting , for that was all [I]143-farmer oak came about : so [I]143-farmer oak 'll take [myself]143-farmer oak off [home]556-home - along , [Mrs. Hurst]165-mrs. hurst .
