CHAPTER XXVII HIVING [THE BEES THE Weatherbury]302-the bees the weatherbury bees were late in [their]302-the bees the weatherbury swarming this year . It was in the latter part of June , and the day after the interview with [Troy]243-bathsheba in [the hayfield]1682-the hayfield , that [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba was standing in [[her]167-miss everdene garden]4513-her garden , watching a swarm in the air and guessing [their]302-the bees the weatherbury probable settling place . Not only were [they]302-the bees the weatherbury late this year , but unruly . Sometimes through- out a whole season [all the swarms]1684-all the swarms would alight on the lowest attainable bough - such as part of a currant - bush or espalier apple - tree ; next year [they]302-the bees the weatherbury would , with just the same unanimity , make straight off to [the uppermost member of some tall , gaunt costard]1685-the uppermost member of some tall , gaunt costard , or quarrenden , and there defy [all invaders who did not come armed with ladders and staves]1686-all invaders who did not come armed with ladders and staves to take [them]302-the bees the weatherbury . This was the case at present . [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's eyes , shaded by one hand , were following [the ascending multitude]1687-the ascending multitude against the unexplorable stretch of blue till [they]302-the bees the weatherbury ultimately halted by one of the unwieldy trees spoken of . A process somewhat analogous to that of alleged formations of [the universe]885-the universe , time and times ago , was observable . The bustling swarm had swept the sky in a scattered and uniform haze , which now thickened to a nebulous centre : this glided on to a bough and grew still denser , till it formed a solid black spot upon the light . [The men]3799-the men and [women]493-women being all busily engaged in saving the hay - even [Liddy]191-liddy had left [the house]552-the house for the purpose of lending a hand - [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba resolved to hive the bees [herself]243-bathsheba , if possible . [She]167-miss everdene had dressed the hive with herbs and honey , fetched a ladder , brush , and crook , made [herself]167-miss everdene impregnable with armour of leather gloves , straw hat , and large gauze veil - once green but now faded to snuff colour - and ascended a dozen rungs of the ladder . At once [she]167-miss everdene heard , not ten yards off , a voice that was beginning to have a strange power in agitating [her]167-miss everdene . " [Miss Everdene]167-miss everdene , let [me]167-miss everdene assist [you]167-miss everdene ; [you]167-miss everdene should not attempt such a thing alone . "[167-miss everdene] [Troy]243-bathsheba was just opening the garden gate . [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba flung down the brush , crook , and empty hive , pulled the skirt of [her]167-miss everdene dress tightly round [her]167-miss everdene ankles in a tremendous flurry , and as well as [she]167-miss everdene could slid down the ladder . By the time [she]167-miss everdene reached the bottom [Troy]243-bathsheba was there also , and [he]243-bathsheba stooped to pick up the hive . " How fortunate [I]243-bathsheba am to have dropped in at this moment ! "[243-bathsheba] exclaimed [the sergeant]1330-the sergeant . [She]167-miss everdene found [her]167-miss everdene voice in a minute . " What ! and will [you]243-bathsheba shake them in for [me]243-bathsheba ? "[243-bathsheba] [she]167-miss everdene asked , in what , for [a defiant girl]1693-a defiant girl , was a faltering way ; though , for [a timid girl]1694-a timid girl , it would have seemed a brave way enough . " Will [I]243-bathsheba ! "[243-bathsheba] said [Troy]243-bathsheba . " Why , of course [I]243-bathsheba will . How blooming [you]243-bathsheba are to - day ! "[243-bathsheba] [Troy]243-bathsheba flung down [his]243-bathsheba cane and put [his]243-bathsheba foot on the ladder to ascend . " But [you]243-bathsheba must have on the veil and gloves , or [you]243-bathsheba 'll be stung fearfully ! "[243-bathsheba] " Ah , yes . [I]243-bathsheba must put on the veil and gloves . Will [you]243-bathsheba kindly show [me]243-bathsheba how to fix them properly ? "[243-bathsheba] " And [you]243-bathsheba must have the broad - brimmed hat , too , for [your]243-bathsheba cap has no brim to keep the veil off , and they 'd reach [your]243-bathsheba face . "[243-bathsheba] " The broad - brimmed hat , too , by all means . "[243-bathsheba] So a whimsical fate ordered that [her]167-miss everdene hat should be taken off - veil and all attached - and placed upon [his]243-bathsheba head , [Troy]243-bathsheba tossing [his]243-bathsheba own into a gooseberry bush . Then the veil had to be tied at its lower edge round [his]243-bathsheba collar and the gloves put on [him]243-bathsheba . [He]243-bathsheba looked such an extraordinary object in this guise that , flurried as [she]167-miss everdene was , [she]167-miss everdene could not avoid laughing outright . It was the removal of yet another stake from the palisade of cold manners which had kept [him]243-bathsheba off [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba looked on from the ground whilst [he]243-bathsheba was busy sweeping and shaking the bees from the tree , holding up the hive with the other hand for them to fall into . [She]167-miss everdene made use of an unobserved minute whilst [his]243-bathsheba attention was absorbed in the operation to arrange [her]167-miss everdene plumes a little . [He]243-bathsheba came down holding the hive at arm 's length , behind which trailed a cloud of bees . " Upon [my]243-bathsheba life . "[243-bathsheba] said [Troy]243-bathsheba , through the veil , " holding up this hive makes [one]4328-one 's arm ache worse than a week of sword - exercise . "[167-miss everdene] When the manoeuvre was complete [he]243-bathsheba approached [her]167-miss everdene . " Would [you]167-miss everdene be good enough to untie [me]167-miss everdene and let [me]167-miss everdene out ? [I]167-miss everdene am nearly stifled inside this silk cage . "[167-miss everdene] To hide [her]167-miss everdene embarrassment during the unwonted process of untying the string about [his]243-bathsheba neck , [she]167-miss everdene said : - " [I]167-miss everdene have never seen that [you]243-bathsheba spoke of . "[167-miss everdene] " What ? "[243-bathsheba] " The sword - exercise . "[167-miss everdene] " Ah ! would [you]167-miss everdene like to ? "[167-miss everdene] said [Troy]243-bathsheba . [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba hesitated . [She]167-miss everdene had heard wondrous reports from time to time by dwellers in [Weatherbury]196-joseph , who had by chance sojourned awhile in [Casterbridge]22-casterbridge , near [the barracks]1129-the barracks , of this strange and glorious perform- ance , tlie sword - exercise . [Men]474-men and [boys who had peeped through chinks or over walls]1697-boys who had peeped through chinks or over walls into [the barrack- yard]1698-the barrack- yard returned with accounts of [its]1698-the barrack- yard being the most flashing affair conceivable ; accoutrements and weapons glistening like stars - here , there , around - yet all by rule and compass . So [she]167-miss everdene said mildly what [she]167-miss everdene felt strongly . " Yes ; [I]167-miss everdene should like to see it very much . "[167-miss everdene] " And so [you]167-miss everdene shall ; [you]167-miss everdene shall see [me]167-miss everdene go through it . "[167-miss everdene] " No ! How ? "[167-miss everdene] " Let [me]167-miss everdene consider . "[167-miss everdene] " Not with a walking - stick - [I]243-bathsheba do n't care to see that . lt must be a real sword . "[243-bathsheba] " Yes , [I]243-bathsheba know ; and [I]243-bathsheba have no sword here ; but [I]243-bathsheba think [I]243-bathsheba could get one by the evening . Now , will [you]1699-you do this ? "[243-bathsheba] " O no , indeed ! "[439-nobody] said [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba , blushing . " Thank [you]1699-you very much , but [I]0-i could n't on any account . "[0-i] Surely [you]1699-you might ? [Nobody]439-nobody would know . " [She]0-i shook [her]0-i head , but with a weakened negation . "[0-i] If [I]0-i were to . " [she]0-i said , "[243-bathsheba] [I]0-i must bring [Liddy]191-liddy too . Might [I]0-i not ? " [Troy]243-bathsheba looked far away . "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't see why [you]243-bathsheba want to bring [her]191-liddy . " [he]243-bathsheba said coldly . An unconscious look of assent in [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's eyes betrayed that something more than [his]243-bathsheba coldness had made [her]0-i also feel that [Liddy]191-liddy Would be superfluous in the suggested scene . [She]0-i had felt it , even whilst making the proposal . "[0-i] Well , [I]0-i wo n't bring [Liddy]191-liddy - and [I]0-i 'll come . But only for a very short time . " [she]0-i added ; "[0-i] a very short time . " "[1701-you] It will not take five minutes . " said [Troy]243-bathsheba . CHAPTER XXVIII THE HOLLOW AMID THE FERNS THE hill opposite [[Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's dwelling]4824-bathsheba 's dwelling extended , a mile off , into [an uncultivated tract of land , dotted at this season with tall thickets of brake fern]4825-an uncultivated tract of land , dotted at this season with tall thickets of brake fern , plump and diaphanous from recent rapid growth , and radiant in hues of clear and untainted green . At eight o'clock this midsummer evening , whilst the bristling ball of gold in the west still swept the tips of the ferns with its long , luxuriant rays , a soft brushing- by of garments might have been heard among them , and [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba appeared in [their]4826-their midst , [their]4826-their soft , feathery arms caressing [her]0-i up to [her]0-i shoulders . [She]0-i paused , turned , went back over [the hill]3452-the hill and half - way to [her]0-i own door , whence [she]0-i cast a farewell glance upon [the spot [she]0-i had just left]4828-the spot she had just left , having resolved not to remain near [the place]3486-the place after all . [She]0-i saw [a dim spot of artificial red moving round the shoulder of the rise]4830-a dim spot of artificial red moving round the shoulder of the rise . It disappeared on the other side . [She]0-i waited one minute - two minutes - thought of [Troy]243-bathsheba 's disappointment at [her]0-i non - fulfilment of a promised engagement , till [she]0-i again ran along [the field]3467-the field , clambered over [the bank]4832-the bank , and followed the original direction . [She]0-i was now literally trembling and panting at this [her]0-i temerity in such an errant undertaking ; [her]0-i breath came and went quickly , and [her]0-i eyes shone with an in- frequent light . Yet go [she]0-i must . [She]0-i reached the verge of [a pit in the middle of the ferns]4833-a pit in the middle of the ferns . [Troy]243-bathsheba stood in the bottom , looking up towards [her]1701-you . "[1703-guards] [I]0-i heard [you]1701-you rustling through the fern before [I]0-i saw [you]1701-you . " [he]243-bathsheba said , coming up and giving [her]1701-you [his]243-bathsheba hand to help [her]1701-you down [the slope]4834-the slope . [The pit]636-the pit was a saucer - shaped concave , naturally formed , with a top diameter of about thirty feet , and shallow enough to allow the sunshine to reach [their]1702-their heads . Standing in the centre , the sky overhead was met by a circular horizon of fern : this grew nearly to the bottom of the slope and then abruptly ceased . [The middle within the belt of verdure]4836-the middle within the belt of verdure was floored with a thick flossy carpet of moss and grass intermingled , so yielding that the foot was half - buried within it . "[1701-you] Now . " said [Troy]243-bathsheba , producing the sword , which , as [he]243-bathsheba raised it into the sunlight , gleamed a sort of greeting , like a living thing , "[1701-you] first , [we]1702-their have four right and four left cuts ; four right and four left thrusts . Infantry cuts and [guards]1703-guards are more interesting than [ours]1702-their , to [my]0-i mind ; but they are not so swashing . [They]1704-they have seven cuts and three thrusts . So much as a preliminary . Well , next , [our]1702-their cut one is as if [you]1701-you were sowing [your]1701-you corn - so . " [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba saw a sort of rainbow , upside down in the air , and [Troy]243-bathsheba 's arm was still again . "[1705-one , two , three , four , right] Cut two , as if [you]1701-you were hedging - so . Three , as if [you]1701-you were reaping - so . " Four , as if [you]1701-you were threshing - in that way . "[1705-one , two , three , four , right] Then the same on the left . The thrusts are these : [one , two , three , four , right]1705-one , two , three , four , right ; one , two , three , four , left . " [He]243-bathsheba repeated them . "[1705-one , two , three , four , right] Have 'em again ? " [he]243-bathsheba said . "[1703-guards] One , two - - " [She]0-i hurriedly interrupted : "[1703-guards] [I]0-i 'd rather not ; though [I]0-i do n't mind [your]1701-you twos and fours ; but [your]1701-you ones and threes are terrible ! " "[1703-guards] Very well . [I]0-i 'll let [you]1701-you off the ones and threes . Next , cuts , points and [guards]1703-guards altogether . " [Troy]243-bathsheba duly exhibited them . "[1703-guards] Then there 's pursuing practice , in this way . " [He]243-bathsheba gave the movements as before . "[1703-guards] There , those are the stereotyped forms . [The infantry]1707-the infantry have two most diabolical upward cuts , which [we]1708-we are too humane to use . Like this - three , four . " "[0-i] How murderous and bloodthirsty ! " "[1701-you] They are rather deathy . Now [I]0-i 'll be more inter- esting , and let [you]1701-you see some loose play - giving all the cuts and points , [infantry]1709-infantry and cavalry , quicker than lightning , and as promiscuously - with just enough rule to regulate instinct and yet not to fetter it . [You]1701-you are [[my]0-i antagonist]1710-my antagonist , with this difference from real warfare , that [I]0-i shall miss [you]1701-you every time by one hair 's breadth , or perhaps two . Mind [you]1701-you do n't flinch , whatever [you]1701-you do . " [I]243-bathsheba 'll be sure not to ! "[243-bathsheba] [she]0-i said invincibly . [He]1701-you pointed to about [a yard in front of [him]1701-you]1711-a yard in front of him . [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's adventurous spirit was beginning to find some grains of relish in these highly novel proceedings . [She]0-i took up [her]0-i position as directed , facing [Troy]243-bathsheba . " Now just to learn whether [you]0-i have pluck enough to let [me]0-i do what [I]0-i wish , [I]0-i 'll give [you]0-i a preliminary test . "[0-i] [He]1701-you flourished the sword by way of introduction number two , and the next thing of which [she]0-i was conscious was that the point and blade of the sword were darting with a gleam towards [her]0-i left side , just above [her]0-i hip ; then of [their]1712-their reappearance on [her]0-i right side , emerging as it were from between [her]0-i ribs , having apparently passed through [her]0-i body . The third item of consciousness was that of seeing the same sword , perfectly clean and free from blood held vertically in [Troy]243-bathsheba 's hand in the position technically called " recover swords "[0-i] . All was as quick as electricity . " Oh ! "[243-bathsheba] [she]0-i cried out in affright , pressing [her]0-i hand to [her]0-i side . " Have [you]243-bathsheba run [me]243-bathsheba through ? - no , [you]243-bathsheba have not ! Whatever have [you]243-bathsheba done ! "[243-bathsheba] " [I]0-i have not touched [you]0-i . "[0-i] said [Troy]243-bathsheba , quietly . " It was mere sleight of hand . The sword passed behind [you]0-i . Now [you]0-i are not afraid , are [you]0-i ? Because if [you]0-i are l ca n't perform . [I]0-i give [my]0-i word that l will not only not hurt [you]0-i , but not once touch [you]0-i . "[0-i] " [I]243-bathsheba do n't think [I]243-bathsheba am afraid . [You]243-bathsheba are quite sure [you]243-bathsheba will not hurt [me]243-bathsheba ? "[243-bathsheba] " Quite sure . "[0-i] " Is the sWord very sharp ? "[243-bathsheba] " O no - only stand as still as a statue . Now ! "[0-i] In an instant the atmosphere was transformed to [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's eyes . Beams of light caught from the low sun 's rays , above , around , in front of [her]1713-her , well - nigh shut out earth and heaven - all emitted in the marvellous evolutions of [Troy]243-bathsheba 's reflecting blade , which seemed everywhere at once , and yet nowherre specially . These circling gleams were accompanied by a keen rush that was almost a whistling - also springing from all sides of [her]1713-her at once . In short , [she]1713-her was enclosed in a firmament of light , and of sharp hisses , resembling a sky - full of meteors close at hand . Never since the broadsword became the national weapon had there been more dexterity shown in its management than by the hands of [Sergeant Troy]243-bathsheba , and never had [he]243-bathsheba been in such splendid temper for the performance as now in the evening sunshine among the ferns with [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba . It may safely be asserted with respect to the closeness of [his]243-bathsheba cuts , that had it been possible for the edge of the sword to leave in the air a permanent substance wherever it flew past , the space left untouched would have been almost a mould of [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's figure . Behind the luminous streams of this aurora militaris , [she]1713-her could see the hue of [Troy]243-bathsheba 's sword arm , spread in a scarlet haze over the space covered by its motions , like a twanged harpstring , and behind all [Troy]243-bathsheba [himself]243-bathsheba , mostly facing [her]1713-her ; sometimes , to show the rear cuts , half turned away , [his]243-bathsheba eye nevertheless always keenly measuring [her]1713-her breadth and outline , and [his]243-bathsheba lips tightly closed in sustained effort . Next , [his]243-bathsheba movements lapsed slower , and [she]1713-her could see them individually . The hissing of the sword had ceased , and [he]243-bathsheba stopped entirely . " That outer loose lock of hair wants tidying , [he]243-bathsheba said , before [she]1713-her had moved or spoken . "[0-i] Wait : [I]0-i 'll do it for [you]1713-her . " An arc of silver shone on [her]1713-her right side : the sword had descended . The lock droped to the ground . "[1713-her] Bravely borne ! " said [Troy]243-bathsheba . "[1713-her] [You]1713-her did n't flinch a shade 's thickness . Wonderful in [a woman]459-a woman ! " "[1713-her] It was because [I]0-i did n't expect it . O , [you]1713-her have spoilt [my]0-i hair ! " "[0-i] Only once more . " "[0-i] No - no ! [I]0-i am afraid of [you]243-bathsheba - indeed [I]0-i am ! " [she]1713-her cried . "[0-i] [I]0-i wo n't touch [you]243-bathsheba at all - not even [your]243-bathsheba hair . [I]0-i am only going to kill that caterpillar settling on [you]243-bathsheba . Now : still ! " It appeared that [a caterpillar]4837-a caterpillar had come from the fern and chosen the front of [her]1713-her bodice as [his]4837-a caterpillar resting place . [She]1713-her saw the point glisten towards [her]1713-her bosom , and seemingly enter it . [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba closed [her]1713-her eyes in the full persuasion that [she]1713-her was killed at last . How- ever , feeling just as usual , [she]1713-her opened them again . "[0-i] There it is , look . " said [the sargeant]4838-the sargeant , holding [his]4838-the sargeant sword before [her]1713-her eyes . The caterpillar was spitted upon its point . "[0-i] Why , it is magic ! " said [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba , amazed . "[0-i] O no - dexterity . [I]0-i merely gave point to [your]243-bathsheba bosom where the caterpillar was , and instead of running [you]243-bathsheba through checked the extension a thousandth of an inch short of [your]243-bathsheba surface . " "[0-i] But how could [you]0-i chop off a curl of [my]0-i hair with a sword that has no edge ? " "[0-i] No edge ! This sword will shave like a razor . Look here . " [He]4838-the sargeant touched the palm of [his]4838-the sargeant hand with the blade , and then , lifting it , showed [her]1713-her a thin shaving of scarf- skin dangling therefrom . "[0-i] But [you]0-i said before beginning that it was blunt and could n't cut [me]0-i ! " "[0-i] That was to get [you]243-bathsheba to stand still , and so make sure of [your]243-bathsheba safety . The risk of injuring [you]243-bathsheba through [your]243-bathsheba moving was too great not to force [me]0-i to tell [you]243-bathsheba a fib to escape it . " [She]1713-her shuddered . "[243-bathsheba] [I]0-i have been within an inch of [my]0-i life , and did n't know it ! " "[243-bathsheba] More precisely speaking , [you]243-bathsheba have been within half an inch of being pared alive two hundred and ninety - five tinies . " "[0-i] Cruel , cruel , ' tis of [you]0-i ! " "[0-i] [You]243-bathsheba have been perfectly safe , nevertheless . [My]0-i sword never errs . " And [Troy]243-bathsheba returned the weapon to the scabbard . [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba , overcome by a hundred tumultuous feel- ings resulting from the scene , abstractedly sat down on a tuft of heather . "[0-i] [I]0-i must leave [you]243-bathsheba now . " said [Troy]243-bathsheba , softly . "[243-bathsheba] And [I]0-i 'll venture to take and keep this in remembrance of [you]243-bathsheba . " [She]1713-her saw [him]243-bathsheba stoop to the grass , pick up the winding lock which [he]243-bathsheba had severed from [her]1713-her manifold tresses , twist it round [his]243-bathsheba fingers , unfasten a button in the breast of [his]243-bathsheba coat , and carefully put it inside . [She]1713-her felt power- less to withstand or deny [him]243-bathsheba . [He]243-bathsheba was altogether too much for [her]1713-her , and [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba seemed as one who , facing a reviving wind , finds it blow so strongly that it stops the breath . [He]243-bathsheba drew near and said , "[459-a woman] [I]0-i must be leaving [you]243-bathsheba . " [He]243-bathsheba drew nearer still . A minute later and [she]1713-her saw [his]243-bathsheba scarlet form disappear amid the ferny thicket , almost in a flash , like a brand swiftly waved . That minute 's interval had brought the blood beating into [her]1713-her face , set [her]1713-her stinging as if aflame to the very hollows of [her]1713-her feet , and enlarged emotion to a compass which quite swamped thought . It had brought upon [her]1713-her a stroke resulting , as did that of [Moses]270-moses in [Horeh]74-horeh , in a liquid stream - here a stream of tears . [She]1713-her felt like [one who has sinned a great sin]4839-one who has sinned a great sin . The circumstance had been the gentle dip of [Troy]243-bathsheba 's mouth downwards upon [her]1713-her own . [He]243-bathsheba had kissed [her]1713-her . CHAPTER XXIX PARTICULARS OF A TWILIGHT WALK [WE]4840-we now see the element of folly distinctly mingling with the many varying particulars which made up the character of [Bathsheba Everdene]243-bathsheba . It was almost foreign to [her]1713-her intrinsic nature . Introduced as lymph on the dart of [Eros]267-eros , it eventually permeated and coloured [her]1713-her whole constitution . [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba , though [she]1713-her had too much understanding to be entirely governed by [her]1713-her womanliness , had too much womanliness to use [her]1713-her understanding to the best advantage . Perhaps in no minor point does [woman]473-woman astonish [her]473-woman helpmate more than in the strange power [she]473-woman possesses of believing cajoleries that [she]473-woman knows to be false - except , indeed , in that of being utterly sceptical on strictures that [she]473-woman knows to be true . [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba loved [Troy]243-bathsheba in the way that only self - reliant women love when [they]473-woman abandon [their]473-woman self - reliance . When [a strong woman]4842-a strong woman recklessly throws away [her]4842-a strong woman strength [she]4842-a strong woman is worse than [a weak woman who has never had any strength to throw away]4843-a weak woman who has never had any strength to throw away . One source of [her]1713-her inadequacy is the novelty of the occasion . [She]1713-her has never had practice in making the best of such a condition . Weakness is doubly weak by being new . [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba was not conscious of guile in this matter . Though in one sense [a woman of [the world]447-the world]4844-a woman of the world , it was , after all , [that world of daylight coteries]4846-that world of daylight coteries and green carpets wherein cattle form [the passing crowd and winds the busy hum]4847-the passing crowd and winds the busy hum ; where [a quiet family of rabbits or hares]4848-a quiet family of rabbits or hares lives on the other side of [your]4849-your party - wall , where [[your]4849-your neigh- bour]4850-your neigh- bour is [everybody]954-everybody in the tything , and where calculation formulated self - indulgence of bad , nothing at all . Had [her]1713-her utmost thoughts in this direction been distinctly worded and by [herself]1713-her they never were , they would only have amounted to such a matter as that [she]1713-her felt [her]1713-her impulses to be pleasanter guides than [her]1713-her discretion . [Her]1713-her love was entire as [a child]786-a child 's , and though warm as summer it was fresh as spring . [Her]1713-her culpability lay in [her]1713-her making no attempt to control feeling by subtle and careful inquiry into consciences . [She]1713-her could show [others]4853-others the steep and thorny way , but ' reck'd not [her]1713-her own rede , "[4518-his mistress] And [Troy]243-bathsheba 's deformities lay deep down from [a woman]459-a woman 's vision , whilst [his]243-bathsheba embellishments were upon the very surface ; thus contrasting with homely [Oak]144-gabriel , whose defects were patent to the blindest , and whose vertues were as metals in [a mine]1716-a mine . The difference between love and respect was mark- edly shown in [her]459-a woman conduct . [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba had spoken of [her]459-a woman interest in [Boldwood]224-boldwood with the greatest freedom to [Liddy]191-liddy , but [she]459-a woman had only communed with [her]459-a woman own heart concerning " [Troy]243-bathsheba "[4518-his mistress] . All this infatuation [Gabriel]144-gabriel saw , and was troubled thereby from the time of [his]144-gabriel daily journey a - field to the time of [his]144-gabriel return , and on to the small hours of many a night . That [he]144-gabriel was not beloved had hitherto been [his]144-gabriel great that [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba was getting into the toils was now a sorrow greater than the first , and one which nearly obscured it . It was a result which paralleled the oft - quoted observation of [Hippocrates]303-hippocrates concerning physical pains . That is a noble though perhaps an unpromising love which not even the fear of breeding aversion in the bosom of [the one beloved]1717-the one beloved can deter from combating [his]1718-his or [her]1719-her errors . [Oak]144-gabriel determined to speak to [[his]144-gabriel mistress]4518-his mistress . [He]144-gabriel would base [his]144-gabriel appeal on what [he]144-gabriel considered [her]4518-his mistress unfair treatment of [Farmer Boldwood]231-boldwood , now absent from [home]556-home . An opportunity occurred one evening when [she]4518-his mistress had gone for a short walk by a path through [the neighbour- ing cornfields]1722-the neighbour- ing cornfields . It was dusk when [Oak]144-gabriel , who had not been far [a - field that day]1723-a - field that day , took [the same path]1724-the same path and met [her]4518-his mistress returning , quite pensively , as [he]144-gabriel thought . The wheat was now tall , and the path was narrow ; thus the way was quite a sunken groove between the embowing thicket on either side . [Two persons]1725-two persons could not walk abreast without damaging the crop , and [Oak]144-gabriel stood aside to let [her]4518-his mistress pass . " Oh , is it [Gabriel]144-gabriel ? "[144-gabriel] [she]4518-his mistress said . " [You]144-gabriel are taking a walk too . Good - night . "[4518-his mistress] " [I]4518-his mistress thought [I]4518-his mistress would come to meet [you]4518-his mistress , as it is rather late , "[4518-his mistress] said [Oak]144-gabriel , turning and following at [her]4518-his mistress heels when [she]4518-his mistress had brushed somewhat quickly by [him]144-gabriel . " Thank [you]4518-his mistress , indeed , but [I]4518-his mistress am not very fearful . "[4518-his mistress] " O no ; but there are [bad characters]4854-bad characters about . "[4518-his mistress] " [I]144-gabriel never meet [them]4854-bad characters . "[144-gabriel] Now [Oak]144-gabriel , with marvellous ingenuity , had been going to introduce [the gallant sergeant]1613-the gallant sergeant through the channel of " bad characters . "[144-gabriel] But all at once the scheme broke down , it suddenly occurring to [him]144-gabriel that this was rather a clumsy way , and too barefaced to begin with . [He]144-gabriel tried another preamble . " Since this subject has been mentioned . "[1729-i] [she]1011-miss said very emphatically , " [I]1729-i am glad of the opportunity of clearing up a mistake which is very common and very provoking . " [he]224-boldwood went on . "[0-i] Come , listen to [me]0-i ! "[144-gabriel] It is more than probable that [she]1776-her privately and un- consciously respected [him]1777-his a little for this grim fidelity , which had been shown in [his]1777-his tone even more than in [his]1777-his words . [She]1776-her said more distinctly , " Will [you]144-gabriel leave [me]243-bathsheba alone now ? "[243-bathsheba] " Certainly [I]1776-her will , [Miss Everdene]167-miss everdene . "[1776-her] said [Gabriel]144-gabriel , gently . [He]144-gabriel wondered that the request should have come at this moment , for the strife was over , and [they]1778-they were on [a most desolate hill]1779-a most desolate hill , far from every human habitation , and the hour was getting late . [He]144-gabriel stood still and allowed [her]1776-her to get far ahead of [him]144-gabriel till [he]144-gabriel could only see [her]1776-her form upon the sky . A distressing explanation of this anxiety to be rid of [him]144-gabriel at that point now ensued . A figure apparently rose from the earth beside [her]1776-her . The shape beyond all doubt was [Troy]243-bathsheba 's . [Oak]144-gabriel would not be even a possible listener , and at once turned back till a good two hundred yards were between [the lovers]1780-the lovers and [himself]144-gabriel . [Gabriel]144-gabriel went [home]556-home by way of [the churchyard]3813-the churchyard . In passing [the tower]4309-the tower [he]144-gabriel thought of what [she]1776-her had said about [the sergeant]1330-the sergeant 's virtuous habit of entering [the church]489-the church un- PARTICULARS OF A TWILIGHT WALK perceived at the beginning of service . Believing that the little gallery door alluded to was quite disused , [he]144-gabriel ascended the external flight of steps at the top of which [it]1786-it stood , and examined [it]1786-it . The pale lustre yet hanging in the north - western heaven was sufficient to show that a sprig of ivy had grown from the wall across the door to a length of more than a foot , delicately tying the panel to the stone jamb . It was a decisive proof that the door had not been opened at least since [Troy]243-bathsheba came back to [Weatherbury]196-joseph . CHAPTER XXX [HOT CHEEKS AND TEARFUL EYES]307-hot cheeks and tearful eyes HALF an hour later [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba entered [[her]1776-her own house]1787-her own house . There burnt upon [her]1776-her face when [she]1776-her met the light of the candles the flush and excitement which were little less than chronic with [her]1776-her now . The farewell words of [Troy]243-bathsheba , who had accompanied [her]1776-her to the very door , still lingered in [her]1776-her ears . [He]243-bathsheba had bidden [her]1776-her adieu for two days , which were so [he]243-bathsheba stated , to be spent at Bath in visiting [some friends]1788-some friends . [He]243-bathsheba had also kissed [her]1776-her a second time . It is only fair to [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba to explain here a little fact which did not come to light till a long time after- wards : that [Troy]243-bathsheba 's presentation of [himself]243-bathsheba so aptly at the roadside this evening was not by any distinctly pre- concerted arrangement . [He]243-bathsheba had hinted - [she]1776-her had forbidden ; and it was only on the chance of [his]243-bathsheba still coming that [she]1776-her had dismissed [Oak]144-gabriel , fearing a meeting between [them]1789-them just then . [She]1776-her now sank down into a chair , wild and perturbed by all these new and fevering sequences . Then [she]1776-her jumped up with a manner of decision , and fetched [her]1776-her desk from a side table . In three minutes , without pause or modification , [she]1776-her had written a letter to [Boldwood]224-boldwood , at [[his]224-boldwood address beyond [Casterbridge]22-casterbridge]1790-his address beyond casterbridge , saying mildly but firmly that [she]1776-her had well considered the whole subject [he]224-boldwood had brought before [her]1776-her and kindly given [her]1776-her time to decide upon ; that [her]1776-her final decision was that [she]1776-her could not marry [him]224-boldwood . [She]1776-her had expressed to [Oak]144-gabriel an intention to wait till [Boldwood]224-boldwood came [home]556-home before communicating to [him]144-gabriel [her]1776-her conclusive reply . But [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba found that [she]1776-her could not wait . It was impossible to send this letter till the next day ; yet to quell [her]1776-her uneasiness by getting it out of [her]1776-her hands , and so , as it were , setting the act in motion at once , [she]1776-her arose to take it to [any one of [the women who might be in the kitchen]1793-the women who might be in the kitchen]1792-any one of the women who might be in the kitchen . [She]1776-her paused in the passage . A dialogue was going on in [the kitchen]4050-the kitchen , and [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba and [Troy]243-bathsheba were the subject of it . " If [he]243-bathsheba marry [her]1776-her , [she]1776-her 'll gie up farming . "[243-bathsheba] " Twill be a gallant life , but may bring some trouble between the mirth - so say [I.]243-bathsheba "[1776-her] " Well , [I]191-liddy wish [I]191-liddy had half [such a husband]4872-such a husband . "[191-liddy] [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba had too much sense to mind seriously what [[her]1776-her servitors]1795-her servitors said about [her]1776-her ; but too much womanly redundance of speech to leave alone what was said till it died the natural death of unminded things . " Yes ; [you]191-liddy must be [a blind thing]4890-a blind thing , [Liddy]191-liddy ! "[1803-i] [she]1803-i said , in reckless abandonment and grief . " O , [I]191-liddy love [him]1802-him to very distraction and misery and agony ! "[191-liddy] [She]1803-i put [her]1803-i arms round [Liddy]191-liddy 's neck . " [I]1803-i must let it out to [somebody]3576-somebody ; it is wearing [me]1803-i away ! "[224-boldwood] CHAPTER XXXI BLAME - FURY THE next evening [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba , with the idea of getting out of the way of [Mr. Boldwood]224-boldwood in the event of [his]224-boldwood returning to answer [her]1821-me note in person , proceeded to fulfil an engagement made with [Liddy]191-liddy some few hours earlier . [[Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's companion]1822-bathsheba 's companion , as a gage of [their]1823-their reconciliation , had been granted a week 's holiday to visit [[her]1821-me sister]1824-her sister , who was married to [a thriving hurdler and cattle - crib - maker]1825-a thriving hurdler and cattle - crib - maker living in [a delightful labyrinth of hazel copse not far beyond [Yalbury]44-yalbury]1826-a delightful labyrinth of hazel copse not far beyond yalbury . The arrangement was that [Miss Everdene]167-miss everdene should honour [them]1823-their by coming [there]3509-there for a day or two to inspect some ingenious con- trivances which [this man of [the woods]1829-the woods]1828-this man of the woods had introduced into [his]224-boldwood wares . Leaving [her]167-miss everdene instructions with [Gabriel]144-gabriel and [Maryann]179-maryann , that [they]1823-their were to see everything carefully locked up for the night , [she]167-miss everdene went out of [the house]552-the house just at the close of a timely thunder - shower , which had refined the air , and daintily bathed the coat of [the land]1831-the land , though all beneath was dry as ever . Freshness was exhaled in an essence from the varied contours of bank and hollow , as if [the earth]1149-the earth breathed maiden breath ; and the pleased birds were hymning to the scene . Before [her]167-miss everdene , among the clouds , there was a contrast in the shape of lairs of fierce light which showed themselves in the neighbour- hood of a hidden sun , lingering on to [the farthest north- west corner of the heavens]1833-the farthest north- west corner of the heavens that this midsummer season allowed . [She]167-miss everdene had walked nearly two miles of [her]167-miss everdene journey , watching how the day was retreating , and thinking how the time of deeds was quietly melting into the time of thought , to give place in its turn to the time of prayer and sleep , when [she]167-miss everdene beheld advancing over [Yalbury]44-yalbury hill [the very man [she]167-miss everdene sought so anxiously to elude]1834-the very man she sought so anxiously to elude . [Boldwood]224-boldwood was stepping on , not with that quiet tread of reserved strength which was [his]224-boldwood customary gait , in which [he]224-boldwood always seemed to be balancing two thoughts . [His]224-boldwood manner was stunned and sluggish now . [Boldwood]224-boldwood had for the first time been awakened to [woman]473-woman 's privileges in tergiversation even when it involves [another person]1836-another person 's possible blight . That [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba was [a firm and positive girl]1837-a firm and positive girl , far less inconsequent than [[her]1837-a firm and positive girl fellows]1838-her fellows , had been the very lung of [his]224-boldwood hope ; for [he]224-boldwood had held that these qualities would lead [her]1837-a firm and positive girl to adhere to a straight course for consistency 's sake , and accept [him]224-boldwood , though [her]1837-a firm and positive girl fancy might not flood [him]224-boldwood with the iridescent hues of uncritical love . But the argument now came back as sorry gleams from a broken mirror . The dis- covery was no less a scourge than a surprise . [He]224-boldwood came on looking upon the ground , and did not see [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba till [they]1839-they were less than a stone 's throw apart . [He]224-boldwood looked up at the sound of [her]1837-a firm and positive girl pit - pat , and [his]224-boldwood changed appearance sufficiently denoted to [her]1837-a firm and positive girl the depth and strength of the feelings paralyzed by [her]1837-a firm and positive girl letter . " Oh ; is it [you]224-boldwood , [Mr. Boldwood]224-boldwood ? "[224-boldwood] [she]1837-a firm and positive girl faltered , a guilty warmth pulsing in [her]1837-a firm and positive girl face . [Those who have the power of reproaching in silence]1840-those who have the power of reproaching in silence may find it a means more effective than words . There are accents in the eye which are not on the tongue , and more tales come from pale lips than can enter an ear . It is both the grandeur and the pain of the remoter moods that they avoid the pathway of sound . Bold- wood 's look was unanswerable . Seeing [she]1837-a firm and positive girl turned a little aside , [he]224-boldwood said , " What , are [you]1837-a firm and positive girl afraid of [me]1837-a firm and positive girl ? "[1849-i] The swift music of [her]1851-her heart became hubbub now , and [she]1851-her throbbed to extremity . [He]1849-i was coming to [Troy]243-bathsheba . [He]1849-i did then know what had occurred ! And the name fell from [his]1849-i lips the next moment . " Why did [Troy]243-bathsheba not leave [my]1852-i treasure alone ? "[1852-i] [he]1849-i asked , fiercely . " When [I]1852-i had no thought of injuring [him]243-bathsheba , why did [he]243-bathsheba force [himself]243-bathsheba upon [your]1847-you notice ! Before [he]243-bathsheba worried [you]1847-you [your]1847-you inclination was to have [me]1852-i ; when next [I]1852-i should have come to [you]1847-you [your]1847-you answer would have been Yes . Can [you]1847-you deny it - [I]1852-i ask , can [you]1847-you deny it ? "[1852-i] [She]1852-i delayed the reply , but was to honest to with hold it . " [I]1854-i can not . "[1854-i] [she]1852-i whispered . " [I]1853-you know [you]1849-i can not . But [he]243-bathsheba stole in in [my]1853-you absence and robbed [me]1853-you . Now [the people]4933-the people sneer at [me]1853-you - [the very hills]4934-the very hills and sky seem to laugh at [me]1853-you till [I]1853-you blush shamefuly for [my]1853-you folly . [I]1853-you have lost [my]1853-you respect , [my]1853-you good name , [my]1853-you standing - lost it , never to get it again . Go and marry [[your]1847-you man]4935-your man - go on ! "[1853-you] " O sir - [Mr. Boldwood]224-boldwood ! "[1854-i] " [You]1847-you may as well . [I]1854-i have no further claim upon [you]1847-you . "[198-jan.] For a moment [Boldwood]224-boldwood stood so inertly after this that [his]224-boldwood soul seemed to have been entirely exhaled with the breath of [his]224-boldwood passionate words . [He]224-boldwood turned [his]224-boldwood face away , and withdrew , and [his]224-boldwood form was soon covered over by the twilight as [his]224-boldwood footsteps mixed in with the low hiss of the leafy trees . [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba , who had been standing motionless as [a model]1858-a model all this latter time , flung [her]1859-her hands to [her]1859-her face , and wildly attempted to ponder on the exhibition which had just passed away . Such astounding wells of fevered feeling in [a still man like [Mr. Boldwood]224-boldwood]1860-a still man like mr. boldwood were incompre- hensible , dreadful . Instead of being [a man trained to repression [he]224-boldwood was]1861-a man trained to repression he was - what [she]1859-her had seen [him]224-boldwood . The force of [the farmer]3540-the farmer 's threats lay in their relation to a circumstance known at present only to [herself]1859-her : [[her]1859-her lover]1863-her lover was coming back to [Weatherby]78-weatherby in the course of the very next day or two . [Troy]243-bathsheba had not returned to [[his]243-bathsheba distant barracks]1864-his distant barracks as [Boldwood]224-boldwood and [others]618-others supposed , but had merely gone to visit [some acquaintance in [Bath]79-bath]1866-some acquaintance in bath , and had yet a week or more remaining to [his]243-bathsheba furlough . [She]1859-her felt wretchedly certain that if [he]243-bathsheba revisited [her]1859-her just at this nick of time , and came into contact with [Boldwood]224-boldwood , a fierce quarrel would be the consequence . [She]1859-her panted with solicitude when [she]1859-her thought of possible injury to [Troy]243-bathsheba . The least spark would kindle [the farmer]3540-the farmer 's swift feelings of rage and jealousy ; [he]243-bathsheba would lose [his]243-bathsheba self - mastery as [he]243-bathsheba had this evening ; [Troy]243-bathsheba 's blitheness might become aggressive ; it might take the direction of derision , and [Boldwood]224-boldwood 's anger might then take the direction of revenge . With almost a morbid dread of being thought [a gushing girl]1868-a gushing girl , [this guileless woman too well concealed from [the world]447-the world under a manner of carelessness the warm depths of [her]1859-her strong emotions]1869-this guileless woman too well concealed from the world under a manner of carelessness the warm depths of her strong emotions . But now there was no reserve . In fer [her]1859-her distraction , instead of advancing further [she]1859-her walked up and down , beating the air with [her]1859-her fingers , pressing on [her]1859-her brow , and sobbing brokenly to [herself]1859-her . Then [she]1859-her sat down on a heap of stones by the wayside to think . There [she]1859-her remained long . Above the dark margin of [the earth]1149-the earth appeared foreshores and promontor- ies of coppery cloud , bounding a green and pellucid expanse in the western sky . Amaranthine glosses came over [them]1872-their then , and the unresting world wheeled [her]1859-her round to a contrasting prospect eastward , in the shape of indecisive and palpitating stars . [She]1859-her gazed upon their silent throes amid the shades of space , but realised none at all . [Her]1859-her troubled spirit was far away with [Troy]243-bathsheba . CHAPTER XXXII NIGHT - HORSES TRAMPING [THE village of Weatherbury]676-the village of weatherbury was quiet as [the graveyard]1874-the graveyard in [its]676-the village of weatherbury midst , and [the living]1875-the living were lying well nigh as still as the dead . The church clock struck eleven . The air was so empty of other sounds that the whirr of the clock - work immediately before the strokes was distinct , and so was also the click of the same at [their]1872-their close . The notes flew forth with the usual blind obtuseness of inanimate things - flapping and rebounding among walls , undulating against the scattered clouds , spreading through [their]1872-their interstices into unexplored miles of space . [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's crannied and [mouldy halls]1876-mouldy halls were to - night occupied only by [Maryann]179-maryann , [Liddy]191-liddy being , as was stated , with [[her]179-maryann sister]1824-her sister , whom [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba had set out to visit . A few minutes after eleven had struck , [Maryann]179-maryann turned in [her]179-maryann bed with a sense of being disturbed . [She]179-maryann was totally unconscious of the nature of the interruption to [her]179-maryann sleep . It led to a dream , and the dream to an awakening , with an uneasy sensation that something had happened . [She]179-maryann left [her]179-maryann bed and looked out of the window . [The paddock]1878-the paddock abutted on this end of [the building]3834-the building , and in [the paddock]1878-the paddock [she]179-maryann could just discern by the uncertain gray a moving figure approaching the horse that was feeding there . [The figure]1157-the figure seized the horse by the forelock , and led [it]1157-the figure to the corner of [the field]3467-the field . Here [she]179-maryann could see some object which circum- stances proved to be [a vehicle]685-a vehicle for after a few minutes the horse down [the road]477-the road , mingled with the sound of light wheels . [Two varieties only of humanity]1885-two varieties only of humanity could have entered [the paddock]1878-the paddock with the ghostlike glide of [that mysterious figure]1887-that mysterious figure . [They]1888-they were [a woman]459-a woman and [a gipsy man]1890-a gipsy man . [A woman]459-a woman was out of the question in such an occupation at this hour , and [the comer]1892-the comer could be no less than [a thief]1109-a thief , who might probably have known the weakness of [the house- hold]1894-the house- hold on this particular night , and have chosen it on that account for [his]1890-a gipsy man daring attempt . Moreover , to raise suspicion to conviction itself , there were [gipsies]1895-gipsies in ! [Weatherbury Bottom]80-weatherbury bottom . [Maryann]179-maryann , who had been afraid to shout in [the robber]1896-the robber 's presence , having seen [him]1896-the robber depart had no fear . [She]179-maryann hastily slipped on [her]179-maryann clothes , stumped down the dis- jointed staircase with its hundred creaks , ran to [[Coggan]180-coggan 's]1897-coggan 's , [the nearest house]1898-the nearest house , and raised an alarm . [Coggan]180-coggan called [Gabriel]144-gabriel , who now again lodged in [[his]144-gabriel house]637-his house as at first , and together [they]1900-we went to [the paddock]1878-the paddock . Beyond all doubt the horse was gone . " Hark ! "[179-maryann] said [Gabriel]144-gabriel . [They]1900-we listened . Distinct upon the stagnant air came the sounds of a trotting horse passing up [Longpuddle Lane]81-longpuddle lane - just beyond [[the gipsies]1902-the gipsies ' encampment in [Weather- bury Bottom]82-weather- bury bottom]1903-the gipsies ' encampment in weather- bury bottom . " That 's [our]1900-we Dainty - i'll swear to [her]4961-she step . "[179-maryann] said [Jan.]198-jan. " Mighty [me]144-gabriel ! Wo n't mis'ess storm and call [us]1900-we stupids wen [she]4961-she comes back ! "[144-gabriel] moaned [Maryann]179-maryann . " How [I]310-faith wish it had happened when [she]4961-she was at [home]556-home , and [none of [us]1900-we]4963-none of us had been answerable ! "[310-faith] " [We]1900-we must ride after . " "[266-maryann] Which pair ? " "[0-i] [Mr Boldwood]224-boldwood 's Tidy and [Moll]266-maryann . " "[231-boldwood] Then wait here till [I]0-i come hither again . " said [Gabriel]144-gabriel . Springing down into [[Boldwood]224-boldwood 's pastures]4966-boldwood 's pastures , [each]3919-each pocketed [his]3919-each halter to hide it from the horses , who , seeing [the men]3799-the men empty - handed , docilely allowed [them-]3799-the men selves to [he]3919-each seized by the mane , when the halters were dexterously slipped on . Having neither bit nor bridle , [Oak]144-gabriel and [Coggan]180-coggan extemporized the former by passing the rope in each case through the animal 's mouth and looping it on the other side . [Oak]144-gabriel vaulted astride , and [Coggan]180-coggan clambered up by aid of the hank , when [they]3799-the men ascended to the gate and galloped off in the direction taken by [Bathsheha]312-bathsheha 's horse and [the robber]1896-the robber . [Whose vehicle the horse had been harnessed to]4970-whose vehicle the horse had been harnessed to was a matter of some uncertainty . [Weatherbury Bottom]80-weatherbury bottom was reached in three or four minutes . "[0-i] [The villains]1907-the villains ! " said [Gabriel]144-gabriel . "[0-i] Which way have [they]1907-the villains gone , [I]0-i wonder ? " "[144-gabriel] Straight on , as sure as [God]171-god made little apples , " said [Jan.]198-jan. "[285-jan] Very well ; [we]1908-we are better mounted , and must over- discovered . The road - metal grew softer and more rain had wetted its surface to a somewhat plastic , but not muddy state . [They]1908-we came to [cross - roads]1909-cross - roads . [Coggan]180-coggan suddenly pulled up [Moll]266-maryann and slipped off . " What 's the matter ? "[285-jan] said [Gabriel]144-gabriel . " [We]1908-we must try to track ['em]4974-'em , since [we]1908-we ca n't hear 'em , "[285-jan] said [Jan]285-jan , fumbling in [his]285-jan pockets . [He]285-jan struck a light , and held the match to the ground . The rain had been heavier here , and all foot and horse tracks made previous to the storm had been abraded and blurred by the drops , and they were now so many little scoops of water , which reflected the flame of the match like eyes . [One set of tracks]1910-one set of tracks was fresh and had no water in them ; one pair of ruts was also empty , and not small canals , like the others . The footprints forming this recent impression were full of information as to pace ; they were in equidistant pairs , three or four feet apart , the right and left foot of each pair being exactly opposite one another . " Straight on ! "[313-old jimmy harris] [Jan]285-jan exclaimed . " Tracks like that mean a stiff gallop . No wonder [we]1908-we do n't hear [him]1912-him . " [You]0-i saw there were [no other tracks]4975-no other tracks ? "[180-coggan] " True . "[180-coggan] [They]1915-they rode along silently for a long weary time . [Coggan]180-coggan carried [an old pinchbeck repeater which [he]180-coggan had inherited from some genius in [[his]180-coggan family]4102-his family]1916-an old pinchbeck repeater which he had inherited from some genius in his family ; and it now struck one . "[180-coggan] Again [they]1915-they hastened on , and entered [Blackmore Vale]84-blackmore vale . [Coggan]180-coggan 's watch struck one . "[198-jan.] [They]1915-they pushed rapidly on for yet two or three miles . " Ah ! a moment . "[198-jan.] said [Jan.]198-jan. " Let 's see how [she]1919-she was driven up [this hill]455-this hill . "[1919-she] Twill help [us]1915-they . " A light was promptly struck upon [his]4976-her gaiters as before , and the ex- amination made , "[1915-they] Hurrah ! " said [Coggan]180-coggan . "[1915-they] [She]1919-she walked up here - and well [she]1919-she might . [We]1915-they shall get [them]1920-them in two miles , for a crown . " [They]1915-they rode three , and listened . No sound was to be heard save a millpond trickling hoarsely through a hatch , and suggesting gloomy possibilities of drowning by jumping in . [Gabriel]144-gabriel dismounted when [they]1915-they came to a turning . [The tracks]4979-the tracks were absolutely the only guide as to the direction that [they]1915-they now had , and great caution was necessary to avoid confusing [them]1915-they with some others which had made [their]1915-they appearance lately . "[1915-they] What does this mean ? - though [I]0-i guess . " said [Gabriel]144-gabriel , looking up at [Coggan]180-coggan as [he]180-coggan moved the match over the ground about the turning . [Coggan]180-coggan , who , no less than the panting horses , had latterly shown signs of weariness , again scrutinized the mystic characters . This time only three were of the regular horseshoe shape . Every fourth was a dot . [He]180-coggan screwed up [his]180-coggan face and emitted a long "[1915-they] Whew - w - w ! " "[1915-they] Lame . " said [Oak]144-gabriel . "[1915-they] Yes [Dainty]314-dainty is lamed ; the near - foot - afore . " said [Coggan]180-coggan slowly staring still at the footprints . "[1915-they] [We]1915-they 'll push on . " said [Gabriel]144-gabriel , remounting [his]144-gabriel humid steed . Although [the road along [its]4980-the road along its greater part greater part]4980-the road along its greater part had been as good as [any turnpike - road in [the country]1144-the country]4981-any turnpike - road in the country , it was nomin- ally only [a byway]4983-a byway . "[1915-they] [We]1915-they shall have [him]1921-he now ! " [he]180-coggan exclaimed . "[1924-the turnpike - man] Where ? " "[1924-the turnpike - man] [Sherton Turnpike]85-sherton turnpike . [The keeper of that gate]1922-the keeper of that gate is [the sleepiest man between here and [London]70-london]1923-the sleepiest man between here and london - [Dan Randall]315-dan randall . that 's [his]1921-he name - knowed en for years , when [he]1921-he was at [Casterbridge]22-casterbridge gate . Between the lameness and the gate ' tis a done job . " ' Twas said until , against a shady background of foliage , five white bars were visible , crossing [their]1915-they route a little way ahead . "[1924-the turnpike - man] Hush - [we]1915-they are almost close ! " said [Gabriel]144-gabriel . "[1924-the turnpike - man] Amble on upon the grass . " said [Coggan]180-coggan . The white bars were blotted out in the midst by a dark shape in front of [them]1915-they . The silence of this lonely time was pierced by an exclamation from that quarter . "[1921-he] Hoy - a - hoy ! Gate ! " It appeared that there had been a previous call which [they]1915-they had not noticed , for on [their]1915-they close approach the door of [the turnpike - house]4985-the turnpike - house opened , and [the keeper]4986-the keeper came out half - dressed , with a candle in [his]4986-the keeper hand . Will [you]144-gabriel now return , please ? "[144-gabriel] [She]1929-she turned [her]1929-she head - [the gateman]1931-the gateman 's candle shimmering upon [her]1929-she quick , clear eyes as [she]1929-she did so - passed through the gate , and was soon wrapped in the embowering shades of mysterious summer boughs . [Coggan]180-coggan and [Gabriel]144-gabriel put about [their]1932-we horses , and , fanned by the velvety air of this July night , retraced the road by which [they]1932-we had come . " [She]1929-she wo n't be in [Bath]79-bath by no daylight ! "[144-gabriel] " [Coggan]180-coggan , suppose [we]1932-we keep this night 's work as quiet as [we]1932-we can ? "[144-gabriel] " [I]180-coggan am of [one and the same mind]5004-one and the same mind . "[180-coggan] " Very well . [We]1932-we shall be [home]556-home by three o'clock or so , and can creep into [the parish]422-the parish like lambs . "[266-maryann] [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's perturbed meditations by the roadside had ultimately evolved a conclusion that there were only two remedies for the present desperate state of affairs . The first was merely to keep [Troy]243-bathsheba away from Weather- bury till [Boldwood]224-boldwood 's indignation had cooled ; the second to listen to [Oak]144-gabriel 's entreaties , and [Boldwood]224-boldwood 's denuncia- tions , and give up [Troy]243-bathsheba altogether . Alas ! Could [she]1933-she give up this new love - induce [him]243-bathsheba to renounce [her]1933-she by saying [she]1933-she did not like [him]243-bathsheba - could no more speak to [him]243-bathsheba , and beg [him]243-bathsheba , for [her]1933-she good , to end [his]243-bathsheba furlough in Bath , and see [her]1933-she and [Weather-]316-weather- bury no more ? It was a picture full of misery , but for a while [she]1933-she contemplated it firmly , allowing [herself]1933-she , nevertheless , as [girls]3618-girls will , to dwell upon the happy life [she]1933-she would have enjoyed had [Troy]243-bathsheba been [Boldwood]224-boldwood , and the path of love the path of duty - inflicting upon [herself]1933-she gratuit- ous tortures by imagining [him]243-bathsheba [the lover of [another woman]3779-another woman after forgetting [her]1933-she]1935-the lover of another woman after forgetting her ; for [she]1933-she had penetrated [Troy]243-bathsheba 's nature so far as to estimate [his]243-bathsheba tendencies pretty accurately , [hut]1933-she unfortunately loved [him]243-bathsheba no less in thinking that [he]243-bathsheba might soon cease to love [her]1933-she - indeed , considerably more . [She]1933-she jumped to [her]1933-she feet . [She]1933-she would see [him]243-bathsheba at once . Yes , [she]1933-she would implore [him]243-bathsheba by word of mouth to assist [her]1933-she in this dilemma . A letter to keep [him]243-bathsheba away could not reach [him]243-bathsheba in time , even if [he]243-bathsheba should be disposed to listen to it . Was [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba altogether blind to the obvious fact that the support of [a lover]1382-a lover 's arms is not of a kind best calculated to assist a resolve to renounce [him]243-bathsheba ? Or was [she]1933-she sophistically sensible , with a thrill of pleasure , that by adopting this course for getting rid of [him]243-bathsheba [she]1933-she was ensuring a meeting with [him]243-bathsheba , at any rate , once more ? It was now dark , and the hour must have been nearly ten . The only way to accomplish [her]1933-she purpose was to give up [her]1933-she idea of visiting [Liddy]191-liddy at [Yalbury]44-yalbury , return to [Weatherbury Farm]61-weatherbury farm , put the horse into the gig , and drive at once to [Bath]79-bath . The scheme seemed at first impossible : the journey was a fearfully heavy one , even for a strong horse , at [her]1933-she own estimate ; and [she]1933-she much underrated the distance . It was most venturesome for [a woman]459-a woman , at night , and alone . But could [she]1933-she go on to [Liddy]191-liddy 's and leave things to take their course ? No , no ; anything but that . [Bath- sheba]168-bath- sheba was full of a stimulating turbulence , beside which caution vainly prayed for a hearing . [she]1933-she turned back towards [the village]3754-the village . [Her]1933-she walk was slow , for [she]1933-she wished not to enter [Weatherbury]196-joseph till [the cottagers]1940-the cottagers were in bed , and , par- ticularly , till [Boldwood]224-boldwood was secure . [Her]1933-she plan was now to drive to [Bath]79-bath during the night , see [Sergeant Troy]243-bathsheba in the morning before [he]243-bathsheba set out to come to [her]1933-she , bid [him]243-bathsheba farewell , and dismiss [him]243-bathsheba : then to rest the horse thoroughly [herself]1933-she to weep the while , [she]1933-she thought , starting early the next morning on [her]1933-she return journey . By this arrangement [she]1933-she could trot Dainty gently all the day , reach [Liddy]191-liddy at [Yalbury]44-yalbury in the evening , and come [home]556-home to [Weatherbury]196-joseph with [her]1933-she whenever [they]1942-they chose - so [nobody]439-nobody would know [she]1933-she had been to [Bath]1944-bath at all . Such was [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's scheme . But in [her]1933-she topo- graphical ignorance as [a late comer to [the place]3486-the place]1945-a late comer to the place , [she]1933-she misreckoned the distance of [her]1933-she journey as not much more than half what it really was . [Her]1933-she idea , however , [she]1933-she proceeded to carry out , with what initial success [we]1947-we have already seen . CHAPTER XXXIII IN [THE SUN]87-the sun - A HARBINGER A WEEK passed , and there were no tidings of Bath- [sheba]1948-sheba ; nor was there any explanation of [her]1933-she Gilpin 's rig . Then a note came for [Maryann]266-maryann , stating that the business which had called [[her]266-maryann mistress]4024-her mistress to [Bath]79-bath still detained [her]266-maryann [there]3509-there ; but that [she]266-maryann hoped to return in the course of another week . Another week passed . The oat - harvest began , and [all the men]1951-all the men were [a - field]1952-a - field under a monochromatic Lammas sky , amid the trembling air and short shadows of noon . Indoors nothing was to be heard save the droning of blue - bottle flies ; out - of - doors the whetting of scythes and the hiss of tressy oat - ears rubbing together as their perpendicular stalks of amber - yellow fell heavily to each swath . Every drop of moisture not in [the men]3799-the men 's bottles and flagons in the form of cider was raining as perspira- tion from [their]3799-the men foreheads and cheeks . Drought was everywhere else . [They]3799-the men were about to withdraw for a while into the charitable shade of a tree in the fence , when [Coggan]180-coggan saw a figure in a blue coat and brass buttons running to [them]3799-the men across [the field]3467-the field . " [I]266-maryann wonder who that is ? "[266-maryann] [he]180-coggan said . " [I]144-gabriel hope nothing is wrong about [mistress]996-mistress . "[144-gabriel] said [Maryann]266-maryann , who with [some other women]1955-some other women was tying the bundles oats being always sheafed on [this farm]1764-this farm , " but an unlucky token came to [me]181-matthew moon indoors this morning . l went to unlock the door and dropped the key , and it fell upon the stone floor and broke into two pieces . Breaking a key is a dreadful bodement . [I]181-matthew moon wish [mis'ess]3453-mis'ess was [home]556-home . "[181-matthew moon] " ' Tis [Cain Ball]235-cain . "[181-matthew moon] said [Gabriel]144-gabriel , pausing from whetting [his]144-gabriel reaphook . [Oak]144-gabriel was not bound by [his]144-gabriel agreement to assist in the corn - field ; but the harvest month is an anxious time for [a farmer]3716-a farmer , and the corn was [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's , so [he]144-gabriel lent a hand . " [He]144-gabriel 's dressed up in [his]144-gabriel best clothes . "[196-joseph] said [Matthew Moon]181-matthew moon . " [He]144-gabriel [hev]144-gabriel been away from [home]556-home for a few days , since [he]144-gabriel 's had [that felon]5011-that felon upon [his]144-gabriel finger ; for ' a said , since [I]180-coggan ca n't work [I]180-coggan 'll have a hollerday . "[180-coggan] " A good time for one - a excellent time . "[144-gabriel] " [Ay]190-ay , and [[my]144-gabriel father]778-my father put [his]778-my father arm out of joint to have time to go courting . By this time [Cainy]252-cainy was nearing [the group of harvesters]1960-the group of harvesters , and was perceived to be carrying a large slice of bread and ham in one hand , from which [he]252-cainy took mouthfuls as [he]252-cainy ran , the other being wrapped in a bandage . "[144-gabriel] " Now then . "[252-cainy] said [Gabriel]144-gabriel , impatiently , " what did [you]252-cainy see , [Cain]235-cain ? " And [I]252-cainy think [the sojer]5043-the sojer was [Sergeant Troy]243-bathsheba . And [they]5039-they sat there together for more than half - an - hour , talking moving things , and [she]5043-the sojer once was crying a'most to death . And when [they]5039-they came out [her]5043-the sojer eyes were shining and [she]5043-the sojer was as white as a lily ; and [they]5039-they looked into [one another]5044-one another 's faces , as far - gone friendly as [a man]3474-a man and [woman]473-woman can be . "[252-cainy] [Gabriel]144-gabriel 's features seemed to get thinner . " Well , what did [you]1979-you see besides ? "[252-cainy] " Oh , all sorts . "[252-cainy] " White as a lily ? CHAPTER XXXIV [HOME]556-home AGAIN - [A TRICKSTER]331-a trickster THAT same evening at dusk [Gabriel]144-gabriel was leaning over [[Coggan]180-coggan 's garden]5061-coggan 's garden - gate , taking an up - and - down survey before retiring to rest . [A vehicle]685-a vehicle of some kind was softly creeping along the grassy margin of [the lane]3664-the lane . From it spread the tones of [two women]3487-two women talking . The tones were natural and not at all suppressed . [Oak]144-gabriel instantly knew the voices to [he]144-gabriel those of [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba and [Liddy]191-liddy . [The carriage]5065-the carriage came opposite and passed by . [It]5065-the carriage was [[Miss Everdene]167-miss everdene 's gig]5066-miss everdene 's gig , and [Liddy]191-liddy and [[her]191-liddy mistress]4024-her mistress were [the only occupants of the seat]5068-the only occupants of the seat . [Liddy]191-liddy was asking questions about [the city of]5069-the city of [Bath]79-bath , and [[her]191-liddy companion]3490-her companion was answering [them]5071-them listlessly and unconcernedly . Both [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba and the horse seemed weary . The exquisite relief of finding that [she]191-liddy was [here]575-here again , safe and sound , overpowered all reflection , and [Oak]144-gabriel could only luxuriate in the sense of it . All grave reports were forgotten . [He]144-gabriel lingered and lingered on , till there was no difference between the eastern and western expanses of sky , and the timid hares began to limp courageously round [the dim hillocks]5073-the dim hillocks . [Gabriel]144-gabriel might have been there an additional half - hour when [a dark form]5074-a dark form walked slowly by . "[3717-sir] Good - night , [Gabriel]144-gabriel . " [the passer]5075-the passer said . It was [Boldwood]224-boldwood . "[3717-sir] Good - night , [sir]3717-sir . " said [Gabriel]144-gabriel . [Boldwood]224-boldwood likewise vanished up [the road]477-the road , and [Oak]144-gabriel shortly afterwards turned indoors to bed . [Farmer Boldwood]231-boldwood went on towards [[Miss Everdene]167-miss everdene 's house]5077-miss everdene 's house . [He]231-boldwood reached the front , and approaching the entrance , saw a light in the parlour . The blind was not drawn down , and inside [the room]4025-the room was [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba , looking over some papers or letters . [Her]167-miss everdene back was towards [Boldwood]224-boldwood . [He]231-boldwood went to the door , knocked , and waited with tense muscles and an aching brow . [Boldwood]224-boldwood had not been outside [[his]224-boldwood garden]5079-his garden since [his]224-boldwood meeting with [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba in [the road to [Yalbury]44-yalbury]5080-the road to yalbury . Silent and alone , [he]224-boldwood had remained in moody medita- tion on [woman]473-woman 's ways , deeming as essentials of the whole sex the accidents of the single one of [their]473-woman number [he]224-boldwood had ever closely beheld . By degrees a more charitable temper had pervaded [him]224-boldwood , and this was the reason of [his]224-boldwood sally to - night . [He]224-boldwood had come to apologize and beg forgiveness of [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba with some- thing like a sense of shame at [his]224-boldwood violence , having but just now learnt that [she]167-miss everdene had returned - only from a visit to [Liddy]191-liddy , as [he]224-boldwood supposed , the Bath escapade being quite unknown to [him]224-boldwood . [He]224-boldwood inquired for [Miss Everdene]167-miss everdene . [Liddy]191-liddy 's manner was odd , but [he]224-boldwood did not notice it . [She]0-i went in , leaving [him]224-boldwood standing there , and in [her]0-i absence the blind of [the room containing [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba]5082-the room containing bathsheba was pulled down . [Bold-]249-bold- wood augured ill from that sign . [Liddy]191-liddy came out . "[3717-sir] [[My]0-i mistress]2035-my mistress can not see [you]2036-you , [sir]3717-sir . " [she]0-i said . [The farmer]3540-the farmer instantly went out by the gate . [He]224-boldwood as unforgiven - that was the issue of it all . [He]224-boldwood had seen [her]2035-my mistress who was to [him]224-boldwood simultaneously a delight and a torture , sitting in [the room [he]224-boldwood had shared with [her]2035-my mistress as [a peculiarly privileged guest]5085-a peculiarly privileged guest only a little earlier in [he]224-boldwood summer]5084-the room he had shared with her as a peculiarly privileged guest only a little earlier in he summer , and [she]2035-my mistress had denied [him]224-boldwood an entrance [there]3509-there now . [Boldwood]224-boldwood did not hurry homeward . It was ten o'clock at least , when , walking deliberately through [the lower part of [Weatherbury]196-joseph]5087-the lower part of weatherbury , [he]224-boldwood heard [[the carrier]5088-the carrier 's spring van]5089-the carrier 's spring van entering [the village]3754-the village . [The van]5091-the van ran to and from [a town]5092-a town in a northern direction , and it was owned and driven by [a Weatherbury man]3818-a weatherbury man , at the door of whose house [it]5091-the van now pulled up . The lamp fixed to the head of the hood illuminated a scarlet and gilded form , who was the first to alight . "[3717-sir] Ah ! " said [Boldwood]224-boldwood to [himself]224-boldwood , "[3717-sir] come to see [her]2038-her again . " [Troy]243-bathsheba entered [[the carrier]5088-the carrier 's house]5095-the carrier 's house , which had been the place of [[his]224-boldwood lodging]5096-his lodging on [his]224-boldwood last visit to [[his]224-boldwood native place]5097-his native place . [Boldwood]224-boldwood was moved by a sudden determina- tion . [He]224-boldwood hastened [home]556-home . In ten minutes [he]224-boldwood was back again , and made as if [he]224-boldwood were going to call upon [Troy]243-bathsheba at [the carrier]5088-the carrier 's . But as [he]224-boldwood approached , [some one]5100-some one opened the door and came out . [He]224-boldwood heard [this person]1170-this person say "[243-bathsheba] Good - night " to [the inmates]5102-the inmates , and the voice was [Troy]243-bathsheba 's . "[243-bathsheba] This was strange , coming so immediately after [his]2039-his arrival . [Boldwood]224-boldwood , however , hastened up to [him]2039-his . [Troy]243-bathsheba had what appeared to be a carpet - bag in [his]243-bathsheba hand - the same that [he]243-bathsheba had brought with [him]243-bathsheba . It seemed as if [he]243-bathsheba were going to leave again this very night . [Troy]243-bathsheba turned up [the hill]3452-the hill and quickened [his]243-bathsheba pace . [Boldwood]224-boldwood stepped forward . " [Sergeant Troy]243-bathsheba ? "[243-bathsheba] " Yes - i'm [Sergeant Troy]243-bathsheba . "[0-i] [I]0-i wish to speak a word with [you]224-boldwood . " [he]224-boldwood said . "[0-i] What about ? " "[0-i] Well then - [I]0-i know a good deal concerning [your]224-boldwood [Fanny Robin]217-fanny 's attachment to [you]224-boldwood . " [Troy]243-bathsheba was about to utter something hastily ; [he]243-bathsheba then checked [himself]243-bathsheba and said , "[0-i] [I]0-i am too poor . " [His]243-bathsheba voice was changed . Previously it had had a devil - may - care tone . It was the voice of [a trickster]5104-a trickster now . [Boldwood]224-boldwood 's present mood was not critical enough to notice tones . [He]224-boldwood continued , "[0-i] [I]0-i may as well speak plainly ; and understand , [I]0-i do n't wish to enter into the questions of right or wrong , [woman]473-woman 's honour and shame , or to express any opinion on [your]224-boldwood conduct . " An old tree trunk lay under the hedge immediately opposite , and [they]2049-we sat down . " "[224-boldwood] Hang might!"Would , then . "[167-miss everdene] " If [you]224-boldwood had not come [I]224-boldwood should certainly - yes , certainly - have been accepted by this time . "[243-bathsheba] " [I]243-bathsheba 'll pay [you]224-boldwood well now , [I]243-bathsheba 'll settle a sum of money upon [her]167-miss everdene , and [I]243-bathsheba 'll see that [you]224-boldwood do n't suffer from poverty in the future . [I]243-bathsheba 'll put it clearly . [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba is only playing with [you]224-boldwood : [you]224-boldwood are too poor for [her]167-miss everdene as [I]243-bathsheba said ; so give up wasting [your]224-boldwood time about a great match [you]224-boldwood 'll never make for a moderate and rightful match [you]224-boldwood may make to - morrow ; take up [your]224-boldwood carpet - bag , turn about , leave [Weatherbury]196-joseph now , this night , and [you]224-boldwood shall take fifty pounds with [you]224-boldwood . [Fanny]217-fanny shall have fifty to enable [her]217-fanny to prepare for the wedding , when [you]224-boldwood have told [me]243-bathsheba where [she]217-fanny is living , and [she]217-fanny shall have five hundred paid down on [her]217-fanny wedding - day . "[243-bathsheba] In making this statement [Boldwood]224-boldwood 's voice revealed only too clearly a consciousness of the weakness of [his]224-boldwood position , [his]224-boldwood aims , and [his]224-boldwood method . [His]224-boldwood manner had lapsed quite from that of [the firm and dignified Bold- wood of former times]2050-the firm and dignified bold- wood of former times ; and such a scheme as [he]224-boldwood had now engaged in [he]224-boldwood would have condemned as childishly imbecile only a few months ago . [We]2051-we discern a grand force in the lover which [he]224-boldwood lacks whilst [a free man]3703-a free man ; but there is a breadth of vision in [the free man]2053-the free man which in [the lover]2054-the lover [we]2051-we vainly seek . Where there is much bias there must be some narrowness , and love , though added emotion , is subtracted capacity . [Boldwood]224-boldwood exemplified this to an abnormal degree : [he]224-boldwood knew nothing of [Fanny Robin]217-fanny 's circumstances or whereabouts , [he]224-boldwood knew nothing of [Troy]243-bathsheba 's possibilities , yet that was what [he]224-boldwood said . " [I]224-boldwood like [Fanny]217-fanny best . "[224-boldwood] said [Troy]243-bathsheba ; " and if , as [you]224-boldwood say , [Miss Everdene]167-miss everdene is out of [my]243-bathsheba reach , why [I]243-bathsheba have all to gain by accepting [your]224-boldwood money , and marrying [Fan]217-fanny . But [she]217-fanny 's only [a servant]1811-a servant . "[243-bathsheba] " Never mind - do [you]224-boldwood agree to [my]224-boldwood arrangement ? "[224-boldwood] " [I]224-boldwood do . "[224-boldwood] " Ah ! "[243-bathsheba] said [Boldwood]224-boldwood , in a more elastic voice . " O , [Troy]243-bathsheba , if [you]243-bathsheba like [her]217-fanny best , why then did [you]224-boldwood step in here and injure [my]243-bathsheba happiness ? "[243-bathsheba] " [I]224-boldwood love [Fanny]217-fanny best now . "[224-boldwood] said [Troy]243-bathsheba . " But Bathsh - - [Miss Everdene]167-miss everdene inflamed [me]243-bathsheba , and displaced [Fanny]217-fanny for a time . It is over now . "[243-bathsheba] " Why should it be over so soon ? "[243-bathsheba] " This may be called Fort meeting Feeble , hey , [Boldwood]224-boldwood ? "[224-boldwood] said [Troy]243-bathsheba . A low gurgle of derisive laughter followed the words . Now , [Boldwood]224-boldwood , [yours]5133-you is the ridiculous fate which always attends inter- ference between [a man]3474-a man and [[his]3474-a man wife]4301-his wife . And another word .
