[Troy]243-bathsheba then closed the door , and locked [himself]243-bathsheba in . Throughout the whole of that night [[Boldwood]224-boldwood 's dark downs of Weatherbury]2087-boldwood 's dark downs of weatherbury like an unhappy Shade in [the Mournful Fields]2088-the mournful fields by [Acheron]338-acheron . CHAPTER XXXV AT AN UPPER WINDOW IT was very early the next morning - a time of sun and dew . The confused beginnings of many birds ' songs spread into the healthy air , and the wan blue of the heaven was here and there coated with thin webs of incorporeal cloud which were of no effect in obscuring day . All the lights in the scene were yellow as to colour , and all the shadows were attenuated as to form . The creeping plants about [the old manor - house]2089-the old manor - house were bowed with rows of heavy water drops , which had upon objects behind them the effect of minute lenses of high magnifying power . Just before the clock struck five [Gabriel Oak]144-gabriel and [Coggan]180-coggan passed [the village cross]2090-the village cross , and went on together to [the fields]527-the fields . [They]2092-they were yet barely in view of [[[their]2092-they mistress]2093-their mistress 's house]2094-their mistress 's house , when [Oak]144-gabriel fancied [he]144-gabriel saw the opening of a casement in one of the upper windows . [The two men]2095-the two men were at this moment partially screened by an elder bush , now beginning to be enriched with black bunches of fruit , and [they]2092-they paused before emerging from its shade . [A handsome man]2096-a handsome man leaned idly from the lattice . [He]2096-a handsome man looked east and then west , in the manner of [one who makes a first morning survey]2097-one who makes a first morning survey . [The man]726-the man was [Sergeant Troy]243-bathsheba . [His]726-the man red jacket was loosely thrown on , but not buttoned , and [he]726-the man had altogether the relaxed bearing of [a soldier]995-a soldier taking [his]726-the man ease . [Coggan]180-coggan spoke first , looking quietly at the window . " [She]5139-she has married [him]2096-a handsome man ! "[180-coggan] [he]180-coggan said . [Gabriel]144-gabriel had previously beheld the sight , and [he]144-gabriel now stood with [his]144-gabriel back turned , making no reply . " [I]180-coggan fancied [we]2092-they should know something to - day . "[180-coggan] con- tinued [Coggan]180-coggan . " [I]144-gabriel heard wheels pass [my]144-gabriel door just after dark - [you]144-gabriel were out somewhere . "He[144-gabriel] glanced round upon [Gabriel]144-gabriel . " Good heavens above [us]2092-they , [Oak]144-gabriel , how white [your]144-gabriel face is ; [you]144-gabriel look like a corpse ! "[144-gabriel] " Do [I]2100-they ? "[2100-they] said [Oak]144-gabriel , with a faint smile . " Lean on the gate : [I]1330-the sergeant 'll wait a bit . "[1330-the sergeant] " All right , all right . "[180-coggan] [They]2100-they stood by the gate awhile , [Gabriel]144-gabriel listlessly staring at the ground . [His]144-gabriel mind sped into the future , and saw there enacted in years of leisure the scenes o repentance that would ensue from this work of haste That [they]2100-they were married [he]144-gabriel had instantly decided . Why had it been so mysteriously managed ? It had become known that [she]2101-she had had a fearful journey to [Bath]79-bath , owing to [her]2101-she miscalculating the distance : that the horse had broken down , and that [she]2101-she had been more than two days getting [there]3509-there . It was not [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's way to do things furtively . With all [her]2101-she faults , [she]2101-she was candour itself . Could [she]2101-she have been entrapped ? The union was not only an unutterable grief to [him]144-gabriel : it amazed [him]144-gabriel , notwithstanding that [he]144-gabriel had passed the preceding week in a suspicion that such might be the issue of [Troy]243-bathsheba 's meeting [her]2101-she away from [home]556-home . [Her]2101-she quiet return with liddy had to some extent dispersed the dread . Just as that imperceptible motion which appears like stillness is infinitely divided in its properties from stili ness itself , so had [his]144-gabriel hope undistinguishable from despair differed from despair indeed . In a few minutes [they]2100-they moved on again towards [the house]552-the house . [The sergeant]1330-the sergeant still looked from the window . " Morning , [comrades]5140-comrades ! "[180-coggan] [he]1330-the sergeant shouted , in a cheery voice , when [they]2100-they came up . [Coggan]180-coggan replied to the greeting . " Bain't [ye]144-gabriel going to answer [the man]726-the man ? "[1330-the sergeant] [he]180-coggan then said to [Gabriel]144-gabriel . " [I]243-bathsheba 'd say good morning - [you]144-gabriel need n't spend a hapenny of meaning upon it , and yet keep [the man]726-the man civil . "[243-bathsheba] [Gabriel]144-gabriel soon decided too that , since the deed was done , to put the best face upon the matter would be the greatest kindness to [her]2101-she [he]144-gabriel loved . " Good morning , [Sergeant Troy]243-bathsheba . "[180-coggan] [he]1330-the sergeant returned , in a ghastly voice . " [A rambling , gloomy house]5143-a rambling , gloomy house this . "[180-coggan] said [Troy]243-bathsheba , smiling . " Why - [they]5144-they may not be married ! "[144-gabriel] suggested [Coggan]180-coggan . " Perhaps [she]2101-she 's not [there]3509-there . "[144-gabriel] [Gabriel]144-gabriel shook [his]144-gabriel head . [The soldier]4298-the soldier turned a little towards the east , and the sun kindled [his]4298-the soldier scarlet coat to an orange glow . " But [it]5143-a rambling , gloomy house is [a nice old house]5146-a nice old house . "[2107-a philosopher] responded [Gabriel]144-gabriel . " Yes - [I]2107-a philosopher suppose so ; but [I]2107-a philosopher feel like new wine in an old bottle here . [My]2107-a philosopher notion is that sash - windows should be put throughout , and these old wainscoted walls brightened up a bit ; or the oak cleared quite away , and the walls papered . "[2107-a philosopher] " It would be a pity , [I]2107-a philosopher think . "[2107-a philosopher] Well , no . [A philosopher]2107-a philosopher once said in [my]0-i hearing that [the old builders , who worked when art was a living thing]2108-the old builders , who worked when art was a living thing , had no respect for the work of builders who went before [them]2108-the old builders , who worked when art was a living thing , but pulled down and altered as [they]2108-the old builders , who worked when art was a living thing thought fit ; and why should n't we?"'Creation and preservation do n't do well together . "[0-i] says [he]2107-a philosopher , " and [a million of antiquarians]5147-a million of antiquarians ca n't invent a style . "[2111-you] [My]0-i mind exactly . [I]0-i am for making [this place]561-this place more modern , that [we]2110-we may be cheerful whilst [we]2110-we can . " [The military man]4718-the military man turned and surveyed the interior of [the room]4025-the room , to assist [his]4718-the military man ideas of improvement in this direction . [Gabriel]144-gabriel and [Coggan]180-coggan began to move on . "[2111-you] Oh , [Coggan]180-coggan . " said [Troy]243-bathsheba , as if inspired by a recollec- tion "[0-i] do [you]2111-you know if insanity has ever appeared in [[Mr. Boldwood]224-boldwood 's family]2112-mr. boldwood 's family ? " [Jan]180-coggan reflected for a moment . "[0-i] [I]0-i once heard that [an uncle of]2113-an uncle of [his]2113-an uncle of was queer in [his]2113-an uncle of head , but [I]0-i do n't know the rights o't . " [he]180-coggan said . "[2111-you] It is of no importance . " said [Troy]243-bathsheba , lightly . "[2111-you] Well , [I]0-i shall be down in [the fields]527-the fields with [you]2111-you some time this week ; but [I]0-i have a few matters to attend to first . So good - day to [you]2111-you . [We]2115-we shall , of course , keep on just as friendly terms as usual . [I]0-i 'm not [a proud man]2116-a proud man : [nobody]439-nobody is ever able to say that of [Sergeant Troy]243-bathsheba . However , what is must be , and here 's half - a - crown to drink [my]0-i health , [men]474-men . " [Troy]243-bathsheba threw the coin dexterously across the front plot and over the fence towards [Gabriel]144-gabriel , who shunned it in its fall , [his]144-gabriel face turning to an angry red . [Coggan]180-coggan twirled [his]180-coggan eye , edged forward , and caught the money in its ricochet upon [the road]477-the road . "[0-i] very well - [you]2111-you keep it , [Coggan]180-coggan . " said [Gabriel]144-gabriel with disdain and almost fiercely . "[0-i] As for [me]0-i , [I]0-i 'll do with- out gifts from [him]243-bathsheba ! " "[2111-you] Do n't show it too much . " said [Coggan]180-coggan , musingly . "[224-boldwood] For if [he]243-bathsheba 's married to [her]2119-her , mark [my]0-i words , [he]243-bathsheba 'll buy [his]243-bathsheba discharge and be [[our]2120-they master]2121-our master here . Therefore ' tis well to say ` [Friend]2122-friend ' outwardly , though [you]2111-you say ` [Troublehouse]339-troublehouse ' within . " "[224-boldwood] Well - perhaps it is best to be silent ; but [I]0-i ca n't go further than that . [I]0-i ca n't flatter , and if [my]0-i place here is only to be kept by smoothing [him]243-bathsheba down , [my]0-i place must be lost . " [A horseman]5151-a horseman , whom [they]2120-they had for some time seen in the distance , now appeared close beside [them]2120-they . "[243-bathsheba] There 's [Mr. Boldwood]224-boldwood . " said [Oak]144-gabriel . "[0-i] [I]0-i wonder what [Troy]243-bathsheba meant by [his]224-boldwood question . " [Coggan]180-coggan and [Oak]144-gabriel nodded respectfully to [the farmer]3540-the farmer , just checked [their]2120-they paces to discover if [they]2120-they were wanted , and finding [they]2120-they were not stood back to let [him]224-boldwood pass on . The only signs of the terrible sorrow [Boldwood]224-boldwood had been combating through the night , and was combating now , were the want of colour in [his]224-boldwood well - defined face , the enlarged appearance of the veins in [his]224-boldwood forehead and temples , and the sharper lines about [his]224-boldwood mouth . The horse bore [him]224-boldwood away , and the very step of the animal seemed significant of dogged despair . [Gabriel]144-gabriel , for a minute , rose above [his]144-gabriel own grief in noticing [Boldwood]224-boldwood 's . [He]144-gabriel saw [the square figure]5153-the square figure sitting erect upon the horse , the head turned to neither side , the elbows steady by the hips , the brim of the hat level and undisturbed in its onward glide , until the keen edges of [Boldwood]224-boldwood 's shape sank by degrees over [the hill]3452-the hill . To one who knew [the man]726-the man and [his]726-the man story there was something more striking in this immobility than in a collapse . The clash of discord between mood and matter here was forced painfully home to the heart ; and , as in laughter there are more dreadful phases than in tears , so was there in the steadiness of [this agonized man an expression deeper than a cry]5156-this agonized man an expression deeper than a cry . CHAPTER XXXVI WEALTH IN [JEOPARDY]93-jeopardy - THE REVEL ONE night , at the end of August , when [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's experiences as [a married woman]697-a married woman were still new , and when the weather was yet dry and sultry , [a man]3474-a man stood motionless in [the stockyard of [Weatherbury Upper Farm]52-weatherbury upper farm]5159-the stockyard of weatherbury upper farm , looking at the moon and sky . The night had a sinister aspect . A heated breeze from the south slowly fanned the summits of lofty objects , and in the sky dashes of buoyant cloud were sailing in a course at right angles to that of another stratum , neither of them in the direction of the breeze below . The moon , as seen through these films , had a lurid metallic look . [The fields]527-the fields were sallow with the impure light , and all were tinged in monochrome , as if beheld through stained glass . The same evening the sheep had trailed homeward head to tail , the behaviour of [the rooks]5161-the rooks had been confused , and the horses had moved with timidity and caution . Thunder was imminent , and , taking some secondary appearances into consideration , it was likely to be followed by one of the lengthened rains which mark the close of dry weather for the season . Before twelve hours had passed a harvest atmosphere would be a bygone thing . [Oak]144-gabriel gazed with misgiving at eight naked and un- protected ricks , massive and heavy with the rich produce of [one - half [the farm]3760-the farm]5162-one - half the farm for that year . [He]144-gabriel went on to [the barn]719-the barn . This was the night which had been selected by [Sergeant Troy]243-bathsheba - ruling now in [the room of [[his]243-bathsheba wife]4301-his wife]5165-the room of his wife - for giving the harvest supper and dance . As [Oak]144-gabriel approached [the building]3834-the building the sound of violins and a tambourine , and the regular jigging of many feet , grew more distinct . [He]144-gabriel came close to the large doors , one of which stood slightly ajar , and looked in . [The central space]5168-the central space , together with the recess at one end , was emptied of all incumbrances , and this area , covering about two - thirds of the whole , was appropriated for the gathering , the remaining end , which was piled to the ceiling with oats , being screened off with sail- cloth . Tufts and garlands of green foliage decorated the walls , beams , and extemporized chandeliers , and immediately opposite to Oak a rostrum had been erected , bearing a table and chairs . Here sat [three fiddlers]5169-three fiddlers , and beside [them]5169-three fiddlers stood [a frantic man]5170-a frantic man with [his]5170-a frantic man hair on end , perspiration streaming down [his]5170-a frantic man cheeks , and a tambourine quivering in [his]5170-a frantic man hand . The dance ended , and on the black oak floor in the midst a new row of [couples]5171-couples formed for another . "[0-i] Now , [ma'am]712-ma'am , and no offence [I]0-i hope , [I]0-i ask what dance [you]712-ma'am would like next ? " said [the first violin]5172-the first violin . "[0-i] Really , it makes no difference . " said the clear voice of [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba , who stood at the inner end of [the build- ing]5173-the build- ing , observing the scene from behind a table covered with cups and viands . [Troy]243-bathsheba was lolling beside [her]712-ma'am . "[1330-the sergeant] Then . " said [the fiddler]5174-the fiddler , "[1330-the sergeant] [I]0-i 'll venture to name that the right and proper thing is " [The Soldier]4298-the soldier 's Joy "[1330-the sergeant] - there being [a gallant soldier]2124-a gallant soldier married into [the farm]3760-the farm - hey , [[my]0-i sonnies]2126-my sonnies , and [gentlemen]1268-gentlemen all ? " "[1330-the sergeant] It shall be " [The Soldier]4298-the soldier 's Joy , "[1330-the sergeant] exclaimed a chorus . " Thanks for the compliment . "[1330-the sergeant] said [the sergeant]1330-the sergeant gaily , taking [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba by the hand and leading [her]712-ma'am to the top of the dance . " For though [I]2131-a performer who understands the proper convulsions , spasms , st. vitus have pur- chased [my]2131-a performer who understands the proper convulsions , spasms , st. vitus discharge from [Her]712-ma'am Most Gracious [Majesty 's regiment of cavalry]94-majesty 's regiment of cavalry [the 11th Dragoon Guards]4261-the 11th dragoon guards , to attend to the new duties awaiting [me]2131-a performer who understands the proper convulsions , spasms , st. vitus here , [I]2131-a performer who understands the proper convulsions , spasms , st. vitus shall continue [a soldier]995-a soldier in spirit and feeling as long as [I]2131-a performer who understands the proper convulsions , spasms , st. vitus live . "[2131-a performer who understands the proper convulsions , spasms , st. vitus] So the dance began . As to the merits of " [The Soldier]4298-the soldier 's Joy . "[144-gabriel] there can not be , and never were , two opinions . It has been observed in the musical circles of [Weatherbury]196-joseph and [[its]196-joseph vicinity]3863-its vicinity that this melody , at the end of three - quarters of an hour of thunderous footing , still possesses more stimulative properties for the heel and toe than the majority of other dances at [their]2130-their first opening . " [The Soldier]4298-the soldier 's Joy "[1330-the sergeant] has , too , an additional charm , in being so admirably adapted to the tambourine aforesaid - no mean instrument in the hands of [a performer who understands the proper convulsions , spasms , St. vitus]2131-a performer who understands the proper convulsions , spasms , st. vitus 's dances , and fearful frenzies necessary when exhibiting its tones in their highest perfection . The immortal tune ended , a fine DD rolling forth from the bass - viol with the sonorousness of a cannonade , and [Gabriel]144-gabriel delayed [his]144-gabriel entry no longer . [He]144-gabriel avoided [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba , and got as near as possible to [the platform]2132-the platform , where [Sergeant Troy]243-bathsheba was now seated , drinking brandy- and - water , though [the others]3772-the others drank without exception cider and ale . [Gabriel]144-gabriel could not easily thrust [himself]144-gabriel within speaking distance of [the sergeant]1330-the sergeant , and [he]144-gabriel sent a message , asking [him]1330-the sergeant to come down for a moment . " [The sergeant]1330-the sergeant said [he]1330-the sergeant could not attend . "[340-troy] Will [you]1330-the sergeant tell [him]1330-the sergeant , then . " said [Gabriel]144-gabriel , "[340-troy] that [I]0-i only stepped ath'art to say that a heavy rain is sure to fall soon , and that something should be done to protect the ricks ? " "[340-troy] [M. Troy]340-troy says it will not rain . " returned [the messenger]4559-the messenger , "[2140-every man] and [he]340-troy can not stop to talk to [you]144-gabriel about such fidgets . " In Juxtaposition with [Troy]340-troy , [Oak]144-gabriel had a melancholy tendency to look like a candle beside gas , and ill at ease , [he]144-gabriel went out again , thinking [he]144-gabriel would go [home]556-home ; for , under the circumstances , [he]144-gabriel had no heart for the scene in [the barn]719-the barn . At the door [he]144-gabriel paused for a moment : [Troy]340-troy was speaking . "[144-gabriel] [Friends]2135-friends , it is not only the harvest [home]556-home that [we]2137-we are celebrating to - night ; but this is also a Wedding Feast . A short time ago [I]0-i had the happiness to lead to the altar [this lady]4087-this lady , [[your]144-gabriel mistress]2139-your mistress , and not until now have [we]2137-we been able to give any public flourish to the event in [Weatherbury]196-joseph . That it may be thoroughly well done , and that [every man]2140-every man may go happy to bed , [I]0-i have ordered to be brought here some bottles of brandy and kettles of hot water . A treble - strong goblet will [he]2140-every man handed round to [each guest]2141-each guest . " [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba put [her]0-i hand upon [his]244-frank arm , and , with upturned pale face , said imploringly , "[144-gabriel] No - do n't give it to [them]2142-them - pray do n't , [Frank]244-frank ! It will only do [them]2142-them harm : [they]2142-them have had enough of everything . " "[2135-friends] True - [we]2137-we do n't wish for no more , thank [ye]144-gabriel . " said [one or two]5185-one or two . "[2137-we] Pooh ! " said [the sergeant]1330-the sergeant contemptuously , and raised [his]1330-the sergeant voice as if lighted up by a new idea . "[2148-company] [Friends]2135-friends . " [he]1330-the sergeant said , "[2148-company] [we]2137-we 'll send [the women - folk]2144-the women - folk [home]556-home ! ' Tis time [they]2144-the women - folk were in bed . Then [we]2137-we cockbirds will have a jolly carouse to [ourselves]2137-we ! If [any of [the men]3799-the men]2146-any of the men show the white feather , let [them]2146-any of the men look elsewhere for a winter 's work . " [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba indignantly left [the barn]719-the barn , followed by [all the women]5188-all the women and [children]5189-children . [The musicians]5190-the musicians , not looking upon [themselves]5190-the musicians as "[0-i] [company]2148-company . " slipped quietly away to [their]5190-the musicians spring waggon and put in the horse . Thus [Troy]243-bathsheba and [the men on [the farm]3760-the farm]5191-the men on the farm were [left sole occupants of [the place]3486-the place]5193-left sole occupants of the place . [Oak]144-gabriel , not to appear unneces- sarily disagreeable , stayed a little while ; then [he]144-gabriel , too , arose and quietly took [his]144-gabriel departure , followed by a friendly oath from [the sergeant]1330-the sergeant for not staying to a second round of grog . [Gabriel]144-gabriel proceeded towards [[his]144-gabriel home]5196-his home . In approach- ing the door , [his]144-gabriel toe kicked something which felt and sounded soft , leathery , and distended , like a boxing- glove . It was a large toad humbly travelling across the path . [Oak]144-gabriel took it up , thinking it might be better to kill the creature to save it from pain ; but finding it uninjured , [he]144-gabriel placed [it]5197-it again among the grass . [He]144-gabriel knew what this direct message from [the Great Mother]323-mother meant . And soon came another . When [he]144-gabriel struck a light indoors there appeared upon the table a thin glistening streak , as if a brush of varnish had been lightly dragged across it . [Oak]144-gabriel 's eyes followed the serpentine sheen to the other side , where it led up to a huge brown garden - slug , which had come indoors to - night for reasons of its own . It was [Nature]161-nature 's second way of hinting to [him]144-gabriel that [he]144-gabriel was to prepare for foul weather . [Oak]144-gabriel sat down meditating for nearly an hour . During this time two black spiders , of the kind common in [thatched houses]5198-thatched houses , promenaded the ceiling , ultimately dropping to the floor . This reminded [him]144-gabriel that if there was one class of manifestation on this matter that [he]144-gabriel thoroughly understood , it was the instincts of sheep . [He]144-gabriel left [the room]4025-the room , ran across [two or three fields]5200-two or three fields towards the flock , got upon a hedge , and looked over among [them]5201-they . [They]5201-they were crowded close together on the other side around some furze bushes , and the first peculiarity ob- servable was that , on the sudden appearance of [Oak]144-gabriel 's head over the fence , [they]5201-they did not stir or run away . [They]5201-they had now a terror of something greater than [their]5201-they terror of [man]3450-man . But this was not the most noteworthy feature : [they]5201-they were all grouped in such a way that [their]5201-they tails , without a single exception , were towards that half of the horizon from which the storm threatened . There was an inner circle closely huddled , and outside these [they]5201-they radiated wider apart , the pattern formed by the flock as a whole not being unlike a vandyked lace collar , to which the clump of furze - bushes stood in the position of [a wearer]5203-a wearer 's neck . opinion . [He]144-gabriel knew now that [he]144-gabriel was right , and that [Troy]243-bathsheba was wrong . Every voice in nature was unanimous in bespeaking change . But two distinct translations attached to these dumb expressions . Apparently there was to be a thunder - storm , and afterwards a cold con- tinuous rain . The creeping things seemed to know all about the later rain , hut little of the interpolated thunder - storm ; whilst [the sheep]644-the sheep knew all about the thunder - storm and nothing of the later rain . This complication of weathers being uncommon , was all the more to be feared . [Oak]144-gabriel returned to [the stack - yard]5205-the stack - yard . All was silent here , and the conical tips of the ricks jutted darkly into the sky . There were five wheat - ricks in [this yard]5206-this yard , and three stacks of barley . The wheat when threshed would average about thirty quarters to each stack ; the barley , at least forty . Their value to [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba , and indeed to [anybody]3643-anybody , [Oak]144-gabriel mentally estimated by the following simple calcula- tion : - 5 x 30 150 quarters 500 L. 3 x 40 120 quarters 250 L. Total . . 750 L. Seven hundred and fifty pounds in the divinest form that money can wear - that of necessary food for [man]3450-man and beast : should the risk be run of deteriorating this bulk of corn to less than half its value , because of the instability of a woman?"Never[2150-the wretched persons of all the work - folk] , if [I]0-i can prevent it ! " said [Gabriel]144-gabriel . Such was the argument that [Oak]144-gabriel set outwardly before [him]144-gabriel . But [man]3450-man , even to [himself]3450-man , is a palimpsest , having an ostensible writing , and another beneath the lines . It is possible that there was this golden legend under the utilitarian one : "[180-coggan] [I]0-i will help to [my]0-i last effort [the woman [I]0-i have loved so dearly]2149-the woman i have loved so dearly . " [He]144-gabriel went back to [the barn]719-the barn to endeavour to obtain assistance for covering the ricks that very night . All was silent within , and [he]144-gabriel would have passed on in the belief that [the party]5211-the party had broken up , had not a dim light , yellow as saffron by contrast with the greenish whiteness outside , streamed through a knot - hole in the folding doors . [Gabriel]144-gabriel looked in . An unusual picture met [his]144-gabriel eye . The candles suspended among the evergreens had burnt down to their sockets , and in some cases the leaves tied about them were scorched . Many of the lights had quite gone out , others smoked and stank , grease dropping from them upon the floor . Here , under the table , and leaning against forms and chairs in every conceivable attitude except the perpendicular , ! "[144-gabriel] were [the wretched persons of all the work - folk]2150-the wretched persons of all the work - folk , the hair of [their]2150-the wretched persons of all the work - folk heads at such low levels being suggestive of mops and brooms . In the midst of these shone red and distinct the figure of [Sergeant Troy]243-bathsheba , leaning back in a chair . [Coggan]180-coggan was on [his]180-coggan back , with [his]180-coggan mouth open , huzzing forth snores , as were [several others]2151-several others ; the united breathings of [the horizonal assemblage]2152-the horizonal assemblage forming a subdued roar like [London]70-london from a distance . [Joseph Poorgrass]196-joseph was curled round in the fashion of a hedge- hog , apparently in attempts to present the least possible portion of [his]196-joseph surface to the air ; and behind [him]196-joseph was dimly visible an unimportant remnant of [William Small-]278-william small- bury bury . The glasses and cups still stood upon the table , a water - jug being overturned , from which a small rill , after tracing its course with marvellous precision down the centre of the long table , fell into the neck of the unconscious [Mark Clark]178-mark clark , in a steady , monotonous drip , like the dripping of a stalactite in [a cave]2153-a cave . [Gabriel]144-gabriel glanced hopelessly at [the group , which , with one or two exceptions]2154-the group , which , with one or two exceptions , composed [all the able - bodied men upon [the farm]3760-the farm]2155-all the able - bodied men upon the farm . [He]144-gabriel saw at once that if [the ricks]2157-the ricks were to be saved that night , or even the next morning , [he]144-gabriel must save [them]2157-the ricks with [his]144-gabriel own hands . A faint " ting - ting "[181-matthew moon] resounded from under [Coggan]180-coggan 's waistcoat . It was [Coggan]180-coggan 's watch striking the hour of two . [Oak]144-gabriel went to the recumbent form of [Matthew Moon]181-matthew moon , who usually undertook the rough thatching of the home- stead , and shook [him]181-matthew moon . The shaking was without effect . [Gabriel]144-gabriel shouted in [his]181-matthew moon ear , " where 's [your]181-matthew moon thatching- beetle and rick - stick and spars ? "[144-gabriel] " Under the staddles . "[144-gabriel] said [Moon]181-matthew moon , mechanically , with the unconscious promptness of [a medium]2158-a medium . [Gabriel]144-gabriel let go [his]144-gabriel head , and it dropped upon the floor like a bowl . [He]144-gabriel then went to [[Susan Tall]211-susan tall 's husband]935-susan tall 's husband . " where 's the key of the granary ? "[211-susan tall] No answer . The question was repeated , with the same result . To be shouted to at night was evidently less of a novelty to [[Susan Tall]211-susan tall 's husband]935-susan tall 's husband than to [Matthew Moon]181-matthew moon . [Oak]144-gabriel flung down [Tall]211-susan tall 's head into the corner again and turned away . To be just , [the men]3799-the men were not greatly to blame for this painful and demoralizing termination to the evening 's entertainment . [Sergeant Troy]243-bathsheba had so strenu- ously insisted , glass in hand , that drinking should be the bond of [their]3799-the men union , that [those who wished to refuse]2162-those who wished to refuse hardly liked to be so unmannerly under the circum- stances . Having from [their]3799-the men youth up been entirely un- accustomed to any liquor stronger than cider or mild ale , it was no wonder that [they]3799-the men had succumbed , one and all , with extraordinary uniformity , after the lapse of about an hour . [Gabriel]144-gabriel was greatly depressed . This debauch boded ill for [that wilful and fascinating mistress whom [the faithful man]2164-the faithful man even now felt within [him]144-gabriel]2163-that wilful and fascinating mistress whom the faithful man even now felt within him as [the embodi- ment of all that was sweet and bright and hopeless]2165-the embodi- ment of all that was sweet and bright and hopeless . [He]144-gabriel put out the expiring lights , that [the barn]719-the barn might not be endangered , closed the door upon [the men]3799-the men in [their]3799-the men deep and oblivious sleep , and went again into the lone night . A hot breeze , as if breathed from the parted lips of some dragon about to swallow the globe , fanned [him]144-gabriel from the south , while directly opposite in [the north]3948-the north rose a grim misshapen body of cloud , in the very teeth of the wind . So unnaturally did it rise that [one]4328-one could fancy it to be lifted by machinery from below . Meanwhile the faint cloudlets had flown back into the south - east corner of the sky , as if in terror of the large cloud , like [a young brood gazed in upon by some monster]2170-a young brood gazed in upon by some monster . Going on to [the village]3754-the village , [Oak]144-gabriel flung a small stone against the window of [[Laban Tall]213-laban 's bedroom]2172-laban tall 's bedroom , expecting [Susan]211-susan tall to open [it]2173-it ; but [nobody]439-nobody stirred . [He]144-gabriel went round to the back door , which had been left unfastened for [Laban]213-laban 's entry , and passed in to the foot of the stair- case . " [Mrs. Tall]211-susan tall , [I]144-gabriel 've come for the key of [the granary]5212-the granary , to get at the rick - cloths . "[144-gabriel] said [Oak]144-gabriel , in a stentorian voice . " Is that [you]144-gabriel ? "[144-gabriel] said [Mrs. Susan Tall]211-susan tall , half awake . " Yes . "[211-susan tall] said [Gabriel]144-gabriel . " Come along to bed , do , [you]144-gabriel [drawlatching rogue]5213-drawlatching rogue - keeping a body awake like this . "[144-gabriel] " It is n't [Laban]213-laban - ' tis [Gabriel Oak]144-gabriel . [I]144-gabriel want the key of [the granary]5212-the granary . "[144-gabriel] " [Gabriel]144-gabriel . what in the name of fortune did [you]144-gabriel pretend to be [Laban]213-laban for ? "[211-susan tall] " [I]144-gabriel did n't . [I]144-gabriel thought [you]144-gabriel meant - - "[144-gabriel] " Yes [you]144-gabriel did ! what do [you]144-gabriel want here ? "[144-gabriel] " The key of [the granary]5212-the granary . "[144-gabriel] " Take it then . ' Tis on the nail . [People]3461-people coming disturbing [women]493-women at this time of night ought - - "[243-bathsheba] [Gabriel]144-gabriel took the key , without waiting to hear the conclusion of the tirade . Ten minutes later [his]144-gabriel lonely figure might have been seen dragging four large water- proof coverings across [the yard]2175-the yard , and soon two of these heaps of treasure in grain were covered snug - two cloths to each . Two hundred pounds were secured . Three wheat - stacks remained open , and there were no more cloths . [Oak]144-gabriel looked under the staddles and found a fork . [He]144-gabriel mounted the third pile of wealth and began operating , adopting the plan of sloping the upper sheaves one over the other ; and , in addition , filling the interstices with the material of some untied sheaves . So far all was well . By this hurried contrivance [[Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's property]2176-bathsheba 's property in wheat was safe for at any rate a week or two , provided always that there was not much wind . Next came the barley . This it was only possible to protect by systematic thatching . Time went on , and the moon vanished not to reappear . It was the farewell of [the ambassador]2177-the ambassador previous to war . The night had a haggard look , like a sick thing ; and there came finally an utter expiration of air from the whole heaven in the form of a slow breeze , which might have been likened to a death . And now nothing was heard in [the yard]2175-the yard but the dull thuds of the beetle which drove in the spars , and the rustle of thatch in the intervals . CHAPTER XXXVII THE STORM - THE TWO TOGETHER A LIGHT flapped over the scene , as if reflected from phosphorescent wings crossing the sky , and a rumble filled the air . It was the first move of the approaching storm . The second peal was noisy , with comparatively little visible lightning . [Gabriel]144-gabriel saw a candle shining in [[Bath- sheba]168-bath- sheba 's bedroom]2179-bath- sheba 's bedroom , and soon a shadow swept to and fro upon the blind . Then there came a third flash . Manoeuvres of a most extraordinary kind were going on in [the vast firmamental hollows overhead]2180-the vast firmamental hollows overhead . The lightning now was the colour of silver , and gleamed in the heavens like [a mailed army]2181-a mailed army . Rumbles became rattles . [Gabriel]144-gabriel from [his]144-gabriel elevated position could see over [the landscape]3471-the landscape at least half - a - dozen miles in front . Every hedge , bush , and tree was distinct as in a line engraving . In [a paddock in the same direction]2183-a paddock in the same direction was a herd of heifers , and the forms of these were visible at this moment in the act of galloping about in the wildest and maddest confusion , flinging [their]2184-their heels and tails high into the air , [their]2184-their heads to earth . A poplar in the immediate fore- ground was like an ink stroke on burnished tin . Then the picture vanished , leaving the darkness so intense that [Gabriel]144-gabriel worked entirely by feeling with [his]144-gabriel hands . [He]144-gabriel had stuck [his]144-gabriel ricking - rod , or poniard , as it was indifferently called - a long iron lance , polished by handling - into the stack , used to support the sheaves instead of the support called a groom used on [houses]2185-houses , A blue light appeared in the zenith , and in some in- describable manner flickered down near the top of the rod . It was the fourth of the larger flashes . A moment later and there was a smack - smart , clear , and short , [Gabriel]144-gabriel felt [his]144-gabriel position to be anything but a safe one , and [he]144-gabriel resolved to descend . Not a drop of rain had fallen as yet . [He]144-gabriel wiped [his]144-gabriel weary brow , and looked again at the black forms of the unprotected stacks . Was [his]144-gabriel life so valuable to [him]144-gabriel after all ? What were [his]144-gabriel prospects that [he]144-gabriel should be so chary of running risk , when important and urgent labour could not be carried on without such risk ? [He]144-gabriel resolved to stick to the stack . How- ever , [he]144-gabriel took a precaution . Under the staddles was a long tethering chain , used to prevent the escape of errant horses . This [he]144-gabriel carried up the ladder , and sticking [his]144-gabriel rod through the clog at one end , allowed the other end of the chain to trail upon the ground The spike attached to it [he]144-gabriel drove in . Under the shadow of this extemporized lightning - conductor [he]144-gabriel felt [himself]144-gabriel comparatively safe . Before [Oak]144-gabriel had laid [his]144-gabriel hands upon [his]144-gabriel tools again out leapt the fifth flash , with the spring of a serpent and the shout of [a fiend]2186-a fiend . It was green as an emerald , and the reverberation was stunning . What was this the light revealed to [him]144-gabriel ? In [the open ground before [him]144-gabriel]2187-the open ground before him , as [he]144-gabriel looked over the ridge of the rick , was [a dark and apparently female form]2188-a dark and apparently female form . Could it be that of [the only venturesome woman in [the parish]422-the parish]2189-the only venturesome woman in the parish - [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba ? The form moved on a step : then [he]144-gabriel could see no more . " Is that [you]243-bathsheba , [ma'am]712-ma'am ? "[243-bathsheba] said [Gabriel]144-gabriel to the darkness . " Who is [there]3509-there ? "[2191-he] said the voice of [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba , " [Gabriel]144-gabriel . [I]2191-he am on the rick , thatching . "[2191-he] " O , [Gabriel]144-gabriel ! - and are [you]144-gabriel ? [I]144-gabriel have come about [them]5220-them . The weather awoke [me]144-gabriel , and [I]144-gabriel thought of the corn . [I]144-gabriel am so distressed about it - can [we]5221-we save it any- how ? [I]144-gabriel can not find [[my]144-gabriel husband]5222-my husband . Is [he]2191-he with [you]144-gabriel ? "[144-gabriel] [He]2191-he is not [here]575-here . " "[2191-he] Do [you]144-gabriel know where [he]2191-he is ? " "[0-i] Asleep in [the barn]719-the barn . " "[144-gabriel] [He]2191-he promised that the stacks should be seen to , and now they are all neglected ! Can [I]0-i do anything to help ? [Liddy]191-liddy is afraid to come out . Fancy finding [you]144-gabriel [here]575-here at such an hour ! Surely [I]0-i can do something ? " "[0-i] [You]144-gabriel can bring up some reed - sheaves to [me]0-i , one by one , [ma'am]712-ma'am ; if [you]144-gabriel are not afraid to come up the ladder in the dark . " said [Gabriel]144-gabriel . "[0-i] Every moment is precious now , and that would save a good deal of time . It is not very dark when the lightning has been gone a bit . " "[0-i] [I]0-i 'll do anything ! " [she]0-i said , resolutely . [She]0-i instantly took a sheaf upon [her]0-i shoulder , clambered up close to [his]144-gabriel heels , placed it behind the rod , and descended for another . At [her]0-i third ascent the rick suddenly brightened with the brazen glare of shining majolica - every knot in every straw was visible . On the slope in front of [him]144-gabriel appeared [two human shapes]5223-two human shapes , black as jet . The rick lost its sheen - the shapes vanished . [Gabriel]144-gabriel turned [his]144-gabriel head . It had been the sixth flash which had come from the east behind [him]144-gabriel , and the two dark forms on the slope had been the shadows of [himself]144-gabriel and [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba . Then came the peal . It hardly was credible that such a heavenly light could be the parent of such a diabolical sound . "[0-i] How terrible ! " [she]0-i exclaimed , and clutched [him]144-gabriel by the sleeve . [Gabriel]144-gabriel turned , and steadied [her]0-i on [her]0-i aerial perch by holding [her]0-i arm . At the same moment , while [he]144-gabriel was still reversed in [his]144-gabriel attitude , there was more light , and [he]144-gabriel saw , as it were , a copy of the tall poplar tree on [the hill]3452-the hill drawn in black on the wall of [the barn]719-the barn . It was the shadow of that tree , thrown across by a secondary flash in the west . The next flare came . [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba was on the ground now , shouldering another sheaf , and [she]0-i bore its dazzle without flinching - thunder and ali - and again ascended with the load . There was then a silence everywhere for four or five minutes , and the crunch of the spars , as [Gabriel]144-gabriel hastily drove them in , could again be distinctly heard . [He]144-gabriel thought the crisis of the storm had passed . But there came a burst of light . "[0-i] Hold on ! " said [Gabriel]144-gabriel , taking the sheaf from [her]0-i shoulder , and grasping [her]0-i arm again . [Heaven]5226-heaven opened then , indeed . The flash was almost too novel for its inexpressibly dangerous nature to be at once realized , and [they]5227-they could only comprehend the magnificence of its beauty . It sprang from east , west , north , south , and was a perfect dance of death . The forms of skeletons appeared in the air , shaped with blue fire for bones - dancing , leaping , striding , racing around , and mingling altogether in unparalleled con- fusion . With these were intertwined undulating snakes of green , and behind these was a broad mass of lesser light . Simultaneously came from every part of the tumbling sky what may be called a shout ; since , though no shout ever came near it , it was more of the nature of a shout than of anything else earthly . In the meantime one of the grisly forms had alighted upon the point of [Gabriel]144-gabriel 's rod , to run invisibly down it , down the chain , and into [the earth]1149-the earth . [Gabriel]144-gabriel was almost blinded , and [he]144-gabriel could feel [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's warm arm tremble in [his]144-gabriel hand - a sensation novel and thrilling enough ; but love , life , everything human , seemed small and trifling in such close juxtaposition with an infuriated universe . [Oak]144-gabriel had hardly time to gather up these impressions into a thought , and to see how strangely the red feather of [her]0-i hat shone in this light , when the tall tree on [the hill before mentioned]5229-the hill before mentioned seemed on fire to a white heat , and a new one among these terrible voices mingled with the last crash of those preceding . It was a stupefying blast , harsh and pitiless , and it fell upon [their]5227-they ears in a dead , flat blow , without that reverberation which lends the tones of a drum to more distant thunder . By the lustre reflected from every part of [the earth]1149-the earth and from the wide domical scoop above it , [he]144-gabriel saw that the tree was sliced down the whole length of [its]144-gabriel tall , straight stem , a huge riband of bark being apparently flung off . The other portion remained erect , and revealed the bared surface as a strip of white down the front . The lightning had struck the tree . A sulphurous smell filled the air ; then all was silent , and black as a cave in [Hinnom]96-hinnom . "[0-i] [We]2196-we had [a narrow escape]2197-a narrow escape ! " said [Gabriel]144-gabriel , hurriedly . "[0-i] [You]2198-you had better go down . " [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba said nothing ; but [he]144-gabriel could distinctly hear [her]0-i rhythmical pants , and the recurrent rustle of the sheaf beside [her]0-i in response to [her]0-i frightened pulsations . [She]0-i descended the ladder , and , on second thoughts , [he]144-gabriel followed [her]0-i . The darkness was now impenetrable by the sharpest vision . [They]2196-we both stood still at the bottom , side by side . [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba appeared to think only of the weather - [Oak]144-gabriel thought only of [her]0-i just then . At last [he]144-gabriel said - "[0-i] The storm seems to have passed now , at any rate . " "[269-heaven] [I]0-i think so too . " said [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba . "[269-heaven] Though there are multitudes of gleams , look ! " The sky was now filled with an incessant light , frequent repetition melting into complete continuity , as an unbroken sound results from the successive strokes on a gong . "[0-i] Nothing serious . " said [he]144-gabriel . "[1958-some of the others] [I]0-i can not understand no rain falling . But [Heaven]269-heaven be praised , it is all the better for [us]2199-us . [I]0-i am now going up again . " "[1958-some of the others] [Gabriel]144-gabriel , [you]144-gabriel are kinder than [I]0-i deserve ! [I]0-i will stay and help [you]144-gabriel yet . O , why are not [some of [the others]3772-the others]1958-some of the others [here]575-here ! " "[0-i] [They]1958-some of the others would have been [here]575-here if [they]1958-some of the others could . " said [Oak]144-gabriel , in a hesitating way . "[0-i] O , [I]0-i know it all - all . " [she]0-i said , adding slowly : "[0-i] [They]1958-some of the others are all asleep in [the barn]719-the barn , in a drunken sleep , and [[my]0-i husband]5222-my husband among [them]1958-some of the others . That 's it , is it not ? Do n't think [I]0-i am [a timid woman]2206-a timid woman and ca n't endure things . " "[0-i] [I]0-i am not certain . " said [Gabriel]144-gabriel . "[144-gabriel] [I]0-i will go and see , " [He]144-gabriel crossed to [the barn]719-the barn , leaving [her]0-i there alone . [He]144-gabriel looked through the chinks of the door . All was in total darkness , as [he]144-gabriel had left [it]719-the barn , and there still arose , as at the former time , the steady buzz of many snores . [He]144-gabriel felt a zephyr curling about [his]144-gabriel cheek , and turned . It was [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's breath - [she]0-i had followed [him]144-gabriel , and was looking into the same chink . [He]144-gabriel endeavoured to put off the immediate and pain- ful subject of [their]5232-their thoughts by remarking gently , "[996-mistress] If [you]0-i 'll come back again , [miss - ma'am]2207-miss - ma'am , and hand up a few more ; it would save much time . " Then [Oak]144-gabriel went back again , ascended to the top , stepped off the ladder for greater expedition , and went on thatching . [She]0-i followed , but without a sheaf "[996-mistress] [Gabriel]144-gabriel . " [she]0-i said , in a strange and impressive voice . [Oak]144-gabriel looked up at [her]0-i . [She]0-i had not spoken since [he]144-gabriel left [the barn]719-the barn . The soft and continual shimmer of the dying lightning showed a marble face high against the black sky of [the opposite quarter]5234-the opposite quarter . [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba was sitting almost on the apex of the stack , [her]0-i feet gathered up beneath [her]0-i , and resting on the top round of the ladder . "[0-i] Yes , [mistress]996-mistress . " [he]144-gabriel said . "[0-i] [I]0-i suppose [you]0-i thought that when [I]0-i galloped away to [Bath]79-bath that night it was on purpose to be married ? " "[618-others] [I]0-i did at last - not at first . " [he]144-gabriel answered , somewhat surprised at the abruptness with which this new subject was broached . "[618-others] And [others]618-others thought so , too ? " "[0-i] Yes . " "[0-i] And [you]0-i blamed [me]0-i for it ? " "[0-i] Well - a little . " "[0-i] [I]0-i thought so . Now , [I]0-i care a little for [your]0-i good opinion , and [I]0-i want to explain something - [i]0-i have longed to do it ever since [I]0-i returned , and [you]0-i looked so gravely at [me]0-i . For if [I]0-i were to die - and [I]0-i may die soon - it would be dreadful that [you]0-i should always think mistakenly of [me]0-i . Now , listen . " [Gabriel]144-gabriel ceased [his]144-gabriel rustling . "[0-i] [I]0-i went to [Bath]79-bath that night in the full intention of breaking off [my]0-i engagement to [Mr. Troy]304-mr. troy . " "[304-mr. troy] [I]0-i must , [I]0-i suppose , say more , now that [I]0-i have begun . And perhaps it 's no harm , for [you]0-i are certainly under no delusion that [I]0-i ever loved [you]0-i , or that [I]0-i can have any object in speaking , more than that object [I]0-i have mentioned . Well , [I]0-i was alone in [a strange city]2211-a strange city , and the horse was lame . And at last [I]0-i did n't know what to do . [I]0-i saw , when it was too late , that scandal might seize hold of [me]0-i for meeting [him]304-mr. troy alone in that way . But [I]0-i was coming away , when [he]304-mr. troy suddenly said [he]304-mr. troy had that day seen [a woman more beautiful than [I]0-i]2212-a woman more beautiful than i , and that [his]304-mr. troy constancy could not be counted on unless [I]0-i at once became [[his]304-mr. troy ....]2213-his .... And [I]0-i was grieved and troubled - - " [She]0-i cleared [her]0-i voice , and waited a moment , as if to gather breath . "[304-mr. troy] And then , between jealousy and distraction , [I]0-i married [him]304-mr. troy ! " [she]0-i whispered with desperate impetuosity . [Gabriel]144-gabriel made no reply . "[0-i] [He]304-mr. troy was not to blame , for it was perfectly true about - about [his]304-mr. troy seeing [somebody else]2033-somebody else . " [she]0-i quickly added . "[0-i] And now [I]0-i do n't wish for a single remark from [you]304-mr. troy upon the subject - indeed , [I]0-i forbid it . " [She]0-i went down the ladder , and the work proceeded . [Gabriel]144-gabriel soon perceived a languor in the movements of [[his]144-gabriel mistress]4518-his mistress up and down , and [he]144-gabriel said to [her]0-i , gently as [a mother]5236-a mother - "[0-i] [I]0-i think [you]304-mr. troy had better go indoors now , [you]304-mr. troy are tired . " [she]0-i said , gratefully . ! Thank [you]304-mr. troy for [your]304-mr. troy devotion , a thousand times , [Gabriel]144-gabriel ! "[144-gabriel] [She]0-i diminished in the gloom , and vanished , and [he]304-mr. troy heard the latch of the gate fall as [she]0-i passed through . [He]304-mr. troy worked in a reverie now , musing upon [her]0-i story , and upon the contradictoriness of that feminine heart which had caused [her]0-i to speak more warmly to [him]304-mr. troy to - night than [she]0-i ever had done whilst unmarried and free to speak as warmly as [she]0-i chose . [He]304-mr. troy was disturbed in [his]304-mr. troy meditation by a grating noise from [the coach - house]4991-the coach - house . It was the vane on the roof turning round , and this change in the wind was the signal for a disastrous rain . CHAPTER XXXVIII RAIN - ONE SOLITARY MEETS ANOTHER IT was now five o'clock , and the dawn was promising to break in hues of drab and ash . The air changed its temperature and stirred itself more vigorously . Cool breezes coursed in transparent eddies round [Oak]144-gabriel 's face . The wind shifted yet a point or two and blew stronger . In ten minutes every wind of [heaven]5226-heaven seemed to be roaming at large . Some of the thatching on the wheat - stacks was now whirled fantas- tically aloft , and had to be replaced and weighted with some rails that lay near at hand . This done , [Oak]144-gabriel slaved away again at the barley . A huge drop of rain smote [his]144-gabriel face , the wind snarled round every corner , the trees rocked to the bases of their trunks , and the twigs clashed in strife . Driving in spars at any point and on any system , inch by inch [he]144-gabriel covered more and more safely from ruin this distracting impersonation of seven hundred pounds . " The rain came on in earnest , and [Oak]144-gabriel soon felt the water to be tracking cold and clammy routes down [his]144-gabriel back . Ultimately [he]144-gabriel was reduced well - nigh to a homogeneous sop , and the dyes of [his]144-gabriel clothes trickled down and stood in a pool at the foot of the ladder . The rain stretched obliquely through the dull atmo- sphere in liquid spines , unbroken in continuity between their beginnings in the clouds and their points in [him]144-gabriel . [Oak]144-gabriel suddenly remembered that eight months before this time [he]144-gabriel had been fighting against fire in the same spot as desperately as [he]144-gabriel was fighting against water now - and for a futile love of [the same woman]5237-the same woman . As for [her]5237-the same woman - - But [Oak]144-gabriel was generous and true , and dis- missed [his]144-gabriel reflections . It was about seven o'clock in the dark leaden morning when [Gabriel]144-gabriel came down from the last stack , and thankfully exclaimed , "[144-gabriel] It is done ! " [He]304-mr. troy was drenched , weary , and sad , and yet not so sad as drenched and weary , for [he]304-mr. troy was cheered by a sense of success in a good cause . Faint sounds came from [the barn]719-the barn , and [he]304-mr. troy looked that way . [Figures]5239-figures stepped singly and in pairs through the doors - all walking awkwardly , and abashed , save the foremost , who wore a red jacket , and advanced with [his]144-gabriel hands in [his]144-gabriel pockets , whistling . [The others]3772-the others shambled after with a conscience - stricken air : [the whole procession]5241-the whole procession was not unlike [[Flaxman]341-flaxman 's group of [the suitors]5243-the suitors tottering on towards [the infernal regions]5244-the infernal regions under the conduct of [Mercury]342-mercury]5242-flaxman 's group of the suitors tottering on towards the infernal regions under the conduct of mercury . The gnarled shapes passed into [the village]3754-the village , [Troy]243-bathsheba , [[their]5239-figures leader]5246-their leader , entering [the farmhouse]3979-the farmhouse . Not [a single one of [them]5239-figures]5248-a single one of them had turned [his]144-gabriel face to the ricks , or apparently bestowed one thought upon [their]5239-figures condition . Soon [Oak]144-gabriel too went [homeward]5249-homeward , by a different route from [theirs]5239-figures . In front of [him]144-gabriel against the wet glazed surface of [the lane]3664-the lane [he]144-gabriel saw [a person]4741-a person walking yet more slowly than [himself]4741-a person under an umbrella . [The man]726-the man turned and plainly started ; [he]726-the man was [Boldwood]224-boldwood . "[0-i] How are [you]2217-you this morning , [sir]3717-sir ? " said [Oak]144-gabriel . "[0-i] Yes , it is a wet day . - Oh , [I]0-i am well , very well , [I]0-i thank [you]3717-sir ; quite well . " "[144-gabriel] [I]0-i am glad to hear it , [sir]3717-sir . " [Boldwood]224-boldwood seemed to awake to the present by degrees . "[0-i] [You]0-i look tired and ill , [Oak]144-gabriel . " "[0-i] Indeed , then [you]0-i are mistaken . " said [Boldwood]224-boldwood , shortly . "[0-i] Nothing hurts [me]0-i . [My]0-i constitution is an iron one . "[0-i] " Then not a tenth of [your]3717-sir corn will come to measure , [sir]3717-sir . "[0-i] " Possibly not . "[0-i] Overlooked them . " repeated [Gabriel]144-gabriel slowly to [him-]0-i self . It is difficult to describe the intensely dramatic effect that announcement had upon [Oak]144-gabriel at such a moment . All the night [he]144-gabriel had been feeling that the neglect [he]144-gabriel was labouring to repair was abnormal and isolated - the only instance of the kind within [the circuit of [the county]5256-the county]5255-the circuit of the county . Yet at this very time , within [the same parish]5257-the same parish , a greater waste had been going on , uncomplained of and disregarded . A few months earlier [Boldwood]224-boldwood 's forgetting [[his]224-boldwood husbandry]5258-his husbandry would have been as preposter- ous an idea as [a sailor]5259-a sailor forgetting [he]5259-a sailor was in [a ship]553-a ship . "[2237-an erect , well - made young man] CHAPTER XXXIX COMING [HOME]556-home - A CRY ON [the turnpike road]2228-the turnpike road , between [Casterbridge]22-casterbridge and [Weatherbury]196-joseph , and about three miles from the former which pervade [the highways of [this undulating part of [South Wessex]98-south wessex]2230-this undulating part of south wessex]2229-the highways of this undulating part of south wessex . [I]0-i returning from market it is usual for [the farmers]4127-the farmers and [other gig - gentry]2232-other gig - gentry to alight at the bottom and walk up . One Saturday evening in the month of October [[Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's vehicle]2233-bathsheba 's vehicle was duly creeping up this incline . "[2237-an erect , well - made young man] " But the time of year is come for changeable weather . "[243-bathsheba] " Well , yes . The fact is , these autumn races are the ruin of [everybody]954-everybody . Never did [I]243-bathsheba see such a day as ' twas ! ' Tis [a wild open place]5273-a wild open place , just out of [Budmouth]99-budmouth , and [a drab sea]5274-a drab sea rolled in towards [us]5270-our like liquid misery . ' Twas five o'clock , and [you]5269-my love could n't see the horses till [they]5276-they were almost in , leave alone colours . [The ground]4422-the ground was as heavy as lead , and all judgment from [a fellow]5278-a fellow 's experi- ence went for nothing . [Horses]5279-horses , [riders]5280-riders , [people]3461-people , were all blown about like [ships at]5282-ships at [sea]5283-sea . "[243-bathsheba] After advancing the distance which completed the ascent of [the hill]3452-the hill , [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba turned [her]2261-her head . [Troy]243-bathsheba then came on towards [[his]243-bathsheba wife]4301-his wife , stepped into the gig , took the reins from [her]4301-his wife hand , and without making any observation whipped the horse into a trot . "[3527-the woman] " Think if [you]168-bath- sheba will , and be - - "[3527-the woman] The sentence was completed by a smart cut of the whip round [Poppet]311-poppet 's flank , which caused the animal to start forward at a wild pace . No more was said . [CHAPTER XL ON CASTERBRIDGE HIGHWAY]102-chapter xl on casterbridge highway FOR a considerable time [the woman]3527-the woman walked on . [Her]3527-the woman steps became feebler , and [she]3527-the woman strained [her]3527-the woman eyes to look afar upon [the naked road]2269-the naked road , now indistinct amid the penumbrae of night . At length [her]3527-the woman onward walk dwindled to the merest totter , and [she]3527-the woman opened a gate within which was a haystack . Underneath this [she]3527-the woman sat down and presently slept . When [the woman]3527-the woman awoke it was to find [herself]3527-the woman in the depths of a moonless and starless night . A heavy un- broken crust of cloud stretched across the sky , shutting out every speck of heaven ; and a distant halo which hung over [the town of Casterbridge]2271-the town of casterbridge was visible against the black concave , the luminosity appearing the brighter by its great contrast with the circumscribing darkness . Towards this weak , soft glow [the woman]3527-the woman turned [her]3527-the woman eyes . " If [I]2279-the pedestrian could only get [there]3509-there ! "[2279-the pedestrian] [she]3527-the woman said . " Meet [him]5307-him the day after to - morrow : God help [me]3527-the woman ! Perhaps [I]3527-the woman shall be in [my]3527-the woman grave before then . "[3527-the woman] [A manor - house clock from [the far depths of shadow]2274-the far depths of shadow]2273-a manor - house clock from the far depths of shadow struck the hour , one , in a small , attenuated tone . After midnight the voice of a clock seems to lose in breadth as much as in length , and to diminish its sonorousness to a thin falsetto . Afterwards a light - two lights - arose from the re- mote shade , and grew larger . [A carriage]2275-a carriage rolled along the toad , and passed the gate . [It]2276-it probably contained [some late diners]2277-some late diners - out . The beams from one lamp shone for a moment upon [the crouching woman]2278-the crouching woman , and threw [her]2278-the crouching woman face into vivid relieff . The face was young in the groundwork , old in the finish ; the general contours were flexuous and childlike , but the finer lineaments had begun to be sharp and thin . [The pedestrian]2279-the pedestrian stood up , apparently with revived determination , and looked around . [The road]477-the road appeared to be familiar to [her]2279-the pedestrian , and [she]2279-the pedestrian carefully scanned the fence as [she]2279-the pedestrian slowly walked along . Presently there became visible a dim white shape ; it was another milestone . [She]2279-the pedestrian drew [her]2279-the pedestrian fingers across [its]2281-its face to feel the marks . " Two more ! "[2279-the pedestrian] [she]2279-the pedestrian said . [She]2279-the pedestrian leant against the stone as a means of rest for a short interval , then bestirred [herself]2279-the pedestrian , and again pursued [her]2279-the pedestrian way . For a slight distance [she]2279-the pedestrian bore up bravely , afterwards flagging as before . This was beside [a lone copsewood]2282-a lone copsewood , wherein heaps of white chips strewn upon the leafy ground showed that [woodmen]2283-woodmen had been faggoting and making hurdles during the day . Now there was not a rustle , not a breeze , not the faintest clash of twigs to keep [her]2279-the pedestrian company . [The woman]3527-the woman looked over the gate , opened it , and went in . Close to the entrance stood a row of faggots , bound and un- bound , together with stakes of all sizes . For a few seconds [the wayfarer]2285-the wayfarer stood with that tense stillness which signifies itself to be not the end but merely the suspension , of a previous motion . [Her]3527-the woman attitude was that of [a person who listens , either to the external world of sound , or to the imagined discourse of thought]2286-a person who listens , either to the external world of sound , or to the imagined discourse of thought . A close criticism might have detected signs proving that [she]3527-the woman was intent on the latter alternative . Moreover , as was shown by what followed , [she]3527-the woman was oddly exercising the faculty of invention upon the spe- ciality of [the clever Jacquet Droz]347-the clever jacquet droz , [the designer of auto- matic substitutes for human limbs]2287-the designer of auto- matic substitutes for human limbs . By the aid of [the Casterbridge aurora]2288-the casterbridge aurora , and by feeling with [her]2279-the pedestrian hands , [the woman]3527-the woman selected two sticks from the heaps . These sticks were nearly straight to the height of three or four feet , where each branched into a fork like the letter Y. [She]2279-the pedestrian sat down , snapped off the small upper twigs , and carried the remainder with [her]2279-the pedestrian into [the road]477-the road . [She]2279-the pedestrian placed one of these forks under each arm as a crutch , tested them , timidly threw [her]2279-the pedestrian whole weight upon them - so little that it was - and swung [herself]2279-the pedestrian forward . [The girl]462-the girl had made for [herself]462-the girl a material aid . The crutches answered well . The pat of [her]3527-the woman feet , and the tap of [her]3527-the woman sticks upon [the highway]2292-the highway , were all the sounds that came from [the traveller]4708-the traveller now . [She]2279-the pedestrian had passed the last milestone by a good long distance , and began to look wistfully towards [the bank]4832-the bank as if calculating upon another milestone soon . The crutches , though so very useful , had their limits of power . [Mechanism]348-mechanism only transfers labour , being powerless to supersede it , and the original amount of exertion was not cleared away ; it was thrown into the body and arms . [She]2279-the pedestrian was exhausted , and each swing forward became fainter . At last [she]2279-the pedestrian swayed sideways , and fell . Here [she]2279-the pedestrian lay , a shapeless heap , for ten minutes and more . The morning wind began to boom dully over [the flats]1432-the flats , and to move afresh dead leaves which had lain still since yesterday . [The woman]3527-the woman desperately turned round upon [her]3527-the woman knees , and next rose to [her]3527-the woman feet . Steadying [herself]2279-the pedestrian by the help of one crutch , [she]2279-the pedestrian essayed a step , then another , then a third , using the crutches now as walking - sticks only . Thus [she]2279-the pedestrian pro- gressed till descending [Mellstock Hill]103-mellstock hill another milestone appeared , and soon the beginning of an iron - railed fence came into view . [She]2279-the pedestrian staggered across to the first post , clung to [it]2297-it , and looked around . The [Casterbridge]22-casterbridge lights were now individually visible , It was getting towards morning , and vehicles might be hoped for , if not expected soon . [She]2279-the pedestrian listened . There was not a sound of life save that acme and sublimation of all dismal sounds , the hark of a fox , its three hollow notes being rendered at intervals of a minute with the precision of a funeral bell . " Less than a mile ! "[2279-the pedestrian] [the woman]3527-the woman murmured . " No ; more . "[2279-the pedestrian] [she]2279-the pedestrian added , after a pause . " [The mile]5308-the mile is to [the county hall]5309-the county hall , and [my]2279-the pedestrian resting - place is on [the other side [Casterbridge]22-casterbridge]5310-the other side casterbridge . A little over a mile , and there [I]2279-the pedestrian am ! "[2279-the pedestrian] After an interval [she]2279-the pedestrian again spoke . " Five or six steps to [a yard]5311-a yard - six perhaps . [I]2279-the pedestrian have to go seventeen hundred yards . A hundred times six , six hundred . Seventeen times that . O pity [me]2279-the pedestrian , [Lord]5312-lord ! "[2279-the pedestrian] Holding to the rails , [she]2279-the pedestrian advanced , thrusting one hand forward upon the rail , then the other , then leaning over it whilst [she]2279-the pedestrian dragged [her]2279-the pedestrian feet on beneath . [This woman]2299-this woman was not given to soliloquy ; but ex- tremity of feeling lessens the individuality of the weak , as it increases that of the strong . [She]2279-the pedestrian said again in the same tone , " [I]2279-the pedestrian 'll believe that the end lies five posts for- ward , and no further , and so get strength to pass them . "[2279-the pedestrian] This was a practical application of the principle that a half - feigned and fictitious faith is better than no faith at all . [She]2279-the pedestrian passed five posts and held on to the fifth . " [I]2279-the pedestrian 'll pass five more by believing [my]2279-the pedestrian longed - for spot is at the next fifth . [I]2279-the pedestrian can do it . "[2279-the pedestrian] [she]2279-the pedestrian passed five more . " [It]5313-it lies only five further . "[2279-the pedestrian] [She]2279-the pedestrian passed five more . " But it is five further . "[2279-the pedestrian] [She]2279-the pedestrian passed them . " [That stone bridge]5314-that stone bridge is the end of [my]2279-the pedestrian journey . "[2279-the pedestrian] [she]2279-the pedestrian said , when [the bridge over [the Froom]104-the froom]2300-the bridge over the froom was in view . [She]2279-the pedestrian crawled to [the bridge]1424-the bridge . During the effort each breath of [the woman]3527-the woman went into the air as if never to return again . " Now for the truth of the matter . "[2279-the pedestrian] [she]2279-the pedestrian said , sitting down . " The truth is , that [I]2279-the pedestrian have less than half a mile . "[2279-the pedestrian] Self - beguilement with what [she]2279-the pedestrian had known all the time to be false had given [her]2279-the pedestrian strength to come over half a mile that [she]2279-the pedestrian would have been powerless to face in the lump . The artifice showed that [the woman]3527-the woman , by some mysterious intuition , had grasped the paradoxical truth that blindness may operate more vigorously than prescience , and the short - sighted effect more than the far - seeing ; that limitation , and not comprehensiveness , is needed for striking a blow . The half - mile stood now before [the sick and weary woman]2304-the sick and weary woman like [a stolid Juggernaut]2305-a stolid juggernaut . It was an impassive King of [[her]3527-the woman world]2306-her world . [The road]477-the road here ran across [Durnover Moor]105-durnover moor , open to [the road]477-the road on either side . [She]2279-the pedestrian surveyed [the wide space]2309-the wide space , the lights , [herself]2279-the pedestrian , sighed , and lay down against a guard - stone of [the bridge]1424-the bridge . Never was ingenuity exercised so sorely as [the traveller]4708-the traveller [here]575-here exercised [hers]4708-the traveller . Every conceivable aid , method , stratagem , mechanism , by which these last desperate eight hundred yards could be overpassed by [a human being unperceived]2313-a human being unperceived , was revolved in [her]2279-the pedestrian busy brain , and dismissed as impracticable . [She]2279-the pedestrian thought of sticks , wheels , crawling - [she]2279-the pedestrian even thought of rolling . But the exertion demanded by either of these latter two was greater than to walk erect . The faculty of con- trivance was worn out , Hopelessness had come at last . " No further ! "[2359-the lord] [she]2279-the pedestrian whispered , and closed [her]2279-the pedestrian eyes . From the stripe of shadow on the opposite side of [the bridge]1424-the bridge a portion of shade seemed to detach itself and move into isolation upon the pale white of [the road]477-the road . It glided noiselessly towards [the recumbent woman]2316-the recumbent woman . [She]2279-the pedestrian became conscious of something touching [her]2279-the pedestrian hand ; it was softness and it was warmth . [She]2279-the pedestrian opened [her]2279-the pedestrian eye 's , and the substance touched [her]2279-the pedestrian face . A dog was licking [her]2279-the pedestrian cheek . [He]2317-he was huge , heavy , and quiet creature , standing darkly against the low horizon , and at least two feet higher than the present position of [her]2279-the pedestrian eyes . Whether [Newfoundland]349-newfoundland , mastiff , bloodhound , or what not , it was impossible to say . [He]2317-he seemed to be of too strange and mysterious a nature to belong to any variety among [those of popular nomenclature]2318-those of popular nomenclature . Being thus assignable to [no breed]2319-no breed , [he]2317-he was [the ideal embodiment of canine greatness]2320-the ideal embodiment of canine greatness - a generalization from what was common to all . Night , in its sad , solemn , and benevolent aspect , apart from its stealthy and cruel side , was personified in this form Darkness endows the small and ordinary ones among [mankind]2321-mankind with poetical power , and even [the suffering woman]2322-the suffering woman threw [her]2322-the suffering woman idea into figure . In [her]2279-the pedestrian reclining position [she]2279-the pedestrian looked up to [him]2317-he just as in earlier times [she]2279-the pedestrian had , when standing , looked up to [a man]3474-a man . The animal , who was as homeless as [she]2279-the pedestrian , respectfully withdrew a step or two when [the woman]3527-the woman moved , and , seeing that [she]2279-the pedestrian did not repulse [him]2317-he , [he]2317-he licked [her]2279-the pedestrian hand again . A thought moved within [her]2279-the pedestrian like lightning . " Perhaps [I]2360-the overcome traveller can make use of [him]2317-he - [I]2360-the overcome traveller might do it then ! "[2360-the overcome traveller] [She]2279-the pedestrian pointed in the direction of [Casterbridge]22-casterbridge , and the dog seemed to misunderstand : [he]2317-he trotted on . Then , finding [she]2279-the pedestrian could not follow , [he]2317-he came back and whined . The ultimate and saddest singularity of [woman]473-woman 's effort and invention was reached when , with a quickened breath- ing , [she]2279-the pedestrian rose to a stooping posture , and , resting [her]2279-the pedestrian two little arms upon the shoulders of the dog , leant firmly thereon , and murmured stimulating words . Whilst [she]2279-the pedestrian sorrowed in [her]2279-the pedestrian heart [she]2279-the pedestrian cheered with [her]2279-the pedestrian voice , and what was stranger than that [the strong]2326-the strong should need encouragement from [the weak]2327-the weak was that cheerfulness should be so well stimulated by such utter dejection . [[Her]2279-the pedestrian friend]2328-her friend moved forward slowly , and [she]2279-the pedestrian with small mincing steps moved forward beside [him]2328-her friend , half [her]2279-the pedestrian weight being thrown upon the animal . Sometimes [she]2279-the pedestrian sank as [she]2279-the pedestrian had sunk from walking erect , from the crutches , from the rails . [The dog , who now thoroughly understood [her]2279-the pedestrian desire and [her]2279-the pedestrian incapacity]2329-the dog , who now thoroughly understood her desire and her incapacity , was frantic in [his]2317-he distress on these occasions ; [he]2317-he would tug at [her]2279-the pedestrian dress and run forward . [She]2279-the pedestrian always called [him]2317-he back , and it was now to be observed that [the woman]3527-the woman listened for human sounds only to avoid them . It was evident that [she]2279-the pedestrian had an object in keeping [her]2279-the pedestrian presence on [the road]477-the road and [her]2279-the pedestrian forlorn state unknown . [Their]2332-they progress was necessarily very slow . [They]2332-they reached [the bottom of [the town]3722-the town]2333-the bottom of the town , and the Casterbridge lamps lay before [them]2332-they like fallen Pleiads as [they]2332-they turned to the left into the dense shade of [a deserted avenue of chestnuts]2335-a deserted avenue of chestnuts , and so skirted [the borough]2336-the borough . Thus [the town]3722-the town was passed , and the goal was reached . On [this much - desired spot outside [the town]3722-the town]2338-this much - desired spot outside the town rose [a picturesque building]2340-a picturesque building . Originally it had been a mere case to hold [people]3461-people . The shell had been so thin , so devoid of excrescence , and so closely drawn over [the accommodation granted]2342-the accommodation granted , that the grim character of what was beneath showed through it , as the shape of a body is visible under a winding - sheet . Then [Nature]161-nature , as if offended , lent a hand . Masses of ivy grew up , completely covering the walls , till [the place]3486-the place looked like [an abbey]2344-an abbey ; and it was discovered that the view from the front , over the Casterbridge chimneys , was one of the most magnificent in [the county]5256-the county . [A neighbouring earl]2346-a neighbouring earl once said that [he]2346-a neighbouring earl would give up a year 's rental to have at [his]2346-a neighbouring earl own door the view enjoyed by [the inmates from [theirs]2347-the inmates from theirs]2347-the inmates from theirs - and very probably [the inmates]5102-the inmates would have given up the view for [his]2346-a neighbouring earl year 's rental . [This stone edifice]2349-this stone edifice consisted of a central mass and two wings , whereon stood as sentinels a few slim chimneys , now gurgling sorrowfully to the slow wind . In the wall was a gate , and by the gate a bellpull formed of a hanging wire . [The woman]3527-the woman raised [herself]3527-the woman as high as possible upon [her]3527-the woman knees , and could just reach the handle . [She]3527-the woman moved it and fell forwards in a bowed attitude , [her]3527-the woman face upon [her]3527-the woman bosom . It was getting on towards six o'clock , and sounds of movement were to be heard inside [the building which was the haven of rest to [this wearied soul]2352-this wearied soul]2351-the building which was the haven of rest to this wearied soul . A little door by [the large one]2353-the large one was opened , and [a man]3474-a man appeared inside . [He]3474-a man discerned the panting heap of clothes , went back for a light , and came again . [He]3474-a man entered a second time , and returned with [two women]3487-two women . These lifted [the prostrate figure]2356-the prostrate figure and assisted [her]2356-the prostrate figure in through the doorway . [The man]726-the man then closed the door . " said [the other]3495-the other . There is a dog outside , "[2360-the overcome traveller] murmured [the overcome traveller]2360-the overcome traveller . " said [the man]726-the man . CHAPTER XLI SUSPICION - [FANNY]217-fanny IS SENT FOR [BATHSHEBA]243-bathsheba said very little to [[her]217-fanny husband]2239-her husband all that evening of [their]5319-the little procession return from [market]5325-market , and [he]2239-her husband was not disposed to say much to [her]217-fanny . [He]2239-her husband exhibited the un- pleasant combination of a restless condition with a silent tongue . The next day , which was Sunday , passed nearly in the same manner as regarded [their]5319-the little procession taciturnity , [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba going to [church]424-church both morning and afternoon . This was the day before the Budmouth races . In the evening [Troy]243-bathsheba said , suddenly - "[2361-her] [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba , could [you]243-bathsheba let [me]0-i have twenty pounds ? " [Her]2361-her countenance instantly sank . "[243-bathsheba] Twenty pounds ? [she]2361-her said . " The fact is , [I]243-bathsheba want it badly . "[243-bathsheba] The anxiety upon [Troy]243-bathsheba 's face was unusual and very marked . lt was a culmination of the mood [he]243-bathsheba had been in all the day . " Ah ! for those races to - morrow . "[243-bathsheba] [Troy]243-bathsheba for the moment made no reply . " Well , suppose [I]243-bathsheba do want it for races ? "[243-bathsheba] [he]243-bathsheba said , at last . " O , [Frank]244-frank ! "[243-bathsheba] [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba replied , and there was such a volume of entreaty in the words . " Only such a few weeks ago [you]244-frank said that [I]3527-the woman was far sweeter than all [your]244-frank other pleasures put together , and that [you]244-frank would give them all up for [me]3527-the woman ; and now , wo n't [you]244-frank give up this one , which is more a worry than a pleasure ? Do , [Frank]244-frank .
