A composite feeling , made up of disgust with the , to [him]243-bathsheba , humdrum tediousness of [a farmer]3716-a farmer 's life , gloomily images of [her]0-i who lay in [the churchyard]3813-the churchyard , remorse , and a general averseness to [[his]243-bathsheba wife]4301-his wife 's society , impelled [him]243-bathsheba to seek a home in [any place on [earth]499-earth save [Weatherbury]196-joseph]2766-any place on earth save weatherbury . The sad accessories of [Fanny]217-fanny 's end confronted [him]243-bathsheba as vivid pictures which threatened to be indelible , and made life in [[Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's house]5124-bathsheba 's house intolerable . At three in the afternoon [he]243-bathsheba found [himself]243-bathsheba at the foot of a slope more than a mile in length , which ran to [the ridge of [a range of hills lying parallel with the shore]2770-a range of hills lying parallel with the shore]2769-the ridge of a range of hills lying parallel with the shore , and forming a monotonous barrier between [the basin of [cultivated country inland]2772-cultivated country inland and the wilder scenery of [the coast]2773-the coast]2771-the basin of cultivated country inland and the wilder scenery of the coast . Up [the hill]3452-the hill stretched [a road]2775-a road nearly straight and perfectly white , the two sides approaching each other in a gradual taper till [they]2776-they met the sky at the top about two miles off . Through- out the length of [this narrow and irksome inclined plane]2777-this narrow and irksome inclined plane not a sign of life was visible on this garish afternoon [Troy]243-bathsheba toiled up [the road]477-the road with a languor and depression greater than any [he]243-bathsheba had experienced for many a day and year before . The air was warm and muggy , and the top seemed to recede as [he]243-bathsheba approached . At last [he]243-bathsheba reached [the summit]2779-the summit , and a wide and novel prospect burst upon [him]243-bathsheba with an effect almost like that of the Pacific upon [Balboa]375-balboa 's gaze . [The broad steely sea]2780-the broad steely sea , marked only by faint lines , which had a semblance of being etched thereon to a degree not deep enough to disturb its general evenness , stretched the whole width of [his]243-bathsheba front and round to the right , where , near [[the town]3722-the town and port of [Budmouth]99-budmouth]2782-the town and port of budmouth , the sun bristled down upon [it]2780-the broad steely sea , and banished all colour , to substitute in [its]2780-the broad steely sea place a clear oily polish . Nothing moved in sky , [land]2783-land , or [sea]5283-sea , except a frill of milkwhite foam along the nearer angles of [the shore]2761-the shore , shreds of which licked the contiguous stones like tongues . [He]243-bathsheba descended and came to [a small basin of sea enclosed by the cliffs]2786-a small basin of sea enclosed by the cliffs . [Troy]243-bathsheba 's nature freshened within [him]243-bathsheba ; [he]243-bathsheba thought [he]243-bathsheba would rest and bathe [here]575-here before going farther . [He]243-bathsheba undressed and plunged in . Inside [the cove]2788-the cove the water was uninteresting to [a swimmer]2789-a swimmer , being smooth as [a pond]2790-a pond , and to get a little of the ocean swell , [Troy]243-bathsheba presently swam between [the two projecting spurs of rock]2791-the two projecting spurs of rock which formed the pillars of [Hercules]116-hercules to [this miniature Mediterranean]2792-this miniature mediterranean . Unfortunately for [Troy]243-bathsheba a current unknown to [him]243-bathsheba existed outside , which , un- important to craft of any burden , was awkward for [a swimmer who might be taken in [it]2794-it unawares]2793-a swimmer who might be taken in it unawares . [Troy]243-bathsheba found [himself]243-bathsheba carried to the left and then round in a swoop out to [sea]5283-sea . [He]243-bathsheba now recollected [the place]3486-the place and [its]3486-the place sinister character . [Many bathers]2797-many bathers had there prayed for a dry death from time to time , and , like [Gonzalo]376-gonzalo also , had been unanswered ; and [Troy]243-bathsheba began to deem it possible that [he]243-bathsheba might be added to [their]2797-many bathers number . Not [a boat]2798-a boat of any kind was at present within sight , but far in the distance [Budmouth]99-budmouth lay upon [the sea]2462-the sea , as it were quietly regarding [his]243-bathsheba efforts , and beside [the town]3722-the town [the harbour]2801-the harbour showed [its]2801-the harbour position by a dim meshwork of ropes and spars . After wellnigh exhausting [himself]243-bathsheba in attempts to get back to [the mouth of [the cove]2788-the cove]2802-the mouth of the cove , in [his]243-bathsheba weakness swimming several inches deeper than was [his]243-bathsheba wo nt , keeping up [his]243-bathsheba breathing entirely by [his]243-bathsheba nostrils , turning upon [his]243-bathsheba back a dozen times over , swimming EN PAPILLON and so on , [Troy]243-bathsheba resolved as a last resource to tread water at a slight incline , and so endeavour to reach [the shore]2761-the shore at any point , merely giving [himself]243-bathsheba a gentle impetus inwards whilst carried on in the general direc- tion of the tide . This , necessarily a slow process , [he]243-bathsheba found to be not altogether so difficult , and though there was no choice of a landing - place - the objects on [shore]2805-shore passing by [him]243-bathsheba in a sad and slow procession - [he]243-bathsheba per- ceptibly approached the extremity of [a spit of land yet further to the right]2806-a spit of land yet further to the right , now well defined against [the sunny portion of the horizon]2807-the sunny portion of the horizon . While [the swimmer]2808-the swimmer 's eye 's were fixed upon [the spit]2809-the spit as [his]243-bathsheba only means of salvation on [this side of [the Unknown]117-the unknown]2810-this side of the unknown , a moving object broke the outline of the extremity , and immediately [[a ship]553-a ship 's boat]2812-a ship 's boat appeared manned with [several sailor lads]2813-several sailor lads , [her]2812-a ship 's boat bows towards [the sea]2462-the sea . All [Troy]243-bathsheba 's vigour spasmodically revived to prolong the struggle yet a little further . Swimming with [his]243-bathsheba right arm , [he]243-bathsheba held up [his]243-bathsheba left to hail [them]2813-several sailor lads , splashing upon the waves , and shouting with all [his]243-bathsheba might . From the position of the setting sun [his]243-bathsheba white form was distinctly visible upon [the now deep - hued bosom of [the sea]2462-the sea to the east of [the boat]2817-the boat]2815-the now deep - hued bosom of the sea to the east of the boat , and [the men]3799-the men saw [him]243-bathsheba at once . Backing [their]3799-the men oars and putting [the boat]2817-the boat about , [they]3799-the men pulled towards [him]243-bathsheba with a will , and in five or six minutes from the time of [his]243-bathsheba first halloo , [two of [the sailors]3675-the sailors]2820-two of the sailors hauled [him]243-bathsheba in over the stern . [They]2820-two of the sailors formed part of [a brig 's crew]2822-a brig 's crew , and had come ashore for sand . Lending [him]243-bathsheba what little clothing [they]3799-the men could spare among [them]3799-the men as a slight protection against late [they]3799-the men made again towards [the roadstead]2823-the roadstead where [their]3799-the men And now night drooped slowly upon the wide watery levels in front ; and at no great distance from [them]3799-the men , where [the shoreline]2824-the shoreline curved round , and formed a long riband of shade upon the horizon , a series of points of yellow light began to start into existence , denoting the spot to be the site of [Budmouth]99-budmouth , where the lamps were being lighted along [the parade]2825-the parade . The cluck of [their]3799-the men oars was the only sound of any distinctness upon [the sea]2462-the sea , and as [they]3799-the men laboured amid the thickening shades the lamplights grew larger , each appearing to send a flaming sword deep down into the waves before it , until there arose , among other dim shapes of the kind , the form of [the vessel for which [they]3799-the men were bound]2827-the vessel for which they were bound . CHAPTER XLVIII DOUBTS ARISE - [DOUBTS LINGER BATHSHEBA]377-doubts linger bathsheba underwent the enlargement of [[her]2828-her Husband]2239-her husband 's absence from hours to days with a slight feeling of surprise , and a slight feeling of relief ; yet neither sensation rose at any time far above the level commonly designated as indifference . [She]2828-her belonged to [him]2239-her husband : the certainties of that position were so well defined , and the reasonable probabilities of its issue so bounded that [she]2828-her could not speculate on contingencies . Taking no further interest in [herself]2828-her as [a splendid woman]2830-a splendid woman , [she]2828-her acquired the indifferent feelings of [an outsider]4631-an outsider in contem- plating [her]2828-her probable fate as [a singular wretch]2832-a singular wretch ; for [Bath-]351-bath- [sheba]351-bath- drew [herself]2828-her and [her]2828-her future in colours that no reality could exceed for darkness . [Her]2828-her original vigorous pride of youth had sickened , and with it had declined all [her]2828-her anxieties about coming years , since anxiety recognizes a better and a worse alternative , and [Bath- sheba]351-bath- had made up [her]2828-her mind that alternatives on any noteworthy scale had ceased for [her]2828-her . Soon , or later - and that not very late - [[her]2828-her husband]2239-her husband would be [home]556-home again . And then the days of [their]2835-their tenancy of [the Upper Farm]4533-the upper farm would be numbered . There had origin- ally been shown by [the agent to [the estate]2838-the estate]2837-the agent to the estate some distrust of [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's tenure as [[James Everdene]257-farmer james everdene 's successor]2839-james everdene 's successor , on the score of [her]2828-her sex , and [her]2828-her youth , and [her]2828-her beauty ; but the peculiar nature of [[her]2828-her uncle]738-her uncle 's will , [his]738-her uncle own frequent testimony before [his]738-her uncle death to [her]2828-her cleverness in such a pursuit , and [her]2828-her vigorous marshalling of the numerous flocks and herds which came suddenly into [her]2828-her hands before negotiations were concluded , had won confidence in [her]2828-her powers , and no further objections had been raised . [She]2828-her had latterly been in great doubt as to what the legal effects of [her]2828-her marriage would be upon [her]2828-her position ; but no notice had been taken as yet of [her]2828-her change of name , and only one point was clear - that in the event of [her]2828-her own or [[her]2828-her husband]2239-her husband 's inability to meet [the agent]2842-the agent at the forthcoming January rent - day , very little consideration would be shown , and , for that matter , very little would be deserved . Once out of [the farm]3760-the farm , the approach of poverty would be sure . Hence [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba lived in a perception that [her]2828-her purposes were broken of . [She]2828-her was not [a woman who could hope on without good materials for the process]2844-a woman who could hope on without good materials for the process , differing thus from [the less far - Sighted and energetic , though more petted ones of the sex , with whom hope goes on as a sort of clockwork which the merest food and shelter are sufficient to wind up]2845-the less far - sighted and energetic , though more petted ones of the sex , with whom hope goes on as a sort of clockwork which the merest food and shelter are sufficient to wind up ; and perceiving clearly that [her]2828-her mistake had been a fatal one , [she]2828-her accepted [her]2828-her position , and waited coldly for the end . The first Saturday after [Troy]243-bathsheba 's departure [she]2828-her went to [Casterbridge]22-casterbridge alone , a journey [she]2828-her had not before taken since [her]2828-her marriage . On this Saturday [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba was passing slowly on foot through [the crowd of rural business - men gathered as usual in front of [the market- house]2847-the market- house , who were as usual gazed upon by [the burghers]2848-the burghers]2846-the crowd of rural business - men gathered as usual in front of the market- house , who were as usual gazed upon by the burghers with feelings that those healthy lives were dearly paid for by exclusion from possible aldermanship , when [a man , who had apparently been following [her]2828-her]2849-a man , who had apparently been following her , said some words to another on [her]2828-her left hand . [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's ears were keen as those of any wild animal , and [she]2828-her dis- tinctly heard what [the speaker]692-the speaker said , though [her]2828-her back was towards [him]692-the speaker " [I]2851-the the person am looking for [Mrs. Troy]353-troy . Is that [she]353-troy there ? "[2851-the the person] " Yes ; that 's [the young lady]5675-the young lady , [I]243-bathsheba believe . "[243-bathsheba] said [the the person]2851-the the person addressed . " [I]231-boldwood have some awkward news to break to [her]5675-the young lady . [[Her]5675-the young lady husband]2239-her husband is drowned . "[231-boldwood] As if endowed with the spirit of prophecy , [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba gasped out , " No , it is not true ; it can not be true ! "[231-boldwood] Then [she]2828-her said and heard no more . The ice of self- command which had latterly gathered over [her]2828-her was broken , and the currents burst forth again , and over whelmed [her]2828-her . A darkness came into [her]2828-her eyes , and [she]2828-her fell . But not to the ground . [A gloomy man]2852-a gloomy man , who had been observing [her]2828-her from under the portico of [the old corn - exchange]2853-the old corn - exchange when [she]2828-her passed through [the group without]2854-the group without , stepped quickly to [her]2828-her side at the moment of [her]2828-her exclamation , and caught [her]2828-her in [his]2852-a gloomy man arms as [she]2828-her sank down . " What is it ? "[2828-her] said [Boldwood]231-boldwood , looking up at [the bringer of the big news]2855-the bringer of the big news , as [he]231-boldwood supported [her]2828-her . " [[Her]2828-her husband]2239-her husband was drowned this week while bathing in [Lulwind Cove]118-lulwind cove . [A coastguardsman]5678-a coastguardsman found [his]2239-her husband clothes , and brought them into [Budmouth]99-budmouth yesterday . "[2828-her] Thereupon a strange fire lighted up [Boldwood]231-boldwood 's eye , and [his]231-boldwood face flushed with the suppressed excitement of an unutterable thought . [Everybody]378-everybody 's glance was now centred upon [him]231-boldwood and [the unconscious Bathsheba]243-bathsheba . [He]231-boldwood lifted [her]2828-her bodily off the ground , and smoothed down the folds of [her]2828-her dress as [a child]786-a child might have taken a storm - beaten bird and arranged its ruffled plumes , and bore [her]2828-her along [the pavement]2857-the pavement to [the King 's Arms Inn]119-the king 's arms inn . Here [he]231-boldwood passed with [her]2828-her under the archway into [a private room]2858-a private room ; and by the time [he]231-boldwood had deposited - so lothly - the precious burden upon a sofa , [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba had opened [her]2828-her eyes . Remembering all that had occurred , [she]2828-her murmured , " [I]191-liddy want to go [home]556-home ! "[191-liddy] [Boldwood]231-boldwood left [the room]4025-the room . [He]231-boldwood stood for a moment in [the passage]4537-the passage to recover [his]231-boldwood senses . The experience had been too much for [his]231-boldwood consciousness to keep up with , and now that [he]231-boldwood had grasped it it had gone again . For those few heavenly , golden moments [she]2828-her had been in [his]231-boldwood arms . What did it matter about [her]2828-her not knowing it ? [She]2828-her had been close to [his]231-boldwood breast ; [he]231-boldwood had been close to [hers]2828-her . [He]231-boldwood started onward again , and sending [a woman]459-a woman to [her]2828-her , went out to ascertain all the facts of the case . These appeared to be limited to what [he]231-boldwood had already heard . [He]231-boldwood then ordered [her]2828-her horse to be put into the gig , and when all was ready returned to inform [her]2828-her . [He]231-boldwood found that , though still pale and unwell , [she]2828-her had in the meantime sent for the Budmouth man who brought the tidings , and learnt from [him]231-boldwood all there was to know . Being hardly in a condition to drive [home]556-home as [she]2828-her had driven to [town]4160-town , [Boldwood]231-boldwood , with every delicacy of manner and feeling , offered to get [her]2828-her [a driver]2864-a driver , or to give [her]2828-her a seat in [his]231-boldwood phaeton , which was more com- fortable than [her]2828-her own conveyance . These proposals [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba gently declined , and [the farmer]3540-the farmer at once de- parted . About half - an - hour later [she]2828-her invigorated [herself]2828-her by an effort , and took [her]2828-her seat and the reins as usual - in external appearance much as if nothing had happened . [She]2828-her went out of [the town]3722-the town by [a tortuous back street]2867-a tortuous back street , and drove slowly along , unconscious of [the road]477-the road and the scene . The first shades of evening were showing [them-]2869-them- selves when [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba reached [home]556-home , where , silently alighting and leaving the horse in the hands of [the boy]444-the boy , [she]2828-her proceeded at once [upstairs]2603-upstairs . [Liddy]191-liddy met [her]2828-her on [the landing]2873-the landing . The news had preceded [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba to [Weather-]316-weather- bury by half - an - hour , and [Liddy]191-liddy looked inquiringly into [[her]191-liddy mistress]4024-her mistress 's face . [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba had nothing to say . [She]2828-her entered [[her]2828-her bedroom]2875-her bedroom and sat by the window , and thought and thought till night enveloped [her]2828-her , and the extreme lines only of [her]2828-her shape were visible . [Somebody]3576-somebody came to the door , knocked , and opened it . " Well , what is it , [Liddy]191-liddy ? "[191-liddy] [she]2828-her said . " [I]3576-somebody was thinking there must be something got for [you]243-bathsheba to wear . "[3576-somebody] said [Liddy]191-liddy , with hesitation . " What do [you]243-bathsheba mean ? "[243-bathsheba] " Mourning . "[243-bathsheba] " No , no , no . "[3576-somebody] said [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba , hurriedly . " But [I]3576-somebody suppose there must be something done for poor - - "[3576-somebody] " Not at present , [I]243-bathsheba think . It is not necessary . "[243-bathsheba] " Why not , [ma'am]712-ma'am ? "[191-liddy] " Because [he]4024-her mistress 's still alive . "[191-liddy] " How do [you]243-bathsheba know that ? "[2889-her] said [Liddy]191-liddy , amazed . " [I]2889-her do n't know it . But would n't it have been different , or should n't [I]2889-her have heard more , or would n't [they]5681-they have found [him]4024-her mistress , [Liddy]191-liddy ? - or - [i]2889-her do n't know how it is , but death would have been different from how this is . [I]2889-her am perfectly convinced that [he]4024-her mistress is still alive ! "[2889-her] [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba remained firm in this opinion till Monday , when two circumstances conjoined to shake it . The first was a short paragraph in the local newspaper , which , beyond making by a methodizing pen formidable pre- sumptive evidence of [Troy]243-bathsheba 's death by drowning , con- tained the important testimony of [a young Mr. Barker]379-a young mr. barker , [M.D.]2877-m.d. , of [Budmouth]99-budmouth , who spoke to being [an eyewitness of the accident]2878-an eyewitness of the accident , in a letter to [the editor]2879-the editor . In this [he]379-a young mr. barker stated that [he]379-a young mr. barker was passing over the cliff on [the remoter side of [the cove]2788-the cove]2880-the remoter side of the cove just as the sun was setting . At that time [he]379-a young mr. barker saw [a bather]2882-a bather carried along in the current outside [the mouth of [the cove]2788-the cove]2802-the mouth of the cove , and guessed in an instant that there was but a poor chance for [him]379-a young mr. barker unless [he]379-a young mr. barker should be possessed of unusual muscular powers . [He]379-a young mr. barker drifted behind [a projection of [the coast]2773-the coast]2885-a projection of the coast , and [Mr. Barker]379-a young mr. barker followed along [the shore]2761-the shore in the same direction . But by the time that [he]379-a young mr. barker could reach an elevation sufficiently great to command a view of [the sea beyond]2888-the sea beyond , dusk had set in , and nothing further was to be seen . The other circumstance was the arrival of [his]379-a young mr. barker clothes , when it became necessary for [her]2889-her to examine and identify them - though this had virtually been done long before by those who inspected the letters in [his]379-a young mr. barker pockets . It was so evident to [her]2889-her in the midst of [her]2889-her agitation that [Troy]243-bathsheba had undressed in the full conviction of dressing again almost immediately , that the notion that anything but death could have prevented [him]379-a young mr. barker was a perverse one to entertain . Then [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba said to [herself]243-bathsheba that [others]618-others were assured in [their]618-others opinion ; strange that [she]2889-her should not be . A strange reflection occurred to [her]2889-her , causing [her]2889-her face to flush . Suppose that [Troy]243-bathsheba had followed [Fanny]217-fanny into [another world]2891-another world . Had [he]243-bathsheba done this intentionally , yet contrived to make [his]243-bathsheba death appear like an accident ? Nevertheless , this thought of how the apparent might differ from the real - made vivid by [her]2889-her bygone jealousy of [Fanny]217-fanny , and the remorse [he]243-bathsheba had shown that night - did not blind [her]2889-her to the perception of a likelier difference , less tragic , but to [herself]2889-her far more disastrous . When alone late that evening beside a small fire , and much calmed down , [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba took [Troy]243-bathsheba 's watch into [her]2889-her hand , which had been restored to [her]2889-her with the rest of the articles belonging to [him]243-bathsheba . [She]2889-her opened the case as [he]243-bathsheba had opened it before [her]2889-her a week ago . There was the little coil of pale hair which had been as the fuze to this great explosion . " [He]243-bathsheba was [hers]2889-her and [she]217-fanny was [his]243-bathsheba ; [they]5682-they should be gone together . "[2889-her] [she]2889-her said . " [I]211-susan tall am nothing to either of [them]5682-they , and why should [I]211-susan tall keep [her]217-fanny hair ? "[211-susan tall] [She]2889-her took it in [her]2889-her hand , and held it over the fire . " No - i'll not burn it -i'll keep it in memory of [her]217-fanny , poor thing ! "[211-susan tall] [she]2889-her added , snatching back [her]2889-her hand . CHAPTER XLIX OAK 'S ADVANCEMENT - A GREAT HOPE THE later autumn and the winter drew on apace , and the leaves lay thick upon the turf of the glades and the mosses of [the woods]1829-the woods . [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba , having previously been living in a state of suspended feeling which was not suspense , now lived in a mood of quietude which was not precisely peacefulness . While [she]2889-her had known [him]243-bathsheba to be alive [she]2889-her could have thought of [his]243-bathsheba death with equanimity ; but now that it might be [she]2889-her had lost [him]243-bathsheba , [she]2889-her regretted that [he]243-bathsheba was not [hers]2889-her still . [She]2889-her kept [the farm]3760-the farm going , raked in [her]2889-her profits without caring keenly about them , and expended money on ventures because [she]2889-her had done so in bygone days , which , though not long gone by , seemed infinitely removed from [her]2889-her present . [She]2889-her looked back upon that past over a great gulf , as if [she]2889-her were now [a dead person]2894-a dead person , having the faculty of meditation still left in [her]2889-her , by means of which , like the mouldering gentlefolk of [the poet]2895-the poet 's story , [she]2889-her could sit and ponder what a gift life used to be . However , one excellent result of [her]2889-her general apathy was the long - delayed installation of [Oak]144-gabriel as [bailiff]3729-bailiff ; but [he]144-gabriel having virtually exercised that function for a long time already , the change , beyond the substantial in- crease of wages it brought , was little more than a nominal one addressed to [the outside world]2897-the outside world . [Boldwood]231-boldwood lived secluded and inactive . Much of [his]231-boldwood wheat and all [his]231-boldwood barley of that season had been spoilt by the rain . It sprouted , grew into intricate mats , and was ultimately thrown to the pigs in armfuls . The strange neglect which had produced this ruin and waste became the subject of whispered talk among all [the people round]2898-the people round ; and it was elicited from [one of [[Boldwood]231-boldwood 's men]2900-boldwood 's men]2899-one of boldwood 's men that forgetfulness had nothing to do with it , for [he]2899-one of boldwood 's men had been reminded of the danger to [his]2899-one of boldwood 's men corn as many times and as persistently as [inferiors]2901-inferiors dared to do . The sight of the pigs turning in disgust from the rotten ears seemed to arouse [Boldwood]231-boldwood , and [he]231-boldwood one evening sent for [Oak]144-gabriel . Whether it was [sug- gested]380-sug- gested by [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's recent act of promotion or not , [the farmer]3540-the farmer proposed at the interview that [Gabriel]144-gabriel should undertake the superintendence of [the Lower Farm]2903-the lower farm as well as of [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's , because of the necessity [Boldwood]231-boldwood felt for such aid , and the impossibility of discovering [a more trustworthy man]2904-a more trustworthy man . [Gabriel]144-gabriel 's malig- nant star was assuredly setting fast . [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba , when [she]2905-she learnt of this proposal - for [Oak]144-gabriel was obliged to consult [her]2905-she - at first languidly objected . [She]2905-she considered that [the two farms]2906-the two farms together were too extensive for the observation of [one man]2907-one man . [Boldwood]231-boldwood , who was apparently determined by personal rather than commercial reasons , suggested that [Oak]144-gabriel should be furnished with a horse for [his]144-gabriel sole use , when the plan would present no difficulty , [the two farms]2906-the two farms lying side by side . [Boldwood]231-boldwood did not directly communicate with [her]2905-she during these negotiations , only speaking to [Oak]144-gabriel , who was [the go - between]2909-the go - between throughout . All was harmoniously arranged at last , and [we]2910-we now see [Oak]144-gabriel mounted on a strong cob , and daily trotting the length breadth of about [two thousand acres]2911-two thousand acres in a cheerful spirit of surveillance , as if the crops belonged to [him]144-gabriel - [the actual mistress of [the one - half]2913-the one - half]2912-the actual mistress of the one - half and [the master of the other]2914-the master of the other , sitting in [[their]2906-the two farms respective homes]2915-their respective homes in gloomy and sad seclusion . Out of this there arose , during the spring succeeding , a talk in [the parish]422-the parish that [Gabriel Oak]144-gabriel was feathering [his]144-gabriel nest fast . " Whatever d'ye think . "[2918-a " near " man] said [Susan Tall]211-susan tall , " [Gable Oak]186-gable is coming it quite the dand . [He]144-gabriel now wears shining boots with hardly a hob in 'em , two or three times a - week , and a tall hat a - Sundays , and ' a hardly knows the name of smockfrock . When [I]231-boldwood see [people]3461-people strut enough to [he]144-gabriel cut up into bantam cocks , [I]231-boldwood stand dormant with wonder , and says no more ! "[231-boldwood] It was eventually known that [Gabriel]144-gabriel , though paid a fixed wage by [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba independent of the fluctua- tions of agricultural profits , had made an engagement with [Boldwood]231-boldwood by which [Oak]144-gabriel was to receive a share of the receipts - a small share certainly , yet it was money of a higher quality than mere wages , and capable of expansion in a way that wages were not . [Some]1053-some were beginning to consider [Oak]144-gabriel [a " near "[231-boldwood] man]2918-a " near " man , for though [his]144-gabriel condition had thus far improved , [he]144-gabriel lived in no better style than before , occupying [the same cottage]2919-the same cottage , paring [his]144-gabriel own potatoes , mending [his]144-gabriel stockings , and sometimes even making [his]144-gabriel bed with [his]144-gabriel own hands . But as [Oak]144-gabriel was not only provokingly indifferent to public opinion , but [a man who clung persistently to old habits and usages]2920-a man who clung persistently to old habits and usages , simply because they were old , there was room for doubt as to [his]144-gabriel motives . A great hope had latterly germinated in [Boldwood]231-boldwood , whose unreasoning devotion to [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba could only be characterized as a fond madness which neither time nor circumstance , evil nor good report , could weaken or destroy . This fevered hope had grown up again like a grain of mustard - seed during the quiet which followed the hasty conjecture that [Troy]243-bathsheba was drowned . [He]144-gabriel nourished it fearfully , and almost shunned the contemplation of it in earnest , lest facts should reveal the wildness of the dream . [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba having at last been persuaded to wear mourning , [her]2921-her appearance as [she]2921-her entered [the church]489-the church in that guise was in itself a weekly addition to [his]144-gabriel faith that a time was coming - very far off perhaps , yet surely nearing - when [his]144-gabriel waiting on events should have its reward . How long [he]144-gabriel might have to wait [he]144-gabriel had not yet closely considered . what [he]144-gabriel would try to recognize was that the severe schooling [she]2921-her had been subjected to had made [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba much more con- siderate than [she]2921-her had formerly been of the feelings of [others]618-others , and [he]144-gabriel trusted that , should [she]2921-her be willing at any time in the future to marry [any man at all]2924-any man at all , [that man]892-that man would be [himself]892-that man . There was a substratum of good feeling in [her]2921-her : [her]2921-her self - reproach for the injury [she]2921-her had thoughtlessly done [him]144-gabriel might be depended upon now to a much greater extent than before [her]2921-her infatuation and disappointment . It would be possible to approach [her]2921-her by the channel of [her]2921-her good nature , and to suggest a friendly businesslike compact between [them]2926-them for fulfilment at some future day , keeping the passionate side of [his]144-gabriel desire entirely out of [her]2921-her sight . Such was [Boldwood]231-boldwood 's hope . To the eyes of [the middle - aged]2927-the middle - aged , [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba was perhaps additionally charming just now . [Her]2921-her exuber- ance of spirit was pruned down ; the original phantom of delight had shown [herself]2921-her to be not too bright for human nature 's daily food , and [she]2921-her had been able to enter this second poetical phase without losing much of the first in the process . [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's return from a two months ' visit to [[her]2921-her old aunt]2928-her old aunt at [Norcombe]18-norcombe afforded the impassioned and yearning farmer a pretext for inquiring directly after [her]2921-her - now possibly in the ninth month of [her]2921-her widowhood - and endeavouring to get a notion of [her]2921-her middle of the haymaking , and [Boldwood]231-boldwood contrived to " [I]2921-her am glad to see [you]2921-her out of doors , [Lydia]191-liddy . "[2921-her] [he]231-boldwood said [She]2921-her simpered , and wondered in [her]2921-her heart why [he]231-boldwood " [I]231-boldwood hope [Mrs. Troy]353-troy is quite well after [her]2921-her long [the coldest - hearted neighbour]5684-the coldest - hearted neighbour could scarcely say less "[231-boldwood] [She]2921-her is quite well , [sir]3717-sir . " Yes , cheerful . "[2921-her] Fearful , did [you]231-boldwood say ? " "[3717-sir] O no . [I]0-i merely said [she]2921-her was cheerful . " "[3717-sir] Tells [you]231-boldwood all [her]2921-her affairs ? " "[353-troy] No , [sir]3717-sir . " Some of them ? "[2921-her] " Yes , [sir]3717-sir . "[2921-her] [Mrs Troy]353-troy puts much confidence in [you]2921-her , [Lydia]191-liddy , and very wisely , perhaps . " "[2921-her] [She]2921-her do , [sir]3717-sir . [I]0-i 've been with [her]2921-her all through [her]2921-her troubles , and was with [her]2921-her at the time of [Mr. Troy]304-mr. troy 's going and all . And if [she]2921-her were to marry again [I]0-i expect [I]0-i should bide with [her]2921-her . " "[2921-her] [She]2921-her promises that [you]231-boldwood shall - quite natural . " said [the strategic lover]5686-the strategic lover , throbbing throughout [him]5686-the strategic lover at the presumption which [Liddy]191-liddy 's words appeared to warrant - that [[his]5686-the strategic lover darling]5687-his darling had thought of re - marriage . "[191-liddy] No - [she]2921-her does n't promise it exactly . [I]0-i merely judge on [my]0-i own account . " Yes , yes , [I]224-boldwood understand . When [she]2921-her alludes to the possibility of marrying again , [you]231-boldwood conclude - - "[224-boldwood] " [She]2921-her never do allude to it , [sir]3717-sir . "[224-boldwood] said [Liddy]191-liddy , thinking how very stupid [Mr. Boldwood]224-boldwood was getting . " Of course not . "[2921-her] [he]224-boldwood returned hastily , [his]224-boldwood hope falling again . " [You]231-boldwood need n't take quite such long reaches with [[your]231-boldwood rake]5689-your rake , [Lydia]191-liddy - short and quick ones are best . Well , perhaps , as [she]2921-her is [absolute mistress]5690-absolute mistress again now , it is wise of [her]2921-her to resolve never to give up [her]2921-her freedom . "[224-boldwood] " [[My]191-liddy mistress]2035-my mistress did certainly once say , though not seriously , that [she]2035-my mistress supposed [she]2035-my mistress might marry again at the end of seven years from last year , if [she]2035-my mistress cared to risk [Mr. Troy]304-mr. troy 's coming back and claiming [her]2035-my mistress . "[191-liddy] " Ah , six years from the present time . Said that [she]2035-my mistress might . [She]2035-my mistress might marry at once in [every reasonable person]5692-every reasonable person 's opinion , whatever [the lawyers]5693-the lawyers may say to the contrary . "[224-boldwood] " Have [you]224-boldwood been to ask [them]5693-the lawyers ? "[224-boldwood] said [Liddy]191-liddy , innocently . " Not [I.]224-boldwood "[224-boldwood] said [Boldwood]224-boldwood , growing red . " [Liddy]191-liddy , [you]191-liddy need n't stay [here]575-here a minute later than [you]191-liddy wish , so [Mr]5695-mr , [Oak]144-gabriel says . [I]383-black bess am now going on a little farther . Good "[383-black bess] afternoon . " [He]224-boldwood went away vexed with [himself]224-boldwood , and ashamed of having for this one time in [his]224-boldwood life done anything which could be called underhand . [Poor Boldwood]381-poor boldwood had no more skill in finesse than a battering - ram , and [he]224-boldwood was uneasy with a sense of having made [himself]224-boldwood to appear stupid and , what was worse , mean . But [he]224-boldwood had , after all , lighted upon one fact by way of repayment . It was a singularly fresh and fascinating fact , and though not without its sadness it was pertinent and real . In little more than six years from this time [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba might certainly marry [him]224-boldwood . There was something definite in that hope , for admitting that there might have been no deep thought in [her]5696-her words to [Liddy]191-liddy about marriage , they showed at least [her]5696-her creed on the matter . This pleasant notion was now continually in [his]224-boldwood mind . Six years were a long time , but how much shorter than never , the idea [he]224-boldwood had for so long been obliged to endure ! [Jacob]187-jacob had served twice seven years for [Rachel]382-rachel : what were six for [such a woman as this]5697-such a woman as this ? [He]187-jacob tried to like the notion of waiting for [her]382-rachel better than that of winning [her]382-rachel at once . [Boldwood]224-boldwood felt [his]224-boldwood love to be so deep and strong and eternal , that it was pos- sible [she]382-rachel had never yet known its full volume , and this patience in delay would afford [him]224-boldwood an opportunity of giving sweet proof on the point . [He]224-boldwood would annihilate the six years of [his]224-boldwood life as if they were minutes - so little did [he]224-boldwood value [his]224-boldwood time on [earth]499-earth beside [her]382-rachel love . [He]224-boldwood would let [her]382-rachel see , all those six years of intangible ether- eal courtship , how little care [he]224-boldwood had for anything but as it bore upon the consummation . Meanwhile the early and the late summer brought round the week in which [Greenhill Fair]26-greenhill fair was held . [This fair]5699-this fair was frequently attended by [the folk of Weather- bury]5700-the folk of weather- bury . CHAPTER L [THE SHEEP FAIR]121-the sheep fair - [TROY]243-bathsheba TOUCHES [[HIS]224-boldwood WIFE]4301-his wife 'S HAND [GREENHILL]122-greenhill was [the Nijni Novgorod of [South Wessex]98-south wessex]5702-the nijni novgorod of south wessex ; and the busiest , merriest , noisiest day of the whole statute number was the day of the sheep fair . This yearly gathering was upon the summit of a hill which retained in good preservation the remains of an ancient earthwork , consisting of a huge rampart and entrenchment of an oval form encircling [the top of [the hill]3452-the hill]5703-the top of the hill , though somewhat broken down here and there . To each of the two chief openings on opposite sides [a winding road]5705-a winding road ascended , and the level green space of ten or fifteen acres enclosed by the bank was the site of the fair . A few permanent erections dotted [the spot]3757-the spot , but [the majority of [visitors]5708-visitors]5707-the majority of visitors patronized canvas alone for resting and feeding under during the time of [their]5707-the majority of visitors sojourn here . [Shepherds who attended with [their]5709-shepherds who attended with their flocks flocks]5709-shepherds who attended with their flocks from long distances started from [home]556-home two or three days , or even a week , before the fair , driving [their]5709-shepherds who attended with their flocks charges a few miles each day - not more than ten or twelve - and resting [them]5709-shepherds who attended with their flocks at night in [hired fields]5711-hired fields by the wayside at pre- viously chosen points , where [they]5709-shepherds who attended with their flocks fed , having fasted since morning . [The shepherd of each flock]5712-the shepherd of each flock marched behind , a bundle containing [his]5712-the shepherd of each flock kit for the week strapped upon [his]5712-the shepherd of each flock shoulders , and in [his]5712-the shepherd of each flock hand [his]5712-the shepherd of each flock crook , which [he]5712-the shepherd of each flock used as the staff of [his]5712-the shepherd of each flock pilgrimage . Several of the sheep would get worn and lame , and occasionally a lambing occurred on [the road]477-the road . To meet [these contingencies]5714-these contingencies , there was frequently provided , to accompany the flocks from the remoter points , a pony and waggon into which [the weakly ones]4226-the weakly ones were taken for the remainder of the journey . [The Weatherbury Farms]5716-the weatherbury farms , however , were no such long distance from [the hill]3452-the hill , and those arrangements were not necessary in [their]5716-the weatherbury farms case . But the large united flocks of [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba and [Farmer Boldwood]231-boldwood formed a valuable and imposing multitude which demanded much attention , and on this account [Gabriel]144-gabriel , in addition to [[Boldwood]231-boldwood 's shepherd]5718-boldwood 's shepherd and [Cain Ball]235-cain , accompanied [them]5709-shepherds who attended with their flocks along the way , through [the decayed old town of Kings- bere]5719-the decayed old town of kings- bere , and upward to [the plateau]5720-the plateau , - old George the dog of course behind [them]5709-shepherds who attended with their flocks . When the autumn sun slanted over Greenhill this morning and lighted [the dewy flat upon]5721-the dewy flat upon [its]5721-the dewy flat upon crest , nebu- lous clouds of dust were to be seen floating between the pairs of hedges which streaked the wide prospect around in all directions . These gradually converged upon [the base of [the hill]3452-the hill]5722-the base of the hill , and the flocks became individually visible , climbing the serpentine ways which led to the top . Thus , in a slow procession , [they]5709-shepherds who attended with their flocks entered the opening to which [the roads]5724-the roads tended , multitude after multitude , horned and hornless - blue flocks and red flocks , buff flocks and brown flocks , even green and salmon - tinted flocks , according to the fancy of the colourist and custom of [the farm]3760-the farm . [Men]474-men were shouting , dogs were barking , with greatest animation , but [the thronging travellers]5727-the thronging travellers in so long a journey had grown nearly indifferent to such terrors , though [they]5727-the thronging travellers still bleated piteously at the unwontedness of [their]5727-the thronging travellers experi- ences , [a tall shepherd rising here and there in the midst of them , like a gigantic idol amid a crowd of prostrate devotees]5728-a tall shepherd rising here and there in the midst of them , like a gigantic idol amid a crowd of prostrate devotees . The great mass of sheep in the fair consisted of [South Downs]124-south downs and the old Wessex horned breeds , to the latter class [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's and [Farmer Boldwood]231-boldwood 's mainly belonged . These filed in about nine o'clock , [their]5727-the thronging travellers vermiculated horns lopping gracefully on each side of [their]5727-the thronging travellers cheeks in geometrically perfect spirals , a small pink and white ear nestling under each horn . Before and behind came other varieties , perfect leopards as to the full rich substance of [their]5727-the thronging travellers coats , and only lacking the spots . There were also [a few of the Oxfordshire breed , whose wool was beginning to curl like a child]5729-a few of the oxfordshire breed , whose wool was beginning to curl like a child 's flaxen hair , though surpassed in this respect by the effeminate Leicesters , which were in turn less curly than the Cots- wolds . But the most picturesque by far was [a small flock of Exmoors]5730-a small flock of exmoors , which chanced to be there this year . [Their]5730-a small flock of exmoors pied faces and legs , dark and heavy horns , tresses of wool hanging round [their]5730-a small flock of exmoors swarthy foreheads , quite relieved the monotony of [the flocks in [that quarter]5732-that quarter]5731-the flocks in that quarter . [All these bleating , panting , and weary thousands]5733-all these bleating , panting , and weary thousands had entered and were penned before the morning had far advanced , the dog belonging to each flock being tied to the corner of the pen containing it . [Alleys for [pedes- trians]5735-pedes- trians]5734-alleys for pedes- trians intersected [the pens]5736-the pens , which soon became crowded with [buyers]5737-buyers and [sellers]5738-sellers from far and near . In [another part of [the hill]3452-the hill]5739-another part of the hill an altogether different scene began to force itself upon the eye towards mid- day . [A circular tent]5741-a circular tent , of exceptional newness and size , was in course of erection here . As the day drew on , [the flocks]5742-the flocks began to change hands , lightening the shep- herd 's responsibilities ; and [they]5742-the flocks turned [their]5742-the flocks attention to [this tent]5743-this tent and inquired of [a man at work there , whose soul seemed concentrated on tying a bothering knot in no time , what was going on]5744-a man at work there , whose soul seemed concentrated on tying a bothering knot in no time , what was going on . "[383-black bess] The Royal Hippodrome Performance of Turpin 's Ride to [York]125-york and the Death of [Black Bess]383-black bess . " replied [the man]726-the man promptly , without turning [his]726-the man eyes or leaving off trying . As soon as [the tent]5746-the tent was completed [the band]5747-the band struck up highly stimulating harmonies , and the announce- ment was publicly made , [Black Bess]383-black bess standing in a con- spicuous position on the outside , as a living proof , If proof were wanted , of the truth of the oracular utterances from the stage over which [the people]4933-the people were to enter . These were so convinced by such genuine appeals to heart and understanding both that [they]5742-the flocks soon began to crowd in abundantly , among the foremost being visible [Jan Coggan]180-coggan and [Joseph Poorgrass]196-joseph , who were holiday keeping [here]575-here to - day , "[0-i] ' That 's the great ruffen pushing [me]0-i ! " screamed [a woman in front of [Jan]180-coggan]5750-a woman in front of jan over [her]5750-a woman in front of jan shoulder at [him]180-coggan when the rush was at its fiercest . "[2933-she] How can [I]0-i help pushing [ye]0-i when [the folk behind push [me]0-i]2932-the folk behind push me ? " said [Coggan]180-coggan , in a deprecating tone , turning without turning [his]180-coggan body , which was jammed as in a vice . There was a silence ; then the drums and trumpets again sent forth [their]5742-the flocks echoing notes . [The crowd]3713-the crowd was again ecstasied , and gave another lurch in which [Coggan]180-coggan and [Poorgrass]196-joseph were again thrust by those behind upon [the women in front]5752-the women in front . "[2937-the damn women] O that helpless feymels should be at the mercy of [she]2933-she swayed like a reed shaken by the wind . Now . " said [Coggan]180-coggan , appealing in an earnest voice to [the public at large]5753-the public at large as it stood clustered about [his]180-coggan shoulder - blades . "[2937-the damn women] Did [ye]0-i ever hear [such onreasonable woman as that]2934-such onreasonable woman as that ? Upon [[my]0-i carcase]2509-my carcase , [neighbours]776-neighbours , if [I]0-i could only get out of this cheesewring , [the damn women]2937-the damn women might eat the show for [me]0-i ! " "[2937-the damn women] Do n't [ye]0-i lose [yer]0-i temper , [Jan]180-coggan ! " implored [Joseph Poorgrass]196-joseph , in a whisper . "[353-troy] [They]2937-the damn women might get [[their]2937-the damn women men]2938-their men to murder [us]2939-they , for [I]0-i think by the shine of [their]2937-the damn women eyes that [they]2937-the damn women be a sinful form of [womankind]2940-womankind . " [Jan]180-coggan held [his]180-coggan tongue , as if [he]180-coggan had no objection to be pacified to please [a friend]5754-a friend , and [they]2939-they gradually reached the foot of the ladder , [Poorgrass]196-joseph being flattened like a jumping - jack , and the sixpence , for admission , which [he]180-coggan had got ready half - an - hour earlier , having become so reeking hot in the tight squeeze of [his]180-coggan excited hand that [the woman in spangles , brazen rings set with glass diamonds]5755-the woman in spangles , brazen rings set with glass diamonds , and with chalked face and shoulders , who took the money of [him]180-coggan , hastily dropped it again from a fear that some trick had been played to burn [her]5755-the woman in spangles , brazen rings set with glass diamonds fingers . So [they]2939-they all entered , and the cloth of [the tent]5746-the tent , to the eyes of [an observer on the outside]5757-an observer on the outside , became bulged into innumerable pimples such as [we]2939-they observe on a sack of potatoes , caused by the various human heads , backs , and elbows at high pressure within . At the rear of [the large tent]5758-the large tent there were two small dressing - tents . One of these , alloted to [the male per- formers]5759-the male per- formers , was partitioned into halves by a cloth ; and in one of [the divisions]5760-the divisions there was sitting on the grass , pull ing on a pair of jack - boots , [a young man whom [we]2939-they instantly recognise as [Sergeant Troy]243-bathsheba]5761-a young man whom we instantly recognise as sergeant troy . [Troy]243-bathsheba 's appearance in this position may be briefly accounted for . [The brig aboard which [he]243-bathsheba was taken in [Budmouth Roads]126-budmouth roads]5762-the brig aboard which he was taken in budmouth roads was about to start on a voyage , though somewhat short of hands . [Troy]243-bathsheba read the articles and joined , but before [they]2939-they sailed [a boat]2798-a boat was despatched across [the bay]1420-the bay to [Lulwind cove]5765-lulwind cove ; as [he]243-bathsheba had half expected , [his]243-bathsheba clothes were gone . [He]243-bathsheba ultimately worked [his]243-bathsheba passage to [the United States]5766-the united states , where [he]243-bathsheba made a precarious living in [various towns]5767-various towns as [Professor of Gymnastics]5768-professor of gymnastics , Sword Exercise , Fencing , and Pugilism . A few months were sufficient to give [him]243-bathsheba a distaste for this kind of life . There was a certain animal form of refinement in [his]243-bathsheba nature ; and however pleasant a strange condition might be whilst privations were easily warded off , it was dis- advantageously coarse when money was short . There was ever present , too , the idea that [he]243-bathsheba could claim [a home]5769-a home and its comforts did [he]243-bathsheba but chose to return to [England]8-england and [Weatherbury Farm]61-weatherbury farm . Whether [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba thought [him]243-bathsheba dead was a frequent subject of curious conjecture . To [England]8-england [he]243-bathsheba did return at last ; but the but the fact of drawing nearer to [Weatherbury]196-joseph abstracted its fascinations , and [his]243-bathsheba intention to enter [his]243-bathsheba old groove at [the place]3486-the place became modified . It was with gloom [he]243-bathsheba con- sidered on landing at [Liverpool]127-liverpool that if [he]243-bathsheba were to go [home]556-home [his]243-bathsheba reception would be of a kind very unpleasant to con- template ; for what [Troy]243-bathsheba had in the way of emotion was an occasional fitful sentiment which sometimes caused [him]243-bathsheba as much inconvenience as emotion of a strong and healthy kind . [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba was not [a women to be made a fool of]5772-a women to be made a fool of , or [a woman to suffer in silence]5773-a woman to suffer in silence ; and how could [he]243-bathsheba endure existence with [a spirited wife to whom at first entering [he]243-bathsheba would be beholden for food and lodging]5774-a spirited wife to whom at first entering he would be beholden for food and lodging ? Moreover , it was not at all unlikely that [[his]243-bathsheba wife]4301-his wife would fail at [her]4301-his wife farming , if [she]4301-his wife had not already done so ; and [he]243-bathsheba would then become liable for [her]4301-his wife maintenance : and what a life such a future of poverty with [her]4301-his wife would be , [the spectre of Fanny]5776-the spectre of fanny constantly be- tween [them]5777-them , harrowing [his]243-bathsheba temper and embittering [her]4301-his wife words ! Thus , for reasons touching on distaste , regret , and shame commingled , [he]243-bathsheba put off [his]243-bathsheba return from day to day , and would have decided to put it off altogether if [he]243-bathsheba could have found anywhere else [the ready - made establishment which existed for [him]243-bathsheba [there]3509-there]5778-the ready - made establishment which existed for him there . At this time - the July preceding the September in which [we]5780-we find at [Greenhill Fair]26-greenhill fair - [he]243-bathsheba fell in with [a travelling circus which was performing in [the outskirts of [a northern town]5783-a northern town]5782-the outskirts of a northern town]5781-a travelling circus which was performing in the outskirts of a northern town . [Troy]243-bathsheba introduced [himself]243-bathsheba to [the manager]5784-the manager by taming [a restive horse of [the troupe]5786-the troupe]5785-a restive horse of the troupe , hitting a suspended apple with pistol - bullet fired from the animal 's back when in full gallop , and other feats . For [his]243-bathsheba merits in these - all more or less based upon [his]243-bathsheba ex- periences as [a dragoon - guardsman]5787-a dragoon - guardsman - [Troy]243-bathsheba was taken into [the company]3918-the company , and the play of [Turpin]384-turpin was prepared with a view to [his]243-bathsheba personation of [the chief character]5789-the chief character . [Troy]243-bathsheba was not greatly elated by the appreciative spirit in which [he]243-bathsheba was undoubtedly treated , but [he]243-bathsheba thought [the engage- ment]5790-the engage- ment might afford [him]243-bathsheba a few weeks for consideration . It was thus carelessly , and without having formed any definite plan for the future , that [Troy]243-bathsheba found [himself]243-bathsheba at [Greenhill Fair]26-greenhill fair with the rest of [the company]3918-the company on this day . And now the mild autumn sun got lower , and in front of [the pavilion]5792-the pavilion the following incident had taken place . [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba - who was driven to the fair that day by [[her]5793-her odd man]5794-her odd man [Poorgrass]196-joseph - had , like [every one else]5795-every one else , read or heard the announcement that [Mr. Francis]385-mr. francis , [the Great Cosmopolitan Equestrian and Roughrider]5796-the great cosmopolitan equestrian and roughrider , would enact the part of [Turpin]384-turpin , and [she]5793-her was not yet too old and careworn to be without a little curiosity to see [him]384-turpin . [This particular show]5797-this particular show was by far the largest and grandest in [the fair]5798-the fair , a horde of little shows grouping [themselves]644-the sheep under its shade like chickens around a hen . [The crowd]3713-the crowd had passed in , and [Boldwood]231-boldwood , who had been watching all the day for an opportunity of speaking to [her]5793-her , seeing [her]5793-her comparatively isolated , came up to [her]5793-her side .
