" Now [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba did care a little to see the show , and had only withheld [her]2953-her feet from the ladder because [she]2953-her feared to go in alone . [She]2953-her had been hoping that [Oak]144-gabriel might appear , whose assistance in such cases was always accepted as an inalienable right , but [Oak]144-gabriel was nowhere to be seen ; and hence it was that [she]2953-her said , "[337-satan] Then if [you]2953-her will just look in first , to see if there 's room , [I]0-i think [I]0-i will go in for a minute or two . " And so a short time after this [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba appeared in [the tent]5746-the tent with [Boldwood]231-boldwood at [her]2953-her elbow , who , taking [her]2953-her to a "[337-satan] reserved " seat , again withdrew . This feature consisted of one raised bench in very conspicuous part of the circle , covered with red cloth , and floored with a piece of carpet , and [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba immediately found , to [her]2953-her confusion , that [she]2953-her was [the single reserved individual in [the tent]5746-the tent]5801-the single reserved individual in the tent , [the rest of [the crowded spectators]5804-the crowded spectators]5803-the rest of the crowded spectators , one and all , standing on [their]5803-the rest of the crowded spectators legs on the borders of [the arena]5805-the arena , where [they]5803-the rest of the crowded spectators got twice as good a view of the performance for half the money . Hence as many eyes were turned upon [her]2953-her , enthroned alone in [this place of honour]5806-this place of honour , against a scarlet back- ground , as upon the ponies and [clown who were engaged in preliminary exploits in the centre]5807-clown who were engaged in preliminary exploits in the centre , [Turpin]384-turpin not having yet appeared . Once [there]3509-there , [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba was forced to make the best of it and remain : [she]2953-her sat down , spreading [her]2953-her skirts with some dignity over the unoccupied space on each side of [her]2953-her , and giving a new and feminine aspect to [the pavilion]5792-the pavilion . In a few minutes [she]2953-her noticed the fat red nape of [Coggan]180-coggan 's neck among those standing just below [her]2953-her , and [Joseph Poor- grass]188-joseph 's saintly profile a little further on . [The interior]5810-the interior was shadowy with a peculiar shade . The strange luminous semi - opacities of fine autumn afternoons and eves intensified into Rembrandt effects the few yellow sunbeams which came through holes and divisions in the canvas , and spirted like jets of gold - dust across the dusky blue atmosphere of haze pervading [the tent]5746-the tent , until they alighted on inner surfaces of cloth opposite , and shone like little lamps suspended there . [Troy]243-bathsheba , on peeping from [[his]243-bathsheba dressing - tent]5812-his dressing - tent through a slit for a reconnoitre before entering , saw [[his]243-bathsheba unconscious wife]5813-his unconscious wife on high before [him]243-bathsheba as described , sitting as [queen of the tournament]5814-queen of the tournament . [He]243-bathsheba started back in utter confusion , for although [his]243-bathsheba disguise effectually concealed [his]243-bathsheba person- ality , [he]243-bathsheba instantly felt that [she]5813-his unconscious wife would be sure to recognize [his]243-bathsheba voice . [He]243-bathsheba had several times during the day thought of the possibility of [some Weatherbury person]5815-some weatherbury person or other appearing and recognizing [him]243-bathsheba ; but [he]243-bathsheba had taken the risk carelessly . If [they]5815-some weatherbury person see [me]337-satan , let [them]5815-some weatherbury person , [he]243-bathsheba had said . But here was [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba in [[her]5813-his unconscious wife own person]5816-her own person ; and the reality of the scene was so much intenser than any of [his]243-bathsheba prefigurings that [he]243-bathsheba felt [he]243-bathsheba had not half enough considered the point . [She]5813-his unconscious wife looked so charming and fair that [his]243-bathsheba cool mood about [Weatherbury people]5817-weatherbury people was changed . [He]243-bathsheba had not expected [her]5813-his unconscious wife to exercise this power over [him]243-bathsheba in the twinkling of an eye . Should [he]243-bathsheba go on , and care nothing ? [He]243-bathsheba could not bring [himself]243-bathsheba to do that . Beyond a politic wish to remain unknown , there suddenly arose in [him]243-bathsheba now a sense of shame at the possibility that [[his]243-bathsheba attractive young wife]5818-his attractive young wife , who already despised [him]243-bathsheba , should despise [him]243-bathsheba more by discovering [him]243-bathsheba in so mean a condition after so long a time . [He]243-bathsheba actually blushed at the thought , and was vexed beyond measure that [his]243-bathsheba sentiments of dislike towards [Weatherbury]196-joseph should have led [him]243-bathsheba to dally about [the country]1144-the country in this way . But [Troy]243-bathsheba was never more clever than when absolutely at [his]243-bathsheba wit 's end . [He]243-bathsheba hastily thrust aside the curtain dividing [his]243-bathsheba own little dressing space from that of [the manager]5784-the manager and proprietor , who now appeared as the individual called [Tom King]306-tom king as far down as [his]306-tom king waist , and as [the aforesaid respectable manager]5821-the aforesaid respectable manager thence to [his]306-tom king toes . "[337-satan] Here 's the devil to pay ! " said [Troy]243-bathsheba . "[2956-a blackguard creditor] How 's that ? " "[337-satan] Why , there 's [a blackguard creditor]2956-a blackguard creditor in [the tent]5746-the tent [I]0-i do n't want to see , who 'll discover [me]0-i and nab [me]0-i as sure as [Satan]337-satan if [I]0-i open [my]0-i mouth . What 's to be done ? " [You]0-i must appear now , [I]0-i think . "[0-i] " [I]384-turpin ca n't . "[384-turpin] But the play must proceed . " "[243-bathsheba] Do [you]0-i give out that [Turpin]384-turpin has got a bad cold , and ca n't speak [his]384-turpin part , but that [he]384-turpin 'll perform it just the same without speaking . " [The proprietor]5822-the proprietor shook [his]5822-the proprietor head . "[243-bathsheba] Anyhow , play or no play , [I]0-i wo n't open [my]0-i mouth , said [Troy]243-bathsheba , firmly . " Very well , then let [me]180-coggan see . [I]180-coggan tell [you]0-i how [we]5823-we 'll manage . "[180-coggan] said the other , who perhaps felt it would be extremely awkward to offend [[his]2958-his leading man]2959-his leading man just at this time . " [I]2958-his wo n't tell ['em]5824-'em anything about [your]0-i keeping silence ; go on with the piece and say nothing , doing what [you]0-i can by a judicious wink now and then , and a few indomitable nods in the heroic places , [you]0-i know . [They]5825-they 'll never find out that the speeches are omitted . "[2958-his] This seemed feasible enough , for [Turpin]384-turpin 's speeches were not many or long , the fascination of the piece lying entirely in the action ; and accordingly the play began , and at the appointed time [Black Bess]383-black bess leapt into the grassy circle amid the plaudits of [the spectators]4316-the spectators . At the turnpike scene , where [Bess]383-black bess and [Turpin]384-turpin are hotly pursued at midnight by [the officers]4118-the officers , and half - awake gatekeeper in [his]2958-his tasselled nightcap denies that [any horseman]2962-any horseman has passed , [Coggan]180-coggan uttered a broad - chested " Well done ! "[196-joseph] which could be heard all over [the fair]5798-the fair above the bleating , and [Poorgrass]196-joseph smiled delightedly with a nice sense of dramatic contrast between [[our]2964-our hero]2965-our hero , who coolly leaps the gate , and halting justice in the form of [[his]2958-his enemies]2966-his enemies , who must needs pull up cumbersomely and wait to be let through . At the death of [Tom King]306-tom king , [he]2958-his could not refrain from seizing [Coggan]180-coggan by the hand , and whispering , with tears in [his]2958-his eyes , " Of course [he]306-tom king 's not really shot , [Jan]180-coggan - only seemingly ! "[384-turpin] And when the last sad scene came on , and the body of [the gallant and faithful Bess]383-black bess had to be carried out on a shutter by [twelve volunteers from among [the spectators]4316-the spectators]2967-twelve volunteers from among the spectators , nothing could restrain [Poorgrass]196-joseph from lending a hand , exclaiming , as [he]196-joseph asked [Jan]180-coggan to join [him]196-joseph , " Twill be something to tell of at [Warren]185-warren 's in future years , [Jan]180-coggan , and hand down to [[our]5826-our children]5827-our children . "[384-turpin] For many a year in [Weatherbury]196-joseph , [Joseph]196-joseph told , with the air of [a man who had had experiences in [his]196-joseph time]2969-a man who had had experiences in his time , that [he]196-joseph touched with [his]196-joseph own hand the hoof of [Bess]383-black bess as [she]383-black bess lay upon the board upon [his]196-joseph shoulder . If , as some thinkers hold , immortality consists in being enshrined in [others]618-others " memories , then did [Black Bess]383-black bess become immortal that day if [she]383-black bess never had done so before . Meanwhile [Troy]243-bathsheba had added a few touches to [his]243-bathsheba ordinary make - up for the character , the more effectually to disguise [himself]243-bathsheba , and though [he]243-bathsheba had felt faint qualms on first entering , the metamorphosis effected by [judici- ously]386-judici- ously "[384-turpin] lining " [his]243-bathsheba face with a wire rendered [him]243-bathsheba safe from the eyes of [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba and [[her]383-black bess men]1056-her men . Nevertheless , [he]243-bathsheba was relieved when it was got through . There a second performance in the evening , and [the tent]5746-the tent was lighted up . [Troy]243-bathsheba had taken [his]243-bathsheba part very quietly this time , venturing to introduce a few speeches on occasion ; and was just concluding it when , whilst standing at the edge of the circle contiguous to [the first row of [spectators]5831-spectators]5830-the first row of spectators , [he]243-bathsheba observed within a yard of [him]243-bathsheba the eye of [a man]3474-a man darted keenly into [his]243-bathsheba side features . [Troy]243-bathsheba hastily shifted [his]243-bathsheba position , after having recognized in [sworn enemy]5833-sworn enemy , who still hung about [the outskirts of At]5834-the outskirts of at first [Troy]243-bathsheba resolved to take no notice and abide by circumstances . That [he]243-bathsheba had been recognized by [this man]4150-this man was highly probable ; yet there was room for a doubt . Then the great objection [he]243-bathsheba had felt to allowing news of [his]243-bathsheba proximity to precede [him]243-bathsheba to [Weatherbury]196-joseph in the event of [his]243-bathsheba return , based on a feeling that knowledge of [his]243-bathsheba present occupation would discredit [him]243-bathsheba still further in [[his]243-bathsheba wife]4301-his wife 's eyes , returned in full force . Moreover , should [he]243-bathsheba resolve not to return at all , a tale of [his]243-bathsheba being alive and being in [the neighbourhood]615-the neighbourhood would be awkward ; and [he]243-bathsheba was anxious to acquire a knowledge of [[his]243-bathsheba wife]4301-his wife 's temporal affairs before deciding which to do . In this dilemma [Troy]243-bathsheba at once went out to recon- noitre . It occurred to [him]243-bathsheba that to find [Pennyways]251-pennyways , and make [a friend of [him]251-pennyways]5839-a friend of him if possible , would be a very wise act . [He]243-bathsheba had put on a thick beard borrowed from [the establishment]5840-the establishment , and this [he]243-bathsheba wandered about [the fair- field]5841-the fair- field . It was now almost dark , and [respectable people]5842-respectable people were getting [their]5842-respectable people carts and gigs ready to go [home]556-home [The largest refreshment booth in [the fair]5798-the fair]5844-the largest refreshment booth in the fair was provided by [an innkeeper from [a neighbouring town]5847-a neighbouring town]5846-an innkeeper from a neighbouring town . This was considered [an unexceptionable place for obtaining the necessary food and rest]5848-an unexceptionable place for obtaining the necessary food and rest : [Host Trencher]387-host trencher as [he]387-host trencher was jauntily called by the local newspaper being [a sub- stantial man of high repute for catering through [all the county round]5850-all the county round]5849-a sub- stantial man of high repute for catering through all the county round . [The tent]5746-the tent was divided into first and second - class compartments , and at the end of [the first- class division]5852-the first- class division was a yet further enclosure for the most exclusive , fenced of from [the body of [the tent]5746-the tent]5853-the body of the tent by [a luncheon - bar , behind which [the host]5856-the host [himself]5856-the host stood bustling about in white apron and shirt - sleeves , and look- ing as if [he]5856-the host had never lived anywhere but under canvas all [his]5856-the host life]5855-a luncheon - bar , behind which the host himself stood bustling about in white apron and shirt - sleeves , and look- ing as if he had never lived anywhere but under canvas all his life . In [these penetralia]5857-these penetralia were chairs and a table , which , on candles being lighted , made quite a cozy and luxurious show , with an urn , plated tea and coffee pots , china teacups , and plum cakes . [Troy]243-bathsheba stood at the entrance to the booth , where [a gipsy - woman]5858-a gipsy - woman was frying pancakes over a little fire of sticks and selling them at a penny a - piece , and looked over the heads of [the people within]5859-the people within . [He]243-bathsheba could see nothing of [Pennyways]251-pennyways , but [he]243-bathsheba soon discerned [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba through an opening into [the reserved space at the further end]5860-the reserved space at the further end . [Troy]243-bathsheba thereupon retreated , went round [the tent]5746-the tent into the darkness , and listened . [He]243-bathsheba could hear [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's voice immediately inside the canvas ; [she]5858-a gipsy - woman was conversing with [a man]3474-a man . A warmth overspread [his]243-bathsheba face : surely [she]5858-a gipsy - woman was not so unprincipled as to flirt in a fair ! [He]243-bathsheba wondered if , then , [she]5858-a gipsy - woman reckoned upon [his]243-bathsheba death as an absolute certainty . To get at the root of the matter , [Troy]243-bathsheba took a penknife from [his]243-bathsheba pocket and softly made two little cuts crosswise in the cloth , which , by folding back the corners left a hole the size of a wafer . Close to this [he]243-bathsheba placed [his]243-bathsheba face , withdrawing it again in a movement of surprise ; for [his]243-bathsheba eye had been within twelve inches of the top of [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's head . lt was too near to be convenient . [He]243-bathsheba made another hole a little to one side and lower down , in a shaded place beside [her]5858-a gipsy - woman chair , from which it was easy and safe to survey [her]5858-a gipsy - woman by looking horizontally ' . [Troy]243-bathsheba took in the scene completely now . [She]5858-a gipsy - woman was leaning back , sipping a cup of tea that [she]5858-a gipsy - woman held in [her]5858-a gipsy - woman hand , and [the owner of the male voice]5863-the owner of the male voice was [Boldwood]231-boldwood , who had apparently just brought the cup to [her]5858-a gipsy - woman , [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba , being in a negligent mood , leant so idly against the canvas that it was pressed to the shape of [her]5858-a gipsy - woman shoulder , and [she]5858-a gipsy - woman was , in fact , as good as in [Troy]243-bathsheba 's arms ; and [he]243-bathsheba was obliged to keep [his]243-bathsheba breast carefully backward that [she]5858-a gipsy - woman might not feel its warmth through the cloth as [he]243-bathsheba gazed in . [Troy]243-bathsheba found unexpected chords of feeling to be stirred again within [him]243-bathsheba as [they]5864-they had been stirred earlier in the day . [She]5858-a gipsy - woman was handsome as ever , and [she]5858-a gipsy - woman was [his]243-bathsheba . It was some minutes before [he]243-bathsheba could counteract [his]243-bathsheba sudden wish to go in , and claim [her]5858-a gipsy - woman . Then [he]243-bathsheba thought how [the proud girl who had always looked down upon [him]243-bathsheba even whilst it was to love [him]243-bathsheba]5865-the proud girl who had always looked down upon him even whilst it was to love him , would hate [him]243-bathsheba on dis- covering [him]243-bathsheba to be [a strolling player]5866-a strolling player . Were [he]243-bathsheba to make [himself]243-bathsheba known , that chapter of [his]243-bathsheba life must at all risks be kept for ever from [her]5858-a gipsy - woman and from [the Weatherbury people]5867-the weatherbury people , or [his]243-bathsheba name would be a byword throughout [the parish]422-the parish . [He]243-bathsheba would be nicknamed "[243-bathsheba] [Turpin]384-turpin " as long as [he]243-bathsheba lived . Assuredly before [he]243-bathsheba could claim [her]5858-a gipsy - woman these few past months of [his]243-bathsheba existence must be entirely blotted out . "[243-bathsheba] Shall [I]0-i get [you]2971-you another cup before [you]2971-you start , [ma'am]712-ma'am ? " said [Farmer Boldwood]231-boldwood . [I]251-pennyways thank [you]2971-you , "[251-pennyways] said [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba . " But [I]251-pennyways must be going at once . It was great neglect in [that man]892-that man to keep [me]251-pennyways waiting [here]575-here till so late . [I]251-pennyways should have gone two hours ago , if it had not been for [him]892-that man . [I]251-pennyways had no idea of coming in [here]575-here ; but there 's nothing so refreshing as a cup of tea , though [I]251-pennyways should never have got one if [you]2971-you had n't helped [me]251-pennyways . "[251-pennyways] [Troy]243-bathsheba scrutinized [her]2971-you cheek as lit by the candles , and watched each varying shade thereon , and the white shell - like sinuosities of [her]2971-you little ear . [She]2971-you took out [her]2971-you purse and was insisting to [Boldwood]231-boldwood on paying for [her]2971-you tea for [herself]2971-you , when at this moment [Pennyways]251-pennyways entered [the tent]5746-the tent . [Troy]243-bathsheba trembled : here was [his]243-bathsheba scheme for respectability endangered at once . [He]243-bathsheba was about to leave [[his]243-bathsheba hole of espial]2974-his hole of espial , attempt to follow [Pennyways]251-pennyways , and find out if [the ex - bailiff]2975-the ex - bailiff had recognized [him]243-bathsheba , when [he]243-bathsheba was arrested by the conversation , and found [he]243-bathsheba was too late . " Excuse [me]251-pennyways , [ma'am]712-ma'am . "[251-pennyways] said [Pennyways]251-pennyways ; " [I]251-pennyways 've some private information for [your]712-ma'am ear alone . "[251-pennyways] [I]0-i can not hear it now . " [she]0-i said , coldly . That [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba could not endure [this man]4150-this man was evident ; in fact , [he]4150-this man was continually coming to [her]0-i with some tale or other , by which [he]4150-this man might creep into favour at the expense of [persons maligned]5874-persons maligned . "[2977-the fool] [I]0-i 'll write it down . " said [Pennyways]251-pennyways , confidently . [He]251-pennyways stooped over the table , pulled a leaf from a warped pocket - book , and wrote upon the paper , in a round hand - "[2977-the fool] [[YOUR]0-i husband]5516-your husband is here . [I]0-i 've seen [him]5516-your husband . Who 's [the fool]2977-the fool now ? " This [he]251-pennyways folded small , and handed towards [her]0-i . [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba would not read it ; [she]0-i would not even put out [her]0-i hand to take it . [Pennyways]251-pennyways , then , with a laugh of derision , tossed it into [her]0-i lap , and , turning away , left [her]0-i . From the words and action of [Pennyways]251-pennyways , [Troy]243-bathsheba , though [he]243-bathsheba had not been able to see what [the ex - bailiff]2975-the ex - bailiff wrote , had not a moment 's doubt that the note referred to [him]243-bathsheba . Nothing that [he]243-bathsheba could think of could be done to check the exposure . "[0-i] Curse [my]0-i luck ! " [he]243-bathsheba whispered , and added imprecations which rustled in the gloom like a pestilent wind . [Meanwhile Boldwood]231-boldwood said , taking up the note from [her]0-i lap - "[0-i] Do n't [you]2978-you wish to read it , [Mrs. Troy]353-troy ? If not , [I]0-i 'll destroy it . " "[2979-he] Oh , well . " said [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba , carelessly , "[353-troy] perhaps it is unjust not to read it ; but [I]0-i can guess what it is about . [He]2979-he wants [me]0-i to recommend [him]2979-he , or it is to tell [me]0-i of some little scandal or another connected with [my]0-i work- [people]3461-people . [He]2979-he 's always doing that . " [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba held the note in [her]0-i right hand . [Bold-]249-bold- wood handed towards [her]0-i a plate of cut bread - and- butter ; when , in order to take a slice , [she]0-i put the note into [her]0-i left hand , where [she]0-i was still holding the purse , and then allowed [her]0-i hand to drop beside [her]0-i close to the canvas . The moment had come for saving [his]2979-he game , and [Troy]353-troy impulsively felt that [he]2979-he would play the card , For yet another time [he]2979-he looked at the fair hand , and saw the pink finger - tips , and the blue veins of the wrist , encircled by a bracelet of coral chippings which [she]0-i wore : how familiar it all was to [him]2979-he ! Then , with the lightning action in which [he]2979-he was such [an adept]5876-an adept , [he]2979-he noiselessly slipped [his]2979-he hand under the bottom of the tent - cloth , which was far from being pinned tightly down , lifted it a little way , keeping [his]2979-he eye to the hole , snatched the note from [her]0-i fingers , dropped the canvas , and ran away in the gloom towards [the bank]4832-the bank and [ditch]5878-ditch , smiling at the scream of astonishment which burst from [her]0-i . [Troy]353-troy then slid down on the outside of [the rampart]5879-the rampart , hastened round in the bottom of [the entrenchment]5880-the entrenchment to a distance of a hundred yards , ascended again , and crossed boldly in a slow walk towards the front entrance of [the tent]5746-the tent . [His]2979-he object was now to get to [Pennyways]251-pennyways , and prevent a repetition of the announcement until such time as [he]2979-he should choose . [Troy]353-troy reached the tent door , and standing among [the groups there gathered]5882-the groups there gathered , looked anxiously for [Pennyways]251-pennyways , evidently not wishing to make [himself]353-troy prominent by inquiring for [him]251-pennyways . [One or two men]5883-one or two men were speaking of a daring attempt that had just been made to rob [a young lady]1649-a young lady by lifting the canvas of the tent beside [her]0-i . It was supposed that [the rogue]5885-the rogue had imagined a slip of paper which [she]0-i held in [her]0-i hand to [he]5885-the rogue a bank note , for [he]5885-the rogue had seized it , and made off with it , leaving [her]0-i purse behind . [His]2979-he chagrin and disappointment at dis- covering its worthlessness would be a good joke , it was said . However , the occurrence seemed to have become known to [few]4511-few , for it had not interrupted [a fiddler , who had lately begun playing by the door of the tent]5887-a fiddler , who had lately begun playing by the door of the tent , nor [the four bowed old men with grim countenances and walking - sticks in hand]5888-the four bowed old men with grim countenances and walking - sticks in hand , who were dancing "[353-troy] [Major Malley]388-major malley 's Reel " to the tune . Behind these stood [Pennyways]251-pennyways . [Troy]353-troy glided up to [him]2979-he , beckoned , and whispered a few words ; and with a mutual glance of concurrence [the two men]2095-the two men went into the night together . [CHAPTER LI BATHSHEBA]243-bathsheba TALKS WITH [HER]0-i OUTRIDER THE arrangement for getting back again to [Weather-]316-weather- bury had been that [Oak]144-gabriel should take the place of Poor- grass in [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's conveyance and drive [her]0-i [home]556-home , it being discovered late in the afternoon that [Joseph]196-joseph was suffering from [his]196-joseph old complaint , a multiplying eye , and was , therefore , hardly trustworthy as [coachman]5891-coachman and protector to [a woman]459-a woman . But [Oak]144-gabriel had found [himself]144-gabriel so occupied , and was full of so many cares relative to those portions of [Boldwood]231-boldwood 's flocks that were not disposed of , that [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba , without telling [Oak]144-gabriel or [anybody]3643-anybody , resolved to drive [home]556-home [herself]243-bathsheba , as [she]0-i had many times done from [Casterbridge Market]128-casterbridge market , and trust to [[her]0-i good angel]5895-her good angel for performing the journey un- molested . But having fallen in with [Farmer Boldwood]231-boldwood accidentally on [her]0-i part at least at [the refreshment- tent]5896-the refreshment- tent , [she]0-i found it impossible to refuse [his]231-boldwood offer to ride on horseback beside [her]0-i as [escort]5897-escort . It had grown twilight before [she]0-i was aware , but [Boldwood]231-boldwood assured [her]0-i that there was no cause for uneasiness , as the moon would be up in half - an - hour . Immediately after the incident in [the tent]5746-the tent , [she]0-i had risen to go - now absolutely alarmed and really grateful for [[her]0-i old lover]5899-her old lover 's protection - though regretting [Gabriel]144-gabriel 's absence , whose company [she]0-i would have much preferred , as being more proper as well as more pleasant , since [he]231-boldwood was [[her]0-i own managing - man]5900-her own managing - man and servant . This , how- ever , could not be helped ; [she]0-i would not , on any consideration , treat [Boldwood]231-boldwood harshly , having once already illused [him]231-boldwood , and the moon having risen , and the gig being ready , [she]0-i drove across [the hilltop]5901-the hilltop in the wending way 's which led downwards - to oblivious obscurity , as it seemed , for the moon and [the hill]3452-the hill [it]3452-the hill flooded with light were in appearance on a level , [the rest of [the world]447-the world]5903-the rest of the world lying as [a vast shady concave between [them]5906-they]5905-a vast shady concave between them . [Boldwood]231-boldwood mounted [his]231-boldwood horse , and followed in close attendance behind . Thus [they]5906-they descended into [the lowlands]5907-the lowlands , and the sounds of those left on [the hill]3452-the hill came like voices from the sky , and the lights were as those of [a camp in heaven]5909-a camp in heaven . [They]5906-they soon passed [the merry stragglers in [the immediate vicinity of [the hill]3452-the hill]5911-the immediate vicinity of the hill]5910-the merry stragglers in the immediate vicinity of the hill , traversed [Kingsbere]31-kingsbere , and got upon [the high road]5656-the high road . The keen instincts of [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba had perceived that [the farmer]3540-the farmer 's staunch devotion to [herself]243-bathsheba was still un- diminished , and [she]5915-her sympathized deeply . The sight had quite depressed [her]5915-her this evening ; had reminded [her]5915-her of [her]5915-her folly ; [she]5915-her wished anew , as [she]5915-her had wished many months ago , for some means of making repara- tion for [her]5915-her fault . Hence [her]5915-her pity for [the man who so persistently loved on to [his]5916-the man who so persistently loved on to his own injury and per- manent gloom own injury and per- manent gloom]5916-the man who so persistently loved on to his own injury and per- manent gloom had betrayed [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba into an injudi- cious considerateness of manner , which appeared almost like tenderness , and gave new vigour to the exquisite dream of a [Jacob]187-jacob 's seven years service in poor [Boldwood]231-boldwood 's mind . [He]231-boldwood soon found an excuse for advancing from [his]231-boldwood position in the rear , and rode close by [her]5915-her side . [They]5917-they had gone two or three miles in the moonlight , speaking desultorily across the wheel of [her]5915-her gig concerning the fair , farming , [Oak]144-gabriel 's usefulness to [them]5917-they both , and [other indifferent subjects]5918-other indifferent subjects , when [Boldwood]231-boldwood said suddenly and simply - "[353-troy] [Mrs. Troy]353-troy , [you]353-troy will marry again some day ? " This point - blank query unmistakably confused [her]5915-her , it was not till a minute or more had elapsed that [she]5915-her said , "[353-troy] [I]0-i have not seriously thought of any such subject . " "[353-troy] [I]0-i quite understand that . Yet [[your]353-troy late husband]2981-your late husband has been dead nearly one year , and - " "[0-i] [You]353-troy forget that [his]2981-your late husband death was never absolutely proved , and may not have taken place ; so that [I]0-i may not be really [a widow]2982-a widow . " [she]0-i said , catching at the straw of escape that the fact afforded "[0-i] Not absolutely proved , perhaps , but it was proved circumstantially . [A man]3474-a man saw [him]2981-your late husband drowning , too . [No reasonable person]2984-no reasonable person has any doubt of [his]2981-your late husband death ; nor have [you]353-troy , [ma'am]712-ma'am , [I]0-i should imagine . " O yes [I]231-boldwood have , or [I]231-boldwood should have acted differently , "[231-boldwood] [she]0-i said , gently . " From the first , [I]2988-you have had a strange uaccountable feeling that [he]2981-your late husband could not have perished , but [I]2988-you have been able to explain that in several ways since . Even were [I]2988-you half persuaded that [I]2988-you shall see [him]2981-your late husband no more , [I]2988-you am far from thinking of marriage with [another]3843-another . [I]2988-you should be very contemptible to indulge in such a thought . "[2988-you] [They]2986-they were silent now awhile , and having struck into an unfrequented track across [a common]2987-a common , the creaks of [Boldwood]231-boldwood 's saddle and gig springs were all the sounds to be heard . [Boldwood]231-boldwood ended the pause . " Do [you]0-i remember when [I]2988-you carried [you]0-i fainting in [my]2988-you arms into [the King 's Arms]5920-the king 's arms , in [Casterbridge]22-casterbridge ? [Every dog]5921-every dog has [his]5921-every dog day : that was [mine]2988-you . "[2988-you] " [I]2988-you know - [I]2988-you know it all . "[2988-you] [she]2988-you said , hurriedly . " [I]2988-you , for one , shall never cease regretting that events so fell out as to deny [you]0-i to [me]2988-you . "[2988-you] " [I]2988-you , too , am very sorry . "[2988-you] [she]2988-you said , and then checked [herself]2988-you . " [I]2988-you mean , [you]0-i know , [I]2988-you am sorry [you]0-i thought [I]2988-you - "[2988-you] " [I]2988-you have always this dreary pleasure in thinking over those past times with [you]0-i - that [I]2988-you was something to [you]0-i before [HE]5922-he was anything , and that [you]0-i belonged ALMOST to [me]2988-you . " "[2988-you] Which ? " "[0-i] How do [you]2988-you mean which ? " "[243-bathsheba] Do [you]2988-you like [me]0-i , or do [you]2988-you respect [me]0-i ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't know - at least , [I]0-i can not tell [you]2988-you . It is difficult for [a woman]459-a woman to define [her]459-a woman feelings in language which is chiefly made by [men]474-men to express [theirs]474-men . [My]0-i treatment of [you]2988-you was thoughtless , inexcusable , wicked ! [I]0-i shall eternally regret it . If there had been anything [I]0-i could have done to make amends [I]0-i would most gladly have done it - there was nothing on [earth]499-earth [I]0-i so longed to do as to repair the error . But that was not possible . " "[0-i] Do n't blame [yourself]2988-you - [you]2988-you were not so far in the wrong as [you]2988-you suppose . [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba , suppose [you]2988-you had real complete proof that [you]2988-you are what , in fact , [you]2988-you are - [a widow]2982-a widow - would [you]2988-you repair the old wrong to [me]0-i by marrying [me]0-i ? " "[2988-you] [I]0-i can not say . [I]0-i should n't yet , at any rate . " "[2988-you] But [you]2988-you might at some future time of [your]2988-you life ? " "[2988-you] O yes , [I]0-i might at some time . " "[2988-you] Well , then , do [you]2988-you know that without further proof of any kind [you]2988-you may marry again in about six years from the present - subject to [nobody]439-nobody 's objection or blame ? " "[2995-they] O yes . " [she]2988-you said , quickly . "[2988-you] [I]0-i know all that . But do n't talk of it - seven or six years - where may [we]2994-we all be by that time ? " "[2988-you] [They]2995-they will soon glide by , and it will seem an astonishingly short time to look back upon when [they]2995-they are past - much less than to look forward to now . " "[2988-you] Yes , yes ; [I]0-i have found that in [my]0-i own experience . " "[2988-you] Now listen once more . " [Boldwood]231-boldwood pleaded . "[224-boldwood] If [I]0-i wait that time , will [you]2988-you marry [me]0-i ? [You]2988-you own that [you]2988-you owe [me]0-i amends - let that be [your]2988-you way of making them . " "[224-boldwood] But , [Mr. Boldwood]224-boldwood - six years - " "[0-i] Do [you]2988-you want to be [the wife of [any other man]2388-any other man]2996-the wife of any other man ? " "[2988-you] No indeed ! [I]0-i mean , that [I]0-i do n't like to talk about this matter now . Perhaps it is not proper , and [I]0-i ought not to allow it . Let [us]2994-we drop it . [[My]0-i husband]5222-my husband may be living , as [I]0-i said . " "[2988-you] Of course , [I]0-i 'll drop the subject if [you]2988-you wish . But propriety has nothing to do with reasons . [I]0-i am [a middle - aged man]2999-a middle - aged man , willing to protect [you]2988-you for the remainder of [our]2994-we lives . On [your]2988-you side , at least , there is no passion or blamable haste - on [mine]0-i , perhaps , there is . But [I]0-i ca n't help seeing that if [you]2988-you choose from a feeling of pity , and , as [you]2988-you say , a wish to make amends , to make a bargain with [me]0-i for a far - ahead time - an agreement which will set all things right and make [me]0-i happy , late though it may be - there is no fault to be found with [you]2988-you as [a woman]459-a woman . Had n't [I]0-i the first place beside [you]2988-you ? Have n't [you]2988-you been almost [mine]0-i once already ? Surely [you]2988-you can say to [me]0-i as much as this , [you]2988-you will have [me]0-i back again should circumstances permit ? Now , pray speak ! [O Bathsheba]243-bathsheba , promise - it is only a little promise - that if [you]2988-you marry again , [you]2988-you will marry [me]0-i ! " [His]2988-you tone was so excited that [she]0-i almost feared [him]2988-you at this moment , even whilst [she]0-i sympathized . It was a simple physical fear - the weak of the strong ; there no emotional aversion or inner repugnance . [She]0-i said , with some distress in [her]0-i voice , for [she]0-i remembered vividly [his]2988-you outburst on [the Yalbury Road]5923-the yalbury road , and shrank from a repetition of [his]2988-you anger : - "[2988-you] [I]0-i will never marry [another man]4200-another man whilst [you]2988-you wish [me]0-i to be [[your]2988-you wife]4111-your wife , whatever comes - but to say more - [you]2988-you have taken [me]0-i so by surprise - " "[0-i] But let it stand in these simple words - that in six years ' time [you]2988-you will be [[my]0-i wife]586-my wife ? Unexpected accidents [we]3004-we 'll not mention , because those , of course , must be given way to . Now , this time [I]0-i know [you]2988-you will keep [your]2988-you word . " "[0-i] That 's why [I]0-i hesitate to give it . " "[0-i] But do give it ! Remember the past , and be kind . " [She]0-i breathed ; and then said mournfully : "[0-i] O what shall [I]0-i do ? " "[0-i] - Consider , if [I]0-i can not promise soon . " "[3011-we] But soon is perhaps never ? " "[3011-we] O no , it is not ! [I]0-i mean soon . Christmas , [we]3011-we 'll say . " "[0-i] Christmas ! " [He]3717-sir said nothing further till [he]3717-sir added : "[3012-he] Well , [I]0-i 'll say no more to [you]2988-you about it till that time . " [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba was in a very peculiar state of mind , which showed how entirely the soul is the slave of the body , the ethereal spirit dependent for its quality upon the tangible flesh and blood . It is hardly too much to say that [she]0-i felt coerced by a force stronger than [her]0-i own will , not only into the act of promising upon this singularly remote and vague matter , but into the emo- tion of fancying that [she]0-i ought to promise . When the weeks intervening between the night of this conversa- tion and Christmas day began perceptibly to diminish , [her]0-i anxiety and perplexity increased . One day [she]0-i was led by an accident into an oddly confidential dialogue with [Gabriel]144-gabriel about [her]0-i difficulty It afforded [her]0-i a little relief - of a dull and cheerless kind . " "[365-mr. thirdly] [I]0-i shall get to , [I]0-i suppose , because [I]0-i can not help feeling what would have brought [him]5516-your husband back long before this time if [he]5516-your husband had lived . " "[842-the doctor] Well , then , in religious sense [you]3029-you will be as free to THINK o ' marrying again as [any real widow of one year]3035-any real widow of one year 's standing . " That was the insect sting . Not that [she]0-i would have listened to any such hypothesis . O no - for was n't [she]0-i saying all the time that such thoughts of the future were improper , and was n't [Gabriel]144-gabriel far too poor a man to speak sentiment to [her]0-i ? But to give such cool advice - the very advice [she]0-i had asked for - it ruffled [[our]5925-our heroine]5926-our heroine all the afternoon . CHAPTER LII CONVERGING COURSES [I]0-i CHRISTMAS - EVE came , and a party that [Boldwood]224-boldwood was to give in the evening was the great subject of talk in [Weatherbury]196-joseph . It was not that the rarity of Christmas parties in [the parish]422-the parish made this one a wonder , but that [Boldwood]224-boldwood should be [the giver]5928-the giver . The announcement had had an abnormal and incongruous sound , as if [one]4328-one should hear of croquet - playing in [a cathedral aisle]5930-a cathedral aisle , or that [some much - respected judge]5931-some much - respected judge was going upon the stage . That the party was intended to be a truly jovial one there was no room for doubt . A large bough of mistletoe had been brought from [the woods]1829-the woods that day , and suspended in [the hall of [the bachelor]4191-the bachelor 's home]5933-the hall of the bachelor 's home . [Holly]390-holly and ivy had followed in armfuls . From six that morning till past noon the huge wood fire in [the kitchen]4050-the kitchen roared and sparkled at its highest , the kettle , the saucepan , and the threelegged pot appearing in the midst of the flames like [Shadrach]391-shadrach , [Meshach]392-meshach , and [Abednego]129-abednego ; moreover , roasting and basting operations were continually carried on in front of the genial blaze . As it grew later the fire was made up in [the large long hall into which the staircase descended]5936-the large long hall into which the staircase descended , and all encumbrances were cleared out for dancing . The log which was to form the back - brand of the evening fire was the uncleft trunk of a tree , so unwieldy that it could be neither brought nor rolled to its place ; and [accord- ingly two men]5937-accord- ingly two men were to be observed dragging and heaving [it]5938-it in by chains and levers as the hour of assembly drew near . [II]393-ii In spite of all this , the spirit of revelry was wanting In the atmosphere of [the house]552-the house . Such a thing had never been attempted before by [its owner]5940-its owner , and it was now done as by a wrench . Intended gaieties would insist upon appearing like solemn grandeurs , the organ- ization of the whole effort was carried out coldly , by [hirelings]5941-hirelings , and a shadow seemed to move about [the rooms]5942-the rooms , saying that the proceedings were unnatural to [the place]3486-the place and [the lone man who lived therein , and hence not good]5944-the lone man who lived therein , and hence not good . [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba was at this time in [[her]0-i room]5945-her room , dressing for the event . [She]0-i had called for candles , and [Liddy]191-liddy entered and placed one on each side of [[her]0-i mistress]4024-her mistress 's glass . "[0-i] Do n't go away , [Liddy]191-liddy . " said [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba , almost timidly . "[0-i] [I]0-i am foolishly agitated - [i]0-i can not tell why . [I]0-i wish [I]0-i had not been obliged to go to this dance ; but there 's no escaping now . [I]0-i have not spoken to [Mr. Boldwood]224-boldwood since the autumn , when [I]0-i promised to see [him]224-boldwood at Christmas on business , but [I]0-i had no idea there was to be anything of this kind . " "[0-i] But [I]0-i would go now . " said [Liddy]191-liddy , who was going with [her]0-i ; for [Boldwood]224-boldwood had been indiscriminate in [his]224-boldwood invitations . "[191-liddy] Yes , [I]0-i shall make [my]0-i appearance , of course . " said [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba . "[712-ma'am] But [I]0-i am [THE CAUSE of the party]3040-the cause of the party , and that upsets [me]0-i ! - Do n't tell , [Liddy]191-liddy . " "[196-joseph] O no , [ma'am]712-ma'am , [You]0-i the cause of it , [ma'am]712-ma'am ? " "[191-liddy] Yes . [I]0-i have never been free from trouble since [I]0-i have lived [here]575-here , and [this party]3044-this party is likely to bring [me]0-i more . Now , fetch [my]0-i black silk dress , and see how it sits upon [me]0-i . " "[144-gabriel] But [you]0-i will leave off that , surely , [ma'am]712-ma'am ? [The party]5211-the party does n't suit [me]0-i a bit ; but never mind , stay and help to finish [me]0-i off . " [III Boldwood]394-iii boldwood was dressing also at this hour . [A tailor from [Casterbridge]22-casterbridge]5947-a tailor from casterbridge was with [him]394-iii boldwood , assisting [him]394-iii boldwood in the operation of trying on a new coat that had just been brought [home]556-home . [The tailor]3902-the tailor walked round and round [him]224-boldwood , tugged at the waist , pulled the sleeve , pressed out the collar , and for the first time in [his]224-boldwood experience [Boldwood]224-boldwood was not bored- Times had been when [the farmer]3540-the farmer had exclaimed against all such niceties as childish , but now no philosophic or hasty rebuke whatever was provoked by [this man]4150-this man for attaching as much importance to a crease in the coat as to an earthquake in [South America]130-south america . [Boldwood]224-boldwood at last expressed [himself]224-boldwood nearly satisfied , and paid the bill , [the tailor]3902-the tailor passing out of the door just as [Oak]144-gabriel came in to report progress for the day . "[0-i] Oh , [Oak]144-gabriel . " said [Boldwood]224-boldwood . "[0-i] [I]0-i shall of course see [you]144-gabriel here to - night . Make [yourself]144-gabriel merry . "[3056-i] " It has not gone far yet , but [I]144-gabriel think it will soon - yes , [I]144-gabriel know it will . "[144-gabriel] [he]3056-i said , in an impulsive whisper . "[144-gabriel] " Seven years . "[3058-she] murmured [Oak]144-gabriel . " No , no - it 's no such thing ! "[3058-she] [he]144-gabriel said , with im- patience . " "[3058-she] It seems long in a forward view . Do n't build too much upon such promises , [sir]3717-sir . Remember , [you]3717-sir have once be'n deceived . " [IV Troy]395-troy was sitting in [a corner of [The White Hart tavern]5964-the white hart tavern at [Casterbridge]22-casterbridge]5963-a corner of the white hart tavern at casterbridge , smoking and drinking a steaming mixture from a glass . [He]144-gabriel was uneasy on [Boldwood]224-boldwood 's account , for [he]144-gabriel saw anew that this constant passion of [the farmer]3540-the farmer made [him]144-gabriel not [the man [he]144-gabriel once had been]5969-the man he once had been . As [Boldwood]224-boldwood continued awhile in [[his]224-boldwood room]5970-his room alone - ready and dressed to receive [his]224-boldwood company - the mood of anxiety about [his]224-boldwood appearance seemed to pass away , and to be succeeded by a deep solemnity . [He]144-gabriel looked out of the window , and regarded the dim outline of the trees upon the sky , and the twilight deepening to darkness . Then [he]144-gabriel went to [a locked closet]5971-a locked closet , and took from a locked drawer therein a small circular case the size of a pillbox , and was about to put it into [his]144-gabriel pocket . But [he]144-gabriel lingered to open the cover and take a momentary glance inside . It contained [a woman]459-a woman 's finger - ring , set all the way round with small diamonds , and from its appearance had evidently been recently purchased . [Boldwood]224-boldwood 's eyes dwelt upon its many sparkles a long time , though that its material aspect concerned [him]224-boldwood little was plain from [his]224-boldwood manner and mien , which were those of a mind following out the presumed thread of that jewel 's future history . The noise of wheels at the front of [the house]552-the house became audible . [Boldwood]224-boldwood closed the box , stowed it away carefully in [his]144-gabriel pocket , and went out upon [the landing]2873-the landing . " CHAPTER LIII CONCURRITUR - HORAE MOMENTO OUTSIDE the front of [[Boldwood]224-boldwood 's house]5983-boldwood 's house [a group of [men]474-men]5984-a group of men stood in the dark , with [their]5984-a group of men faces towards the door , which occasionally opened and closed for the passage of [some guest or servant]5986-some guest or servant , when a golden rod of light would stripe the ground for the moment and vanish again , leaving nothing outside but the glowworm shine of the pale lamp amid the evergreens over the door . "[537-master] And [I]0-i 'm in- clined to think [we]3151-we 'd better keep quiet . If so be ' tis not true , ' twill flurry [her]3152-her , and do [her]3152-her much harm to repeat it ; and if so be ' tis true , ' twill do no good to forestall [her]3152-her time o ' trouble . " "[537-master] [She]3152-her never do tell [women]493-women 's little lies , that 's true ; and ' tis a thing that can be said of [very few]3156-very few . Ay , all the harm [she]3152-her thinks [she]3152-her says to [yer]3157-yer face : there 's nothing underhand wi ' [her]3152-her . " [They]5993-they stood silent then , [every man]2140-every man busied with [his]2140-every man own thoughts , during which interval sounds of [merri- ment]5995-merri- ment could be heard within . Then the front door again opened , the rays streamed out , the wellknown form of [Boldwood]224-boldwood was seen in the rectangular area of light , the door closed , and [Boldwood]224-boldwood walked slowly down [the path]3518-the path . "[224-boldwood] ' Tis [master]537-master . " [one of [the men]3799-the men]2452-one of the men whispered , as [he]2452-one of the men neared [them]3799-the men . "[2452-one of the men] [We]3159-we 'd better stand quiet - [he]537-master 'll go in again directly . [He]537-master would think it unseemly o ' [us]3159-we to be loitering [here]575-here . [Boldwood]224-boldwood came on , and passed by [the men]3799-the men without seeing [them]3799-the men , [they]3799-the men being under the bushes on the grass . [He]224-boldwood paused , leant over the gate , and breathed a long breath . [They]3799-the men heard low words come from [him]224-boldwood . " [I]2452-one of the men hope to [God]171-god [she]5999-she 'll come , or this night will be nothing but misery to [me]2452-one of the men ! O [[my]2452-one of the men darling]6000-my darling , [[my]2452-one of the men darling]6000-my darling , why do [you]3799-the men keep [me]2452-one of the men in suspense like this ? "[2452-one of the men] [He]224-boldwood said this to [himself]224-boldwood , and [they]3799-the men all distinctly heard it . [Boldwood]224-boldwood remained silent after that , and the noise from indoors was again just audible , until , a few minutes later , light wheels could be distinguished coming down [the hill]3452-the hill . [They]3799-the men drew nearer , and ceased at the gate . [Boldwood]224-boldwood hastened back to the door , and opened it ; and the light shone upon [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba coming up [the path]3518-the path . [Boldwood]224-boldwood compressed [his]224-boldwood emotion to mere welcome : [the men]3799-the men marked [her]3165-her light laugh and apology as [she]3165-her met [him]224-boldwood : [he]224-boldwood took [her]3165-her into [the house]552-the house ; and the door closed again . " [Gracious heaven]6002-gracious heaven , [I]0-i did n't know it was like that with [him]537-master ! "[0-i] said [one of [the men]3799-the men]2452-one of the men . " [I]0-i thought that fancy of [his]537-master was over long ago . "[0-i] [You]3169-you do n't know much of [master]537-master , if [you]3169-you thought that . " said [Samway]401-samway . "[3171-we] [I]0-i would n't [he]537-master should know [we]3171-we heard what ' a said for [the world]447-the world . " remarked [a third]751-a third . "[3179-hist] [I]0-i wish [we]3171-we had told of the report at once . " [the first]4138-the first uneasily continued . "[3179-hist] More harm may come of this than [we]3171-we know of . [Poor Mr. Boldwood]224-boldwood , it will , be hard upon [en]3173-en . [I]0-i wish [Troy]243-bathsheba was in - - Well , [God]171-god forgive [me]0-i for such a wish ! [A scoundrel]3174-a scoundrel to play [a poor wife]3175-a poor wife such tricks . Nothing has prospered in [Weatherbury]196-joseph since [he]243-bathsheba came [here]575-here . And now [I]0-i 've no heart to go in . Let 's look into [[Warren]185-warren 's]3177-warren 's for a few minutes first , shall [us]3171-we , [neighbours]776-neighbours ? " [Samway]401-samway , [Tall]213-laban , and [Smallbury]176-billy smallbury agreed to go to [Warren 's]185-warren , and went out at the gate , [the remaining ones]3974-the remaining ones entering [the house]552-the house . [The three]6007-the three soon drew near [the malt - house]6008-the malt - house , approaching [it]6008-the malt - house from [the adjoining orchard]6009-the adjoining orchard , and not by way of [the street]3706-the street . The pane of glass was illuminated as usual . [Smallbury]176-billy smallbury was a little in advance of the rest when , pausing , [he]176-billy smallbury turned suddenly to [[his]176-billy smallbury companions]6011-his companions and said , "[3179-hist] [Hist]3179-hist ! See there . " The light from the pane was now perceived to be shining not upon the ivied wall as usual , but upon some object close to the glass . It was a human face . "[3181-he] Let 's come closer . " whispered [Samway]401-samway ; and [they]6007-the three approached on tiptoe . There was no disbelieving the report any longer . [Troy]243-bathsheba 's face was almost close to the pane , and [he]243-bathsheba was looking in . Not only was [he]243-bathsheba looking in , but [he]243-bathsheba appeared to have been arrested by a conversation which was in progress in [the malt - house]6008-the malt - house , the voices of [the interlocutors]6013-the interlocutors being those of [Oak]144-gabriel and [the maltster]3839-the maltster . "[3181-he] The spree is all in [her]3180-her honour , is n't it - hey ? " said [the old man]6015-the old man . "[3181-he] Although [he]3181-he made believe ' tis only keeping up o ' Christmas ? " "[3180-her] [I]0-i can not say . " replied [Oak]144-gabriel . "[3181-he] O ' tis true enough , faith . [I]0-i can not understand [Farmer Boldwood]231-boldwood being such a fool at [his]231-boldwood time of life as to ho and hanker after [[thik]3182-thik woman]3183-thik woman in the way ' a do , and [she]3180-her not care a bit about en . " [The men]3799-the men , after recognizing [Troy]243-bathsheba 's features , withdrew across [the orchard]6017-the orchard as quietly as [they]3799-the men had come . The air was big with [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's fortunes to - night : every word everywhere concerned [her]3180-her . When [they]3799-the men were quite out of earshot all by one instinct paused . "[3181-he] It gave [me]0-i quite a turn - [his]3181-he face . " said [Tall]213-laban , breathing . "[0-i] And so it did [me]0-i . " said [Samway]401-samway . "[0-i] What 's to be done ? " "[401-samway] [I]0-i do n't see that ' tis any business of [ours]3184-we . " [Smallbury]176-billy smallbury murmured dubiously . "[213-laban] But it is ! ' Tis a thing which is [everybody]954-everybody 's business , said [Samway]401-samway . " [We]3184-we know very well that [master]537-master 's on a wrong tack , and that [she]537-master 's quite in the dark , and [we]3184-we should let ['em]3184-we know at once . " ' Tis a ticklish business altogether . Why , [he]176-billy smallbury 'll go on to [her]537-master [himself]176-billy smallbury in a few minutes , [ye'll]213-laban see . "[403-tall reluct- antly] " Very well , if [I]213-laban must [I]213-laban must , [I]213-laban suppose . "[213-laban] [Tall reluct- antly]403-tall reluct- antly answered . " What must [I]213-laban say ? "[213-laban] " Just ask to see [master]537-master . "[401-samway] " O no ; [I]176-billy smallbury sha n't speak to [Mr. Boldwood]224-boldwood . [Laban]213-laban then went to the door . When [he]213-laban opened it the hum of bustle rolled out as a wave upon a still strand - the assemblage being immediately inside [the hall]4051-the hall - and was deadened to a murmur as [he]213-laban closed it again . [Each man]3187-each man waited intently , and looked around at the dark tree tops gently rocking against the sky and occasionally shivering in a slight wind , as if [he]213-laban took interest in the scene , which neither did . [One of [them]3187-each man]5987-one of them began walking up and down , and then came to where [he]5987-one of them started from and stopped again , with a sense that walking was thing not worth doing now . " [I]2457-both should think [Laban]213-laban must have seen [mistress]996-mistress by this time . "[2457-both] said [Smallbury]176-billy smallbury , breaking the silence . " Per- haps [she]996-mistress wo n't come and speak to [him]213-laban . "[213-laban] The door opened . [Tall]213-laban appeared , and joined [them]3187-each man " Well ? "[213-laban] said [both]2457-both . " [I]401-samway did n't like to ask for [her]996-mistress after all . "[401-samway] [Laban]213-laban faltered out . " [They]3799-the men were all in such a stir , trying to put a little spirit into the party . Somehow the fun seems to hang fire , though everything 's there that a heart can desire , and [I]401-samway could n't for [my]401-samway soul interfere and throw damp upon it - if ' twas to save [my]401-samway life , [I]401-samway could n't ! "[401-samway] " [I]3201-the master of the house suppose [we]3187-each man had better all go in together . "[3201-the master of the house] said [Samway]401-samway , gloomily . " Perhaps [I]3201-the master of the house may have a chance of saying a word to [master]537-master . "[3201-the master of the house] So [the men]3799-the men entered [the hall]4051-the hall , which was [the room]4025-the room selected and arranged for the gathering because of [its]4051-the hall size . [The younger men]3193-the younger men and [maids]3194-maids were at last just beginning to dance . [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba had been perplexed how to act , for [she]3195-she was not much more than [a slim young maid]3196-a slim young maid [herself]3195-she , and the weight of stateliness sat heavy upon [her]3195-she . Sometimes [she]3195-she thought [she]3195-she ought not to have come under any circumstances ; then [she]3195-she considered what cold unkindness that would have been , and finally resolved upon the middle course of staying for about an hour only , and gliding off unobserved , having from the first made up [her]3195-she mind that [she]3195-she could on no account dance , sing , or take any active part in the proceedings . [Her]3195-she allotted hour having been passed in chatting and looking on , [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba told [Liddy]191-liddy not to hurry [her-]191-liddy self , and went to [the small parlour]3197-the small parlour to prepare for departure , which , like [the hall]4051-the hall , was decorated with holly and ivy , and well lighted up . [Nobody]439-nobody was in [the room]4025-the room , but [she]3195-she had hardly been there a moment when [the master of the house]3201-the master of the house entered . " [Mrs. Troy]353-troy - [you]3195-she are not going ? "[3195-she] [he]3201-the master of the house said . " [We]6025-we 've hardly begun ! "[3195-she] " If [you]3201-the master of the house 'll excuse [me]3195-she , [I]3195-she should like to go now . "[3195-she] [Her]3195-she manner was restive , for [she]3195-she remembered [her]3195-she promise , and imagined what [he]3201-the master of the house was about to say . " But as it is not late . "[224-boldwood] [she]3195-she added , " [I]224-boldwood can walk [home]556-home , and leave [[my]224-boldwood man]6027-my man and [Liddy]191-liddy to come when [they]6028-they choose . "[224-boldwood] " [I]224-boldwood 've been trying to get an opportunity of speaking to [you]243-bathsheba . "[224-boldwood] said [Boldwood]224-boldwood . " [You]243-bathsheba know perhaps what [I]3195-she long to say ? "[3195-she] [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba silently looked on the floor . " [You]243-bathsheba do give it ? "[3195-she] [he]224-boldwood said , eagerly . " What ? "[224-boldwood] [she]3195-she whispered . " Now , that 's evasion ! Why , the promise . [I]243-bathsheba do n't want to intrude upon [you]243-bathsheba at all , or to let it become known to [anybody]3643-anybody . But do give [your]243-bathsheba word ! A mere business compact , [you]243-bathsheba know , between [two people who are beyond the influence of passion]6030-two people who are beyond the influence of passion . "[243-bathsheba] [Boldwood]224-boldwood knew how false this picture was as regarded [himself]224-boldwood ; but [he]224-boldwood had proved that it was the only tone in which [she]3195-she would allow [him]224-boldwood to approach [her]3195-she . " A promise to marry [me]243-bathsheba at the end of five years and three - quarters . [You]243-bathsheba owe it to [me]243-bathsheba ! "[243-bathsheba] " [I]0-i feel that [I]0-i do . "[0-i] said [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba ; " that is , if [you]224-boldwood demand it . But [I]0-i am [a changed woman]6031-a changed woman - [an unhappy woman]6032-an unhappy woman - and not - not - - "[0-i] " [You]0-i are still [a very beautiful woman]6033-a very beautiful woman , said [Boldwood]224-boldwood . Honesty and pure conviction suggested the remark , unaccompanied by any perception that it might have been adopted by blunt flattery to soothe and win [her]0-i . However , it had not much effect now , for for [she]0-i said , in a passionless murmur which was in itself a proof of [her]0-i words : "[0-i] [I]0-i have no feeling in the matter at all . And [I]0-i do n't at all know what is right to do in [my]0-i diddicult position , and [I]0-i have [nobody]439-nobody to advise [me]0-i . But [I]0-i give [my]0-i promise , if [I]0-i must . [I]0-i give it as the rendering of a debt , conditionally , of course , on [my]0-i being [a widow]2982-a widow . " "[0-i] [You]0-i 'll marry [me]0-i between five and six years hence ? " "[0-i] Do n't press [me]0-i too hard . [I]0-i 'll marry [nobody else]4319-nobody else . " "[0-i] But surely [you]0-i will name the time , or there 's nothing in the promise at all ? " O , [I]3205-i do n't know , pray let [me]3205-i go ! "[3205-i] [she]0-i said , [her]0-i bosom beginning to rise . " [I]3206-she am afraid what to do ! want to be just to [you]3205-i , and to be that seems to be wrong- ing [myself]3206-she , and perhaps it is breaking the commandments . There is considerable doubt of [his]3205-i death , and then it is dreadful ; let [me]3206-she ask [a solicitor]6034-a solicitor , [Mr. Boldwood]224-boldwood , if [I]3206-she ought or no ! "[3206-she] " Say the words , [dear one]6035-dear one , and the subject shall be dismissed ; a blissful loving intimacy of six years , and then marriage - O [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba , say them ! "[3207-you] [he]3205-i begged in a husky voice , unable to sustain the forms of mere friendship any longer . " Promise [yourself]243-bathsheba to [me]0-i ; [I]0-i deserve it , indeed [I]0-i do , for [I]0-i have loved [you]243-bathsheba more than anybody in [the world]447-the world ! And if [I]0-i said hasty words and showed uncalled - for heat of manner towards [you]243-bathsheba , believe [me]0-i , [dear]1008-dear , [I]0-i did not mean to distress [you]243-bathsheba ; [I]0-i was in agony , [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba , and [I]0-i did not know what [I]0-i said . [You]243-bathsheba would n't let a dog suffer what [I]0-i have suffered , could [you]243-bathsheba but know it ! Sometimes [I]0-i shrink from [your]243-bathsheba knowing what [I]0-i have felt for [you]243-bathsheba , and sometimes [I]0-i am distressed that all of it [you]243-bathsheba never will know . Be gracious , and give up a little to [me]0-i , when [I]0-i would give up [my]0-i life for [you]243-bathsheba ! "[0-i] The trimmings of [her]3206-she dress , as they quivered against the light , showed how agitated [she]3206-she was , and at last [she]3206-she burst out crying . ' And [you]3207-you 'll not - press [me]0-i - about anything more - if [I]0-i say in five or six years ? " [she]3206-she sobbed , when [she]3206-she had power to frame the words . "[0-i] Yes , then [I]0-i 'll leave it to time . " "[3207-you] Very well . If [he]3208-he does not return , [I]0-i 'll marry [you]3207-you in six years from this day , if [we]3209-we both live . " [she]3206-she said solemnly . "[0-i] And [you]3207-you 'll take this as a token from [me]0-i . " [Boldwood]224-boldwood had come close to [her]3206-she side , and now [he]224-boldwood clasped one of [her]3206-she hands in both [his]224-boldwood own , and lifted it to [his]224-boldwood breast . "[224-boldwood] What is it ? Oh [I]0-i can not wear a ring ! " [she]0-i ex- claimed , on seeing what [he]224-boldwood held ; "[224-boldwood] besides , [I]0-i would n't have [a soul]3210-a soul know that it 's an engagement ! Perhaps it is improper ? Besides , [we]3209-we are not engaged in the usual sense , are [we]3209-we ? Do n't insist , [Mr. Boldwood]224-boldwood - do n't ! " In [her]0-i trouble at not being able to get [her]0-i hand away from [him]224-boldwood at once , [she]0-i stamped passionately on the floor with one foot , and tears crowded to [her]0-i eyes again . "[224-boldwood] It means simply a pledge - no sentiment - the seal of a practical compact . " [he]224-boldwood said more quietly , but still retaining [her]0-i hand in [his]224-boldwood firm grasp . "[224-boldwood] Come , now ! " And [Boldwood]224-boldwood slipped the ring on [her]0-i finger . "[0-i] [I]0-i can not wear it . " [she]0-i said , weeping as if [her]0-i heart would break . "[0-i] [You]0-i frighten [me]0-i , almost . So wild a scheme ! Please let [me]0-i go [home]556-home ! " "[0-i] Only to - night : wear it just to - night , to please [me]0-i ! " [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba sat down in a chair , and buried [her]0-i face in [her]0-i handkerchief , though [Boldwood]224-boldwood kept [her]0-i hand yet . At length [she]0-i said , in a sort of hopeless whisper - "[0-i] Very well , then , [I]0-i will to - night , if [you]0-i wish it so earnestly . Now loosen [my]0-i hand ; [I]0-i will , indeed [I]0-i will wear it to - night . " "[0-i] And it shall be the beginning of a pleasant secret courtship of six years , with a wedding at the end ? " "[0-i] It must be , [I]0-i suppose , since [you]0-i will have it so ! " [she]0-i said , fairly beaten into non - resistance . [Boldwood]224-boldwood pressed [her]0-i hand , and allowed it to drop in [her]0-i lap . "[0-i] [I]0-i am happy now . " [he]224-boldwood said . "[3212-their] God bless [you]0-i ! " [He]224-boldwood left [the room]4025-the room , and when [he]224-boldwood thought [she]0-i might be sufficiently composed sent [one of [the maids]6040-the maids]6039-one of the maids to [her]0-i Bathsheba cloaked the effects of the late scene as [she]0-i best could , followed [the girl]462-the girl , and in a few moments came [downstairs]1015-downstairs with [her]462-the girl hat and cloak on , ready to go . To get to the door it was necessary to pass through [the hall]4051-the hall , and before doing so [she]462-the girl paused on the bottom of the staircase which descended into one corner , to take a last look at the gathering . There was no music or dancing in progress just now . At the lower end , which had been arranged for the work- [folk]3076-folk specially , [a group conversed in whispers , and with clouded looks]6045-a group conversed in whispers , and with clouded looks . [Boldwood]224-boldwood was standing by the fireplace , and [he]224-boldwood , too , though so absorbed in visions arising from [her]462-the girl promise that [he]224-boldwood scarcely saw anything , seemed at that moment to have observed [their]3212-their peculiar manner , and [their]3212-their looks askance . "[213-laban] What is it [you]3212-their are in doubt about , [men]474-men ? " [he]224-boldwood said . [Anybody married or engaged , born or dead]3215-anybody married or engaged , born or dead ? " inquired [the farmer]3540-the farmer , gaily . "[4328-one] Tell it to [us]474-men , [Tall]213-laban .
