" said [Tall]213-laban . "[0-i] [I]0-i wish [somebody]3576-somebody was . " said [Samway]401-samway , in a whisper . "[353-troy] What do [you]0-i say , [Samway]401-samway ? " asked [Boldwood]224-boldwood , some- what sharply . "[353-troy] If [you]0-i have anything to say , speak out ; if not , get up another dance . " "[3221-they] [Mrs. Troy]353-troy has come [downstairs]1015-downstairs . " said [Samway]401-samway to [Tall]213-laban . "[0-i] If [you]0-i want to tell [her]353-troy , [you]0-i had better do it now . " "[0-i] Do [you]0-i know what [they]3221-they mean ? " [the farmer]3540-the farmer asked [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba , across [the room]4025-the room . "[353-troy] [I]0-i do n't in the least , " said [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba . There was a smart rapping at the door . [One of [the men]3799-the men]2452-one of the men opened it instantly , and went outside . "[353-troy] [Mrs. Troy]353-troy is wanted . " [he]2452-one of the men said , on returning . "[3222-him] Quite ready . " said [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba . "[718-a stranger] Though [I]0-i did n't tell [them]3221-they to send . " "[3222-him] [It]3222-him is [a stranger]718-a stranger , [ma'am]712-ma'am . " said [the man by the door]6052-the man by the door . "[3222-him] [A stranger]718-a stranger ? " [she]0-i said . "[3222-him] Ask [him]3222-him to come in . " said [Boldwood]224-boldwood . The message was given , and [Troy]353-troy , wrapped up to [his]3222-him eyes as [we]6053-we have seen [him]3222-him , stood in the doorway . There was an unearthly silence , all looking towards [the newcomer]5495-the newcomer . [Those who had just learnt that [he]3222-him was in [the neighbourhood]615-the neighbourhood]6055-those who had just learnt that he was in the neighbourhood recognized [him]3222-him instantly ; [those who did not]6057-those who did not were perplexed . [Nobody]439-nobody noted [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba . [She]0-i was leaning on the stairs . [Her]0-i brow had heavily contracted ; [her]0-i whole face was pallid , [her]0-i lips apart , [her]0-i eyes rigidly staring at [[their]3226-their visitor]6059-their visitor . [Boldwood]224-boldwood was among those who did not notice that [he]224-boldwood was [Troy]353-troy . "[243-bathsheba] Come in , come in ! " [he]224-boldwood repeated , cheerfully , "[0-i] and drain a Christmas beaker with [us]3226-their , [stranger]3227-stranger ! " [Troy]353-troy next advanced into the middle of [the room]4025-the room , took off [his]3222-him cap , turned down [his]3222-him coat - collar , and looked [Boldwood]224-boldwood in the face . Even then [Boldwood]224-boldwood did not recognize that [the impersonator of [Heaven]269-heaven]6061-the impersonator of heaven 's persistent irony towards [him]3222-him , who had once before broken in upon [his]3222-him bliss , scourged [him]3222-him , and snatched [his]3222-him delight away , had come to do these things a second time . [Troy]353-troy began to laugh a mechanical laugh : [Boldwood]224-boldwood recognized [him]3222-him now . [Troy]353-troy turned to [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba . [The poor girl]969-the poor girl 's wretched- ness at this time was beyond all fancy or narration . [She]969-the poor girl had sunk down on the lowest stair ; and there [she]969-the poor girl sat , [her]969-the poor girl mouth blue and dry , and [her]969-the poor girl dark eyes fixed vacantly upon [him]3222-him , as if [she]969-the poor girl wondered whether it were not all a terrible illusion . Then [Troy]353-troy spoke . "[3229-his] [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba , [I]0-i come here for [you]243-bathsheba ! " [She]969-the poor girl made no reply . "[3229-his] Come [home]556-home with [me]0-i : come ! [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba moved [her]0-i feet a little , but did not rise . [Troy]353-troy went across to [her]0-i . " Come , [madam]1568-madam , do [you]0-i hear what [I]224-boldwood say ? "[224-boldwood] [he]3229-his said , peremptorily . A strange voice came from the fireplace - a voice sounding far off and confined , as if from [a dungeon]3230-a dungeon . [Hardly a soul in the assembly]3231-hardly a soul in the assembly recognized the thin tones to be those of [Boldwood]224-boldwood . Sudden dispaire had trans- formed [him]3229-his . " [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba , go with [[your]243-bathsheba husband]5516-your husband ! "[224-boldwood] Nevertheless , [she]0-i did not move . The truth was that [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba was beyond the pale of activity - and yet not in a swoon . [She]0-i was in a state of mental [GUTTA SERENA]404-gutta serena ; [her]0-i mind was for the minute totally deprived of light at the same time no obscuration was apparent from without . [Troy]353-troy stretched out [his]3229-his hand to pull [her]0-i [her]0-i towards [him]3229-his , when [she]0-i quickly shrank back . This visible dread of [him]3229-his seemed to irritate [Troy]353-troy , and [he]3229-his seized [her]0-i arm and pulled it sharply . Whether [his]3229-his grasp pinched [her]0-i , or whether [his]3229-his mere touch was the 'cause , was never known , but at the moment of [his]3229-his seizure [she]0-i writhed , and gave a quick , low scream . The scream had been heard but a few seconds When it was followed by sudden deafening report that echoed through [the room]4025-the room and stupefied [them]3233-them all . The oak partition shook with the concussion , and [the place]3486-the place was filled with grey smoke . In bewilderment [they]3233-them turned [their]3233-them eyes to [Boldwood]224-boldwood . at [his]224-boldwood back , as stood before the fireplace , was a gun- rack , as is usual in [farmhouses]3235-farmhouses , constructed to hold two guns . When [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba had cried out in [[her]0-i husband]2239-her husband 's grasp , [Boldwood]224-boldwood 's face of gnashing despair had changed . The veins had swollen , and a frenzied look had gleamed in [his]224-boldwood eye . [He]224-boldwood had turned quickly , taken one of the guns , cocked it , and at once discharged it at [Troy]243-bathsheba . [Troy]243-bathsheba fell . The distance apart of [the two men]2095-the two men was so small that the charge of shot did not spread in the least , but passed like a bullet into [his]3229-his body . [He]3229-his uttered a long guttural sigh - there was a contraction - an exten- sion - then [his]3229-his muscles relaxed , and [he]3229-his lay still . [Boldwood]224-boldwood was seen through the smoke to be now again engaged with the gun . [It]3238-it was double - barrelled , and [he]224-boldwood had , meanwhile , in some way fastened [his]224-boldwood hand- kerchief to the trigger , and with [his]224-boldwood foot on the other end was in the act of turning the second barrel upon [himself]224-boldwood . [Samway]401-samway [[his]401-samway man]3239-his man was [the first to see this]3240-the first to see this , and in the midst of the general horror darted up to [him]224-boldwood . [Boldwood]224-boldwood had already twitched the handkerchief , and the gun exploded a second time , sending its contents , by a timely blow from [Samway]401-samway , into the beam which crossed the ceiling . " Well , it makes no difference ! "[4301-his wife] [Boldwood]224-boldwood gasped . " There is another way for [me]4301-his wife to die . "[4301-his wife] Then [he]224-boldwood broke from [Samway]401-samway , crossed [the room]4025-the room to [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba , and kissed [her]3242-her hand . [He]224-boldwood put on [his]224-boldwood hat , opened the door , and went into the darkness , nobody thinking of preventing [him]224-boldwood . CHAPTER LIV AFTER [THE SHOCK BOLDWOOD]405-the shock boldwood passed into [the high road]5656-the high road and turned in the direction of [Casterbridge]22-casterbridge . Here [he]224-boldwood walked at an even , steady pace over [Yalbury Hill]21-yalbury hill , along [the dead level beyond]3244-the dead level beyond , mounted [Mellstock Hill]103-mellstock hill , and between eleven and twelve o'clock crossed [the Moor]133-the moor into [the town]3722-the town . [The streets]3246-the streets were nearly deserted now , and the waving lamp - flames only lighted up rows of grey shop - shutters , and strips of white paving upon which [his]224-boldwood step echoed as [his]224-boldwood passed along . [He]224-boldwood turned to the right , and halted before an archway of heavy stonework , which was closed by an iron studded pair of doors . This was the entrance to [the gaol]3247-the gaol , and over [it]3248-it a lamp was fixed , the light en- abling [the wretched traveller]3249-the wretched traveller to find a bellpull . [The small wicket]3250-the small wicket at last opened , and [a porter]3251-a porter appeared . [Boldwood]224-boldwood stepped forward , and said some- thing in a low tone , when , after a delay , [another man]4200-another man came . [Boldwood]224-boldwood entered , and the door was closed behind [him]224-boldwood , and [he]224-boldwood walked [the world]447-the world no more . Long before this time [Weatherbury]196-joseph had been thoroughly aroused , and the wild deed which had ter- minated [Boldwood]224-boldwood 's merrymaking became known to [all]820-all . Of those out of [the house]552-the house [Oak]144-gabriel was one of [the first to hear of the catastrophe]3256-the first to hear of the catastrophe , and when [he]144-gabriel entered [the room]4025-the room , which was about five minutes after [Boldwood]224-boldwood 's exit , the scene was terrible . [All the female guests]3258-all the female guests were huddled aghast against the walls like sheep in a storm , and [the men]3799-the men were bewildered as to what to do . As for [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba , [she]3260-she had changed . [She]3260-she was sitting on the floor beside the body of [Troy]243-bathsheba , [his]243-bathsheba head pillowed in [her]3260-she lap , where [she]3260-she had [herself]3260-she lifted it . With one hand [she]3260-she held [her]3260-she handkerchief to [his]243-bathsheba breast and covered the wound , though scarcely a single drop of blood had flowed , and with the other [she]3260-she tightly clasped one of [his]243-bathsheba . The household convulsion had made [her]3260-she [herself]3260-she again . The temporary coma had ceased , and activity had come with the necessity for it . Deeds of endur- ance , which seem ordinary in philosophy , are rare in conduct , and [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba was astonishing all around [her]3260-she now , for [her]3260-she philosophy was [her]3260-she conduct , and [she]3260-she seldom thought practicable what [she]3260-she did not practise . [She]3260-she was of the stuff of which [[great men]3261-great men 's mothers]3262-great men 's mothers are made . [She]3260-she was indispensable to [high generation]3263-high generation , hated at tea parties , feared in [shops]3264-shops , and loved at crises . [Troy]243-bathsheba recumbent in [[his]243-bathsheba wife]4301-his wife 's lap formed now the sole spectacle in the middle of [the spacious room]3266-the spacious room . " [Gabriel]144-gabriel . "[3288-his informant] [she]4301-his wife said , automatically , when [he]243-bathsheba entered , turning up a face of which only the wellknown lines remained to tell [him]243-bathsheba it was [hers]4301-his wife , all else in the picture having faded quite . " Ride to [Casterbridge]22-casterbridge instantly for [a surgeon]6065-a surgeon . It is , [I]842-the doctor believe , useless , but go . [Mr. Boldwood]224-boldwood has shot [[my]842-the doctor husband]5222-my husband . "[842-the doctor] [Her]4301-his wife statement of the fact in such quiet and simple words came with more force than a tragic declamation , and had somewhat the effect of setting the distorted images in each mind present into proper focus . [Oak]144-gabriel , almost before [he]144-gabriel had comprehended anything beyond the briefest abstract of the event , hurried out of [the room]4025-the room , saddled a horse and rode away . Not till [he]144-gabriel had ridden more than a mile did it occur to [him]144-gabriel that [he]144-gabriel would have done better by sending [some other man]3268-some other man on this errand , remaining [himself]144-gabriel in [the house]552-the house . What had become of [Boldwood]224-boldwood ? [He]224-boldwood should have been looked after . Was [he]224-boldwood mad - had there been a quarrel ? Then how had [Troy]243-bathsheba got [there]3509-there ? Where had [he]243-bathsheba come from ? How did this remarkable reappearance effect itself when [he]243-bathsheba was supposed by [many]4313-many to be at [the bottom of [the sea]2462-the sea]3272-the bottom of the sea ? [Oak]144-gabriel had in some slight measure been prepared for the presence of [Troy]243-bathsheba by hearing a rumour of [his]243-bathsheba return just before entering [[Boldwood]224-boldwood 's house]5983-boldwood 's house ; but before [he]144-gabriel had weighed that information , this fatal event had been superimposed . However , it was too late now to think of sending [another messenger]3275-another messenger , and [he]144-gabriel rode on , in the excitement of these self - inquiries not discerning , when about three miles from [Caster- bridge]34-caster- bridge , [a square - figured pedestrian passing along under the dark hedge]3276-a square - figured pedestrian passing along under the dark hedge in the same direction as [his]144-gabriel own . The miles necessary to be traversed , and other hindrances incidental to the lateness of the hour and the darkness of the night , delayed the arrival of [Mr , Aldritch]406-mr. aldritch , [the surgeon]3277-the surgeon ; and more than three hours passed between the time at which the shot was fired and that of [his]144-gabriel entering [the house]552-the house . [Oak]144-gabriel was [addition- ally detained in [Casterbridge]22-casterbridge]3279-addition- ally detained in casterbridge through having to give notice to [the authorities]3280-the authorities of what had happened ; and [he]144-gabriel then found that [Boldwood]224-boldwood had also entered [the town]3722-the town , and delivered [himself]144-gabriel up . In the meantime [the surgeon]3277-the surgeon , having hastened into [the hall]4051-the hall at [[Boldwood]224-boldwood 's]3284-boldwood 's , found [it]4051-the hall in darkness and quite deserted . [He]3277-the surgeon went on to the back of [the house]552-the house , where [he]3277-the surgeon discovered in [the kitchen]4050-the kitchen [an old man]3287-an old man , of whom [he]3277-the surgeon made inquiries . " [She]3287-an old man 's had [him]3287-an old man took away to [[her]3287-an old man own house]1787-her own house , [sir]3717-sir , "[842-the doctor] said [[his]3277-the surgeon informant]3288-his informant . Everything around was quite orderly . [The doctor]842-the doctor went in , and after a few minutes returned to [the landing]2873-the landing again , where [Oak]144-gabriel and [the parson]2007-the parson still waited . " It is all done , indeed , as [she]191-liddy says . "[191-liddy] remarked [Mr. Aldritch]406-mr. aldritch , in a subdued voice . " The body has been undressed and properly laid out in grave clothes . [Gracious Heaven]269-heaven - [this mere girl]6087-this mere girl ! [She]6087-this mere girl must have the nerve of [a stoic]6088-a stoic ! "[191-liddy] " The heart of [a wife]450-a wife merely . "[3315-we] floated in a whisper about the ears of [the three]6007-the three , and turning [they]3304-they saw [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba in the midst of [them]3304-they . Then , as if at that instant to prove that [her]191-liddy fortitude had been more of will than of spontaneity , [she]191-liddy silently sank down between [them]3304-they and was a shapeless heap of drapery on the floor . The simple consciousness that superhuman strain was no longer required had at once put a period to [her]191-liddy power to continue it . [They]3304-they took [her]191-liddy away into [a further room]3310-a further room , and the medical attendance which had been useless in [Troy]243-bathsheba 's case was invaluable in [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's , who fell into a series of fainting - fits that had a serious aspect for a time . [The sufferer]3311-the sufferer was got to bed , and [Oak]144-gabriel , finding from the bulletins that nothing really dreadful was to be apprehended on [her]191-liddy score , left [the house]552-the house . [Liddy]191-liddy kept watch in [[Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's chamber]3313-bathsheba 's chamber , where [she]191-liddy heard [[her]191-liddy mistress]4024-her mistress , moaning in whispers through the dull slow hours of that wretched night : " O it is [my]180-coggan fault - how can [I]180-coggan live ! O Heaven , how can [I]180-coggan live ! "[180-coggan] CHAPTER LV THE MARCH FOLLOWING - " [BATHSHEBA BOLDWOOD]224-boldwood "[180-coggan] [WE]3315-we pass rapidly on into the month of March , to a breezy day without sunshine , frost , or dew . On [Yai]135-yai - bury Hill , about midway between [Weatherbury]196-joseph and [Casterbridge]22-casterbridge , where [the turnpike road]2228-the turnpike road passes over the crest , [a numerous concourse of [people]3461-people]3317-a numerous concourse of people had gathered , the eyes of the greater number being fre- quently stretched afar in a northerly direction . [The groups]3319-the groups consisted of [a throng of idlers]3320-a throng of idlers , a party of [javelin - men]3321-javelin - men , and [two trumpeters]3322-two trumpeters , and in the midst were [carriages]3323-carriages , one of which contained [the high sheriff]3324-the high sheriff . With [the idlers]3325-the idlers , [many of whom had mounted to the top of a cutting formed for [the road]477-the road]3326-many of whom had mounted to the top of a cutting formed for the road , were [several Weatherbury men]3328-several weatherbury men and [boys]3329-boys - among others [Poorgrass]196-joseph , [Coggan]180-coggan , and [Cain Ball]235-cain . At the end of half - an - hour a faint dust was seen in [the expected quarter]3330-the expected quarter , and shortly after [a travelling- carriage]3331-a travelling- carriage , bringing [one of [the two judges on the Western Circuit]3333-the two judges on the western circuit]3332-one of the two judges on the western circuit , came up [the hill]3452-the hill and halted on the top . [The judge]3335-the judge changed carriages whilst a flourish was blown by [the big - cheeked trumpeters]3336-the big - cheeked trumpeters , and a procession being formed of [the vehicles]3337-the vehicles and [javelin - men]3321-javelin - men , [they]3339-they all pro- ceeded towards [the town]3722-the town , excepting [[the Weatherbury]196-joseph men , who as soon as [they]3341-the weatherbury men , who as soon as they had seen the judge move off had seen [the judge move off]3342-the judge move off]3341-the weatherbury men , who as soon as they had seen the judge move off returned [home]556-home again to [their]3341-the weatherbury men , who as soon as they had seen the judge move off work . " [Joseph]196-joseph , [I]196-joseph seed [you]196-joseph squeezing close to [the carriage]5065-the carriage , "[196-joseph] said [Coggan]180-coggan , as [they]3339-they walked . " Did [ye]196-joseph notice [[my]196-joseph lord [judge]6092-judge]6091-my lord judge 's face ? "[196-joseph] " [I]180-coggan did . "[180-coggan] said [Poorgrass]196-joseph . " [I]0-i looked hard at [en]6092-judge , as if [I]0-i would read [his]3345-his very soul ; and there was mercy in [his]3345-his eyes - or to speak with the exact truth required of [us]3339-they at this solemn time , in the eye that was towards [me]0-i . "[0-i] " Well , [I]0-i hope for the best . "[0-i] said [Coggan]180-coggan , though bad that must be . However , [I]0-i sha n't go to the trial , and [I]0-i 'd advise the rest of [ye]3344-ye that bain't wanted to bide away . ' Twill disturb [his]3345-his mind more than anything to see [us]3339-they there staring at [him]3345-his as if [he]3345-his were a show . " "[409-justice] The very thing [I]0-i said this morning . " observed [Joseph]196-joseph , "[3346-a man who can talk like that ought to be heard] [Justice]409-justice is come to weigh [him]3345-his in the balances , " [I]3346-a man who can talk like that ought to be heard said in [my]3346-a man who can talk like that ought to be heard reflectious way , "[3346-a man who can talk like that ought to be heard] and if [he]3345-his 's found wanting , so be it unto [him]3345-his , " and [a bystander]6093-a bystander said "[3346-a man who can talk like that ought to be heard] Hear , hear , [A man who can talk like that ought to be heard]3346-a man who can talk like that ought to be heard . " But [I]4997-ladies do n't like dwelling upon it , for [my]4997-ladies few words are [my]4997-ladies few words , and not much ; though the speech of [some men]445-some men is rumoured abroad as though by nature formed for such . "[4997-ladies] " So ' tis , [Joseph]196-joseph . And now , [neighbours]776-neighbours , as [I]4997-ladies said , [every man]2140-every man bide at [home]556-home . "[4997-ladies] The resolution was adhered to ; and [all]820-all waited anxiously for the news next day . [Their]820-all suspense was diverted , however , by a discovery which was made in the afternoon , throwing more light on [Boldwood]224-boldwood 's conduct and condition than any details which had preceded it . That [he]224-boldwood had been from the time of [Greenhill Fair]26-greenhill fair until the fatal Christmas Eve in excited and unusual moods was known to [those who had been intimate with [him]224-boldwood]3348-those who had been intimate with him ; but [nobody]439-nobody imagined that there had shown in [him]224-boldwood unequivocal symptoms of the mental derange- ment which [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba and [Oak]144-gabriel , alone of all others and at different times , had momentarily suspected . In [a locked closet]5971-a locked closet was now discovered an extraordinary collection of articles . There were several sets of [ladies]4997-ladies " dresses in the piece , of sundry expensive materials ; silks and satins , poplins and velvets , all of colours which from [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's style of dress might have been judged to be [her]410-bathsheba favourites . There were two muffs , sable and ermine . Above all there was a case of jewellery , containing four heavy gold bracelets and several lockets and rings , all of fine quality and manu- facture . These things had been bought in [Bath]79-bath and [other towns]6098-other towns from time to time , and brought [home]556-home by stealth . They were all carefully packed in paper , and each package was labelled "[4997-ladies] [Bathsheba Boldwood]410-bathsheba . " a date being subjoined six years in advance in every instance . These somewhat pathetic evidences of [a mind crazed with care and love]6100-a mind crazed with care and love were the subject of discourse in [[Warren]185-warren 's malt - house]6101-warren 's malt - house when [Oak]144-gabriel entered from [Caster- bridge]6102-caster- bridge with tidings of the kiln glow shone upon [it]144-gabriel , told the tale sufficiently well . [Boldwood]224-boldwood , as [every one]3841-every one supposed [he]224-boldwood would do , had pleaded guilty , and had been sentenced to death . The conviction that [Boldwood]224-boldwood had not been morally responsible for [his]224-boldwood later acts now became general . Facts elicited previous to the trial had pointed strongly in the same direction , but they had not been of sufficient weight to lead to an order for an examination into the state of [Boldwood]224-boldwood 's mind . It was astonishing , now that a presumption of insanity was raised , how many collateral circumstances were remembered to which a condition of mental disease seemed to afford the only explanation - among others , the unprecedented neglect of [his]224-boldwood corn stacks in the previous summer . A petition was addressed to [the Home Secretary]6104-the home secretary , advancing the circumstances which appeared to justify a request for a reconsideration of the sentence . It was not "[4997-ladies] numerously signed " by [the inhabitants of [Caster-]34-caster- bridge bridge]6105-the inhabitants of caster- bridge , as is usual in such cases , for [Boldwood]224-boldwood had never made [many friends]6106-many friends over the counter . [The shops]1977-the shops thought it very natural that [a man who , by importing direct from the producer]6108-a man who , by importing direct from the producer , had daringly set aside the first great principle of provincial existence , namely that [God]171-god made [country villages]6109-country villages to supply [customers]6110-customers to [county towns]6111-county towns , should have confused ideas about [the Decalogue]6112-the decalogue . [The prompters]6113-the prompters were [a few merciful men who had perhaps too feelingly considered the facts latterly unearthed]6114-a few merciful men who had perhaps too feelingly considered the facts latterly unearthed , and the result was that evidence was taken which it was hoped might remove the crime in a moral point of view , out of the category of wilful murder , and lead it to be regarded as a sheer outcome of madness . The upshot of the petition was waited for in Weather- bury with solicitous interest . The execution had been fixed for eight o'clock on a Saturday morning about a fortnight after the sentence was passed , and up to Friday afternoon no answer had been received . At that time [Gabriel]144-gabriel came from [Casterbridge Gaol]137-casterbridge gaol , whither [he]144-gabriel had been to wish [Boldwood]224-boldwood good - bye , and turned down [a by - street]6115-a by - street to avoid [the town]3722-the town . When past [the last house]6117-the last house [he]144-gabriel heard a hammering , and lifting [his]144-gabriel bowed head [he]144-gabriel looked back for a moment . Over the chimneys [he]144-gabriel could see the upper part of [the gaol]3247-the gaol entrance , rich and glowing in the afternoon sun , and some moving figures were there . [They]6119-they were [carpenters lifting a post into a vertical position within the parapet]6120-carpenters lifting a post into a vertical position within the parapet . [He]144-gabriel with- drew [his]144-gabriel eyes quickly , and hastened on . It was dark when [he]144-gabriel reached [home]556-home , and half [the village]3754-the village was out to meet [him]144-gabriel . "[0-i] No tidings . " [Gabriel]144-gabriel said , wearily . "[0-i] And [I]0-i 'm afraid there 's no hope . [I]0-i 've been with [him]3352-he more than two hours . " "[0-i] Do [ye]0-i think [he]3352-he REALLY was out of [his]3352-he mind when [he]3352-he did it ? " said [Smallbury]191-liddy . "[996-mistress] [I]0-i ca n't honestly say that [I]0-i do . " [Oak]144-gabriel replied . "[996-mistress] How- ever , that [we]3353-we can talk of another time . Has there been any change in [mistress]996-mistress this afternoon ? " "[996-mistress] None at all . " "[0-i] Is [she]996-mistress [downstairs]1015-downstairs ? " "[0-i] No . And getting on so nicely as [she]996-mistress was too . [She]996-mistress 's but very little better now again than [she]996-mistress was at Christmas . " "[213-laban] No . " said [Oak]144-gabriel . " "[3362-they] Yes . " said [Tall]213-laban . "[3362-they] What [I]0-i 've arranged is , that [you]0-i shall ride to [town]4160-town the last thing to - night ; leave [here]575-here about nine , and wait a while there , getting [home]556-home about twelve . If nothing has been received by eleven to - night , [they]3362-they say there 's no chance at all . " "[996-mistress] [I]0-i do so hope [his]3358-him life will be spared . " said [Liddy]191-liddy . "[996-mistress] If it is not , [she]996-mistress 'll go out of [her]996-mistress mind too . Poor thing ; [her]996-mistress sufferings have been dreadful ; [she]996-mistress deserves any- body 's pity . " "[996-mistress] Is [she]996-mistress altered much ? " said [Coggan]180-coggan . "[996-mistress] [Her]996-mistress eyes are so miserable that [she]996-mistress 's not [the same woman]5237-the same woman . Only two years ago [she]996-mistress was [a romping girl]3365-a romping girl , and now [she]996-mistress 's this ! " [Laban]213-laban departed as directed , and at eleven o'clock that night [several of [the villagers]749-the villagers]6123-several of the villagers strolled along [the road]477-the road to [Casterbridge]22-casterbridge and awaited [his]213-laban arrival - among [them]6123-several of the villagers [Oak]144-gabriel , and [nearly all the rest of [[Bathsheba]410-bathsheba 's men]6127-bathsheba 's men]6126-nearly all the rest of bathsheba 's men . [Gabriel]144-gabriel 's anxiety was great that [Boldwood]410-bathsheba might be saved , even though in [his]144-gabriel conscience [he]144-gabriel felt that [he]144-gabriel ought to die ; for there had been qualities in the farmer which [Oak]144-gabriel loved . At last , when [they]3366-they all were weary the tramp of a horse was heard in the distance - First dead , as if on turf it trode , Then , clattering on [the village road]6128-the village road In other pace than forth [he]213-laban yode . "[3367-you] [We]3366-they shall soon know now , one way or other . " said [Coggan]180-coggan , and [they]3366-they all stepped down from the bank on which [they]3366-they had been standing into [the road]477-the road , and [the rider]1434-the rider pranced into the midst of [them]3366-they . "[3368-her] Is that [you]3367-you , [Laban]213-laban ? " said [Gabriel]144-gabriel . "[171-god] Yes - ' tis come . [He]213-laban 's not to die . " CHAPTER LVI BEAUTY IN [LONELINESS]138-loneliness - AFTER ALL [BATHSHEBA]410-bathsheba revived with the spring . The utter prostration that had followed the low fever from which [she]410-bathsheba had suffered diminished perceptibly when all un- certainty upon every subject had come to an end . But [she]410-bathsheba remained alone now for the greater part of [her]410-bathsheba time , and stayed in [the house]552-the house , or at furthest went into [the garden]3633-the garden . [She]410-bathsheba shunned every one , even [Liddy]191-liddy , and could be brought to make no confidences , and to ask for no sympathy . As the summer drew on [she]410-bathsheba passed more of [her]410-bathsheba time in the open air , and began to examine into farming matters from sheer necessity , though [she]410-bathsheba never rode out or personally superintended as at former times . One Friday evening in August [she]410-bathsheba walked a little way along [the road]477-the road and entered [the village]3754-the village for the first time since the sombre event of the preceding Christmas . None of the old colour had as yet come to [her]410-bathsheba cheek , and its absolute paleness was heightened by the jet black of [her]410-bathsheba gown , till it appeared preternatural . When [she]410-bathsheba reached [a little shop at the other end of [the place]3486-the place , which stood nearly opposite to [the churchyard]3813-the churchyard]6135-a little shop at the other end of the place , which stood nearly opposite to the churchyard , [Bath-]351-bath- [sheba]410-bathsheba heard singing inside [the church]489-the church , and [she]410-bathsheba knew that [the singers]6139-the singers were practising . [She]410-bathsheba crossed [the road]477-the road , opened the gate , and entered [the graveyard]1874-the graveyard , the high sills of [the church]489-the church windows effectually screening [her]410-bathsheba from the eyes of [those gathered within]6143-those gathered within . [Her]410-bathsheba stealthy walk was to [the nook wherein [Troy]351-bath- had worked at planting flowers upon [Fanny Robin]217-fanny 's grave]6144-the nook wherein troy had worked at planting flowers upon fanny robin 's grave , and [she]410-bathsheba came to the marble tombstone . A motion of satisfaction enlivened [her]410-bathsheba face as [she]410-bathsheba read the complete inscription . First came the words of [Troy]351-bath- [himself]351-bath- : - ERECTED BY [FRANCIS TROY]385-mr. francis IN BELOVED MEMORY OF [FANNY ROBIN]217-fanny , WHO DIED OCTOBER 9 , 18 - , AGED 20 YEARS . Underneath this was now inscribed in new letters : - IN [THE SAME GRAVE]6145-the same grave LIE THE REMAINS OF THE AFORESAID [FRANCIS TROY]244-frank , WHO DIED DECEMBER 24TH , 18 - , Whilst [she]410-bathsheba stood and read and meditated the tones of the organ began again in [the church]489-the church , and [she]410-bathsheba went with the same light step round to [the porch]4287-the porch and listened . The door was closed , and [the choir]6148-the choir was learning a new hymn . [Bathsheba]410-bathsheba was stirred by emotions which latterly [she]410-bathsheba had assumed to be altogether dead within [her]410-bathsheba . [The little attenuated voices of [the children]1098-the children]6149-the little attenuated voices of the children brought to [her]410-bathsheba ear in destinct utterance the words [they]1098-the children sang without thought or comprehension - Lead , kindly Light , amid the encircling gloom , Lead Thou [me]146-mr. oak on . [Bathsheba]410-bathsheba 's feeling was always to some extent de- pendent upon [her]410-bathsheba whim , as is the case with [many other women]6151-many other women . Something big came into [her]410-bathsheba throat and an uprising to [her]410-bathsheba eyes - and [she]410-bathsheba thought that [she]410-bathsheba would allow the imminent tears to flow if [they]1098-the children wished . [They]1098-the children did flow and plenteously , and one fell upon the stone bench beside [her]410-bathsheba . Once that [she]410-bathsheba had begun to cry for [she]410-bathsheba hardly knew what , [she]410-bathsheba could not leave off for crowd- ing thoughts [she]410-bathsheba knew too well . [She]410-bathsheba would have given anything in [the world]447-the world to be , as [those children]6153-those children were , un- concerned at the meaning of [their]6153-those children words , because too innocent to feel the necessity for any such expression . All the impassioned scenes of [her]410-bathsheba brief expenence seemed to revive with added emotion at that moment , and those scenes which had been without emotion during enactment had emotion then . Yet grief came to [her]410-bathsheba rather as a luxury than as the scourge of former times . Owing to [Bathsheba]410-bathsheba 's face being buried in [her]410-bathsheba hands [she]410-bathsheba did not notice a form which came quietly into [the porch]4287-the porch , and on seeing [her]410-bathsheba , first moved as if to retreat , then paused and regarded [her]410-bathsheba . [Bathsheba]410-bathsheba did not raise [her]410-bathsheba head for some time , and when [she]410-bathsheba looked round [her]410-bathsheba face was wet , and [her]410-bathsheba eyes drowned and dim . "[146-mr. oak] [Mr. Oak]146-mr. oak . " exclaimed [she]410-bathsheba , disconcerted , "[146-mr. oak] how long have [you]146-mr. oak been [here]575-here ? " "[0-i] A few minutes , [ma'am]712-ma'am . " said [Oak]146-mr. oak , respectfully . "[0-i] Are [you]146-mr. oak going in ? " said [Bathsheba]410-bathsheba ; and there came from within [the church]489-the church as from [a prompter]6156-a prompter - l loved the garish day , and , spite of fears , pride ruled [my]0-i will : remember not past years . "[0-i] [I]0-i was . " said [Gabriel]144-gabriel . "[1098-the children] [I]0-i am one of [the bass singers]3371-the bass singers , [you]146-mr. oak know . [I]0-i have sung bass for several months . " Indeed : [I]3373-i was n't aware of that . [I]3373-i 'll leave [you]146-mr. oak , then . "[3373-i] which [I]0-i have loved long since , and lost awhile , sang [the children]1098-the children . Then [they]6158-they stood in a state of some embarrassment [Bathsheba]410-bathsheba trying to wipe [her]410-bathsheba dreadfully drenched and inflamed face without [his]3373-i noticing [her]410-bathsheba . At length [Oak]144-gabriel said , [I]3374-i 've not seen [you]146-mr. oak - [i]3374-i mean spoken to [you]146-mr. oak - since ever so long , have [I]3374-i ? "[3374-i] But [he]3373-i feared to bring distress- ing memories back , and interrupted [himself]3373-i with : " Were [you]146-mr. oak going into [church]424-church ? "[146-mr. oak] " No . " So together [they]3376-our went and read [the tomb]5580-the tomb . "[146-mr. oak] Eight months ago ! " [Gabriel]144-gabriel murmured when [he]144-gabriel saw the date . "[146-mr. oak] It seems like yesterday to [me]0-i . " And to [me]146-mr. oak as if it were years ago - long years , and [I]146-mr. oak had been dead between . And now [I]146-mr. oak am going [home]556-home , [Mr. Oak]146-mr. oak . "[146-mr. oak] [Oak]146-mr. oak walked after [her]3377-i . "[0-i] It is that [I]0-i may soon have to give up the manage- ment of [[your]3377-i farm]3378-your farm , [Mrs. Troy]353-troy . " [she]353-troy said , in surprise and genuine disappointment . "[0-i] Why , [Gabriel]144-gabriel , what are [you]144-gabriel going to do that for ? " "[0-i] Well , [I]0-i 've thought it best . " [Oak]144-gabriel stammered out . "[144-gabriel] [California]139-california is the spot [I]0-i 've had in [my]0-i mind to try . Oh , [Gabriel]144-gabriel , [I]0-i do n't think [you]144-gabriel ought to go away . [You]144-gabriel 've been with [me]0-i so long - through bright times and dark times - [such old friends that as [we]3383-we are]3382-such old friends that as we are - that it seems unkind almost . And now going away ! " "[144-gabriel] [I]0-i would have willingly . " "[144-gabriel] Yet now that [I]0-i am more helpless than ever [you]144-gabriel go away ! " "[146-mr. oak] Yes , that 's the ill fortune o ' it . " said [Gabriel]144-gabriel , in a distressed tone . "[146-mr. oak] And it is because of that very help- lessness that [I]0-i feel bound to go . Good afternoon , [ma'am]712-ma'am " [he]144-gabriel concluded , in evident anxiety to get away , and at once went out of [the churchyard]3813-the churchyard by a path [she]712-ma'am could follow on no pretence whatever . [Bathsheba]410-bathsheba went [home]556-home , [her]410-bathsheba mind occupied with a new trouble , which being rather harassing than deadly was calculated to do good by diverting [her]410-bathsheba from the chronic gloom of [her]410-bathsheba life . [She]410-bathsheba was set thinking a great deal about [Oak]144-gabriel and of [his]144-gabriel which to shun [her]410-bathsheba ; and there occurred to [Bathsheba]410-bathsheba several incidents of latter in- tercourse with [him]144-gabriel , which , trivial when singly viewed amounted together to a perceptible disinclination for [her]410-bathsheba society . It broke upon [her]410-bathsheba at length as a great pain that [[her]410-bathsheba last old disciple]6164-her last old disciple was about to forsake [her]410-bathsheba and flee . [He]144-gabriel who had believed in [her]410-bathsheba and argued on [her]410-bathsheba side when all the rest of [the world]447-the world was against [her]410-bathsheba , had at last like the others become weary and neglectful of the old cause , and was leaving [her]410-bathsheba to fight [her]410-bathsheba battles alone . Three weeks went on , and more evidence of [his]144-gabriel want of interest in [her]410-bathsheba was forthcoming . [She]410-bathsheba noticed that instead of entering [the small parlour or office where the farm accounts were kept]6166-the small parlour or office where the farm accounts were kept , and waiting , or leaving a memorandum as [he]144-gabriel had hitherto done during [her]410-bathsheba seclusion , [Oak]144-gabriel never came at all when [she]410-bathsheba was likely to be [there]3509-there , only entering at unseasonable hours when [her]410-bathsheba presence in that part of [the house]552-the house was least to be expected . Whenever [he]144-gabriel wanted directions [he]144-gabriel sent a message , or note with neither heading nor signature , to which [she]410-bathsheba was obliged to reply in the same off - hand style . [Poor Bathsheba]410-bathsheba began to suffer now from the most torturing sting of ali - a sensation that [she]410-bathsheba was despised . The autumn wore away gloomily enough amid these melancholy conjectures , and Christmas - day came , com- pleting a year of [her]410-bathsheba legal widowhood , and two years and a quarter of [her]410-bathsheba life alone . On examining [her]410-bathsheba heart it appeared beyond measure strange that the sub- ject of which the season might have been supposed suggestive - the event in [the hall at [Boldwood]410-bathsheba 's]6169-the hall at boldwood 's - was not agitating [her]410-bathsheba at all ; but instead , an agonizing con- viction that [everybody]954-everybody abjured [her]410-bathsheba - for what [she]410-bathsheba could not tell - and that [Oak]144-gabriel was [the ringleader of the recusants]6171-the ringleader of the recusants . Coming out of [church]424-church that day [she]410-bathsheba looked round in hope that [Oak]144-gabriel , whose bass voice [she]410-bathsheba had heard rolling out from [the gallery]1755-the gallery overhead in a most unconcerned manner , might chance to linger in [her]410-bathsheba path in the old way . There [he]144-gabriel was , as usual , coming down the path behind [her]410-bathsheba . But on seeing [Bathsheba]410-bathsheba turn , [he]144-gabriel looked aside , and as soon as [he]144-gabriel got beyond the gate , and there was the barest excuse for a divergence , [he]144-gabriel made one , and vanished . The next morning brought the culminating stroke ; [she]410-bathsheba had been expecting it long . It was a formal notice by letter from [him]144-gabriel that [he]144-gabriel should not renew [his]144-gabriel engage- ment with [her]410-bathsheba for the following Lady - day . [Bathsheba]410-bathsheba actually sat and cried over this letter most bitterly . [She]410-bathsheba was aggrieved and wounded that the possession of hopeless love from [Gabriel]144-gabriel , which [she]410-bathsheba had AFTER ALL grown to regard as [her]410-bathsheba inalienable right for life , should have been withdrawn just at [his]144-gabriel own pleasure in this way . [She]410-bathsheba was bewildered too by the prospect of having to rely on [her]410-bathsheba own resources again : it seemed to [herself]410-bathsheba that [she]410-bathsheba never could again acquire energy sufficient to go to market , barter , and sell . Since [Troy]353-troy 's death [Oak]144-gabriel had attended all sales and fairs for [her]410-bathsheba , transacting [her]410-bathsheba business at the same time with [his]144-gabriel own . What should [she]410-bathsheba do now ? [Her]410-bathsheba life was becoming a desolation . So desolate was [Bathsheba]410-bathsheba this evening , that in an absolute hunger for pity and sympathy , and miserable in that [she]410-bathsheba appeared to have outlived [the only true friend- ship [she]410-bathsheba had ever owned]6174-the only true friend- ship she had ever owned , [she]410-bathsheba put on [her]410-bathsheba bonnet and cloak and went down to [[Oak]144-gabriel 's house]6175-oak 's house just after sunset , guided on [her]410-bathsheba way by the pale primrose rays of a crescent moon a few days old . A lively firelight shone from the window , but [nobody]439-nobody was visible in [the room]4025-the room . [She]410-bathsheba tapped nervously , and then thought it doubtful if it were right for [a single woman]6178-a single woman to call upon [a bachelor who lived alone]6179-a bachelor who lived alone , although [he]6179-a bachelor who lived alone was [[her]410-bathsheba manager]6180-her manager , and [she]410-bathsheba might be supposed to call on business without any real impropriety . [Gabriel]144-gabriel opened the door , and the moon shone upon [his]144-gabriel fore- haad . "[146-mr. oak] [Mr. Oak]146-mr. oak . " said [Bathsheba]410-bathsheba , faintly . "[0-i] Yes ; [I]0-i am [Mr. Oak]146-mr. oak . " said [Gabriel]144-gabriel . "[144-gabriel] Who have [I]0-i the honour - O how stupid of [me]0-i , not to know [you]3387-you , [mistress]996-mistress ! " "[0-i] [I]0-i shall not be [[your]0-i mistress]2139-your mistress much longer , shall [I]0-i [Gabriel]144-gabriel ? " [she]0-i said , in pathetic tones . "[0-i] Well , no . [I]0-i suppose - But come in , [ma'am]712-ma'am . Oh - and [I]0-i 'll get a light . " [Oak]144-gabriel replied , with some awkwardness . "[0-i] No ; not on [my]0-i account . " "[0-i] It is so seldom that [I]0-i get [a lady visitor]3391-a lady visitor that [I]0-i 'm afraid [I]0-i have n't proper accommodation . Will [you]3387-you sit down , please ? Here 's a chair , and there 's one , too . [I]0-i am sorry that [my]0-i chairs all have wood seats , and are rather hard , but [I]0-i was thinking of getting some new ones . " [Oak]144-gabriel placed two or three for [her]0-i . "[0-i] They are quite easy enough for [me]0-i . " So down [she]0-i sat , and down sat [he]144-gabriel , the fire dancing in [their]6181-their faces , and upon the old furniture all a - sheenen Wi ' long years o ' handlen , that formed [Oak]144-gabriel 's array of household possessions , which sent back a dancing reflection in reply . It was very odd to [these two persons]6182-these two persons , who knew [each other]3826-each other passing well , that the mere circumstance of [their]6181-their meeting in [a new place]6184-a new place and in a new way should make [them]6181-their so awkward and constrained . In [the fields]527-the fields , or at [[her]0-i house]4457-her house , there had never been any embarrassment ; but now that [Oak]144-gabriel had become [the entertainer]6187-the entertainer [their]6181-their lives seemed to be moved back again to the days when [they]6181-their were [strangers]4098-strangers . "[0-i] [You]3392-you 'll think it strange that [I]0-i have come , but - " "[0-i] O no ; not at all . " "[0-i] But [I]0-i thought - [Gabriel]144-gabriel , [I]0-i have been uneasy in the belief that [I]0-i have offended [you]144-gabriel , and that [you]144-gabriel are going away on that account . "[144-gabriel] " And quite right too . "[410-bathsheba] said [Oak]144-gabriel . " [I]144-gabriel 've danced at [your]410-bathsheba skittish heels , [my]144-gabriel beautiful [Bathsheba]410-bathsheba , for many a long mile , and many a long day ; and it is hard to be- grudge [me]144-gabriel this one visit . "[144-gabriel] [He]144-gabriel accompanied [her]410-bathsheba up [the hill]3452-the hill , explaining to [her]410-bathsheba the details of [his]144-gabriel forthcoming tenure of [the other farm]3384-the other farm . [They]3405-their spoke very little of [their]3405-their mutual feeling ; pretty phrases and warm expressions being probably un- necessary between [such tried friends]3408-such tried friends . [Theirs]3409-theirs was that substantial affection which arises if any arises at all when [the two who are thrown together]3410-the two who are thrown together begin first by knowing the rougher sides of each other 's character , and not the best till further on , the romance growing up in the interstices of a mass of hard prosaic reality . This good - fellowship - CAMARADERIE - usually occurring through similarity of pursuits , is unfortunately seldom superadded to love between the sexes , because [men]474-men and [women]493-women associate , not in [their]3405-their labours , but in [their]3405-their pleasures merely . Where , however , happy circumstance permits its development , the compounded feeling proves itself to be the only love which is strong as death - that love which many waters can not quench , nor the floods drown , beside which the passion usually called by the name is evanescent as steam . CHAPTER LVII A FOGGY NIGHT AND MORNING - CONCLUSION " THE most private , secret , plainest wedding that it is possible to have . "[144-gabriel] Those had been [Bathsheba]410-bathsheba 's words to [Oak]144-gabriel one evening , some time after the event of the preceding chapter , and [he]144-gabriel meditated a full hour by the clock upon how to carry out [her]410-bathsheba wishes to the letter . " A licence - O yes , it must be a licence . "[144-gabriel] [he]144-gabriel said to [himself]144-gabriel at last . " Very well , then ; first , a license . "[144-gabriel] On a dark night , a few days later , [Oak]144-gabriel came with mysterious steps from [the surrogate]2084-the surrogate 's door , in [Caster- bridge]34-caster- bridge . On the way [home]556-home [he]144-gabriel heard a heavy tread in front of [him]144-gabriel , and , overtaking [the man]726-the man , found [him]726-the man to be [Coggan]180-coggan . [They]3410-the two who are thrown together walked together into [the village]3754-the village until [they]3410-the two who are thrown together came to [a little lane behind [the church]489-the church]3417-a little lane behind the church , leading down to [the cottage of [Laban Tall]213-laban , who had lately been installed as clerk of [the parish]422-the parish]3419-the cottage of laban tall , who had lately been installed as clerk of the parish , and was yet in mortal terror at [church]424-church on Sundays when [he]213-laban heard [his]213-laban lone voice among certain hard words of the Psalms , whither [no man]3662-no man ventured to follow [him]213-laban . " Well , good - night , [Coggan]180-coggan . "[180-coggan] said [Oak]144-gabriel , " [I]180-coggan 'm going down this way . "[180-coggan] " Oh ! "[144-gabriel] said [Coggan]180-coggan , surprised ; " what 's going on to- night then , make so bold [Mr. Oak]146-mr. oak ? "[144-gabriel] It seemed rather ungenerous not to tell [Coggan]180-coggan , under the circumstances , for [Coggan]180-coggan had been true as steel all through the time of [Gabriel]144-gabriel 's unhappiness about [Bathsheba]410-bathsheba , and [Gabriel]144-gabriel said , " [You]180-coggan can keep a secret , [Coggan]180-coggan ? "[180-coggan] " [You]180-coggan 've proved [me]144-gabriel , and [you]180-coggan know . "[144-gabriel] " Yes , [I]144-gabriel have , and [I]144-gabriel do know . "[144-gabriel] " Ay , [I]180-coggan see : quite right , too , [I]180-coggan suppose [I]180-coggan must say . And [you]180-coggan be now going down to [the clerk]905-the clerk . " [[Labe Tall]411-labe tall 's [old woman]6203-old woman]6202-labe tall 's old woman will horn it all over [parish]36-parish in half - an - hour . "[191-liddy] [CONCLUSION Bathsheba]243-bathsheba , however , awoke voluntarily at four , nor could [she]410-bathsheba by any contrivance get to sleep again . About six , being quite positive that [her]410-bathsheba watch had stopped during the night , [she]410-bathsheba could wait no longer . " said [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba . "[0-i] However , there 's no getting out of it now ! " It was a damp disagreeable morning . Nevertheless , at twenty minutes to ten o'clock , [Oak]143-farmer oak came out of [[his]143-farmer oak house]637-his house , and Went up [the hill side]6221-the hill side With that sort of stride [A man]3474-a man puts out when walking in search of [a bride]6223-a bride , and knocked [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's door . Ten minutes later a large and a smaller umbrella might have been seen moving from the same door , and through the mist along [the road]477-the road to [the church]489-the church . The distance was not more than a quarter of a mile , and [these two sensible persons]6226-these two sensible persons deemed it unnecessary to drive . [An observer]6227-an observer must have been very close indeed to discover that the forms under the umbrellas were those of [Oak]143-farmer oak and [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba , arm - in- arm for the first time in [their]6226-these two sensible persons lives , [Oak]143-farmer oak in a greatcoat extending to [his]143-farmer oak knees , and [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba in a cloak that reached [her]0-i clogs . Yet , though so plainly dressed there was a certain rejuvenated appearance about [her]0-i : - As though a rose should shut and be a bud again . [Repose]414-repose had again incarnadined [her]0-i cheeks ; and having , at [Gabriel]144-gabriel 's request , arranged [her]0-i hair this morning as [she]0-i had worn it years ago on [Norcombe Hill]1-norcombe hill , [she]0-i seemed in [his]144-gabriel eyes remarkably like [a girl of that fascinating dream]6228-a girl of that fascinating dream , which , considering that [she]0-i was now only three or four - and - twenty , was perhaps not very wonderful . In [the church]489-the church were [Tall , Liddy]191-liddy , and [the parson]2007-the parson , and in a remarkably short space of time the deed was done . [The two]3493-the two sat down very quietly to tea in [[Bathsheba]243-bathsheba 's parlour]6232-bathsheba 's parlour in the evening of the same day , for it had been arranged that [Farmer Oak]143-farmer oak should go [there]3509-there to live , since [he]143-farmer oak had as yet neither money , [house]4510-house , nor furniture worthy of the name , though [he]143-farmer oak was on a sure way towards [them]3493-the two , whilst [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba was , comparatively , in a plethora of all three . Just as [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba was pouring out a cup of tea , [their]3493-the two ears were greeted by the firing of a cannon , followed by what seemed like a tremendous blowing of trumpets , in the front of [the house]552-the house . "[3436-those fellows] There ! " said [Oak]143-farmer oak , laughing , "[3436-those fellows] [I]0-i knew [those fellows]3436-those fellows were up to something , by the look on [their]3436-those fellows face ; " [Oak]143-farmer oak took up the light and went into [the porch]4287-the porch , followed by [Bathsheba]243-bathsheba with a shawl over [her]6237-her head . " and at the same moment bang again went the cannon in the background , followed by a hideous clang of music from a drum , tambourine , clarionet , serpent , hautboy , tenor- viol , and double - bass - the only remaining relics of [the true and original Weatherbury band]6241-the true and original weatherbury band]6238-a group of male figures gathered upon the gravel in front , who , when they saw the newly - married couple in the porch , set up a loud " hurrah ! " "[6245-the man hev learnt to say " my wife] Faith . "[187-jacob] said [Jacob Smallbury]187-jacob . " It might have been a little more true to nater if't had been spoke a little chillier , but that was n't to be expected just now . "[0-i] That improvement will come wi ' time . " said [Jan]180-coggan , twirling [his]180-coggan eye . "[416-hosea] Yes ; [I]0-i suppose that 's the size o't .
